story:
It's Beginning to Look A Lot Like Christmas.


Remember last year's Christmas card? The joy upon receiving that little white envelope then the growing horror as you slid it out of the envelope, only to find gold glitter was now forever embedded in your carpet? 

But the joy! The joy of dick baby Jesus! Those fluffy-butted dick sheep! It more than made up for the glitter. Mostly.

Experience the joy again, or for the first time, in 2015.

Buy My Christmas Card, Suckers!


You may notice that there are a few different options. This is because I'm way too nice. You can do the regular Christmas card, sure, but now you can be SUPER COOL by ordering a pack of 5 or 10 to mail to your friends. Or people you want to be your friends. Or people you want to ensure will never consider being your friends again. 


Why Am I Asking For Money This Year and Not Sending Cards Invested With (Free) Christmas Spirit? 


Last year was expensive and now I'm unemployed. Also, outlining 113 vaginal holy stars with glue and gold glitter, letting the glitter dry, and personalizing each card took two full weekends. I want a life. Or get a little bit of cash for not having one.


Oh god, someone hire me. I'm so alone.

story:
No)one. Art House  is an organization geared toward producing and curating approachable and stimulating art. We seek to remove the barriers of codified aesthetics in specific art disciplines to inform and allow viewers to eclipse preconceived expectations of what art can be. 

We have been active in the Los Angeles community since April 2014. Since our inception, the goal has been to educate LA audiences and broaden their awareness of movement based art. The Art House has hosted workshops with some of the leading dancers and choreographers in the field, taught lecture demonstrations throughout the Greater Los Angeles Area, and produced numerous exhibitions and performances to packed houses.

To continue making an impact on the arts culture in Los Angeles, WE NEED YOUR HELP! Your generosity will DIRECTLY SUPPORT the numerous initiatives No)one. Art House has in store for 2016.

2016 Initiatives:

EDUCATION PROGAMS--

No)one. Art House puts on about 1-3 contemporary dance workshops every month. The artists that come to share their art with us are from some of the leading dance companies in the world; Netherlands Dance Theater 1, Batsheva Dance Company, Kidd Pivot. We also host a week long intensive in the summer with classes including Injury Prevention, Arts Administration, Dance on Film, and Nutrition. Other educational endeavors the Art House participates in are performances and lecture demonstrations for elementary, middle, and high schools throughout Los Angeles. Past schools include Hamilton High School, Los Angeles County High School for the Arts, New World Charter School.

PERFORMANCE SEASON--

No)one. Art House will produce 3 performances in 2016. These performances will be created with outside choreographers and art makers, as well as from in house. These creations take much planning and ingenuity to come to fruition. Hours of rehearsal, promotion, venue scouting, and documentation all play an integral role in this process. We intend to compensate collaborators appropriately for their work and talent. 

CHOREOGRAPHIC RESIDENCY--

No)one. Art House has newly curated a call for submissions from choreographer's to present their work on the Art House for a 3 week period.  During this time, the selected choreographer's will be able to have free studio space, access to world class dancer's, and the opportunity to have their work presented to LA audiences. The Art House will also be offering housing and transportation during this residency.

BUDGET--

Our estimated budget for these endeavors are as followed.

Education Programs/$6500

Performance Season/$7500

Choreographic Residency/$4000

No)one. Art House is fiscally sponsored by the Dance Resource Center. Your donation can be TAX DEDUCTIBLE by donating any sized amount here. https://drc.nationbuilder.com/no_one_arthouse

THANK YOU FOR TAKING THE TIME OUT TO READ THIS AND WE HOPE YOU WILL SUPPORT OUR EFFORTS TO KEEP QUALITY ART ALIVE IN LOS ANGELES!

story:
'Ultimately, we envisage a society where the quill or the sketchbook holds as much sexual potency as the electric guitar; where the illustrator or poet is as much of a sex symbol as the rock star.'

Hi, I'm Tim Grayson. I'm currently the poet-in residence at Belvoir Castle, England. Back in 2011, Steven Silverman (nom de plume of Stephen Thomas) and I wrote an arts manifesto in an attempt to identify a growing literary & artistic counter-movement ('Brothelliana') which was rising to challenge the prevailing influences of post-modernism and its contemporary derivatives. We called it the 'Brothellian Manifesto'.

Inside, we drew on our experiences of hosting alternative interdisciplinary arts events  (including 'Poetry Brothels' and 'Carnivals of Artisans'), as well as our own trials and tribulations as independent artists, to offer advice, encouragement and the 'tools' for anybody (especially those who feels distanced from the prevailing order in the arts) to pursue and achieve their creative ambitions.

Project Summary

With the Brothellian movement growing larger every day and a successful crowdfunding bid (with thanks to indiegogo for the platform), we're going to be building upon this momentum to create a 'deluxe edition' of the Brothellian Manifesto, which will include a fully updated version of the Brothellian Manifesto for 2015/16, a walk-through guide to instruct anyone on how to host a Brothellian event themselves (using the Poetry Brothel, Carnival of Artisans and 'House of Verse' as case studies), explanatory articles, scans of old [but important] notes AND a selection of the very best work from members and supporters of the Brothellian movement.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Deluxe edition (overall cost): £500 (production, chapter heading motifs, revision & editing, misc. materials, proof copies inc. postage from USA).

The main reason for starting this crowd-funding bid was to give our members and supporters the opportunity to be an integral part of our central document from the ground up.

Now, as we were successful with our bid, we're keeping this page open for anyone who'd like to pre-order a copy of the manifesto.

Stretch goals

£1000 - CD inc. audio-book, music, misc. performances, speeches, etc.

£1500 - DVD inc. audio-visual production of the full Brothellian manifesto, event walk-throughs, short films, music videos, behind-the-scenes, etc.

Our stretch targets will enable us to include audio and visual extras on CDs and DVDs which we will package together with the manifesto in a special edition deluxe pack.

How can I join?

Everyone's welcome to join the Brothellian movement long as they believe in these core principles (which are explored further in the Brothellian Manifesto):

1. Valuing our artistic communities
2.Respecting our audiences
3.Presenting our work in an irresistible way
4.Restoring humanity in the digital age
5.Being fearless in our proactive attitude
6.Never compromising our artistic integrity
7.Striving towards the development of our Craft, Talent and Imagination

How else can I help?

If you like what we're trying to achieve here but can't contribute financially, please still try and get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! It all helps, and the person who makes the loudest noise via social media will be given a special additional mention! Don't forget to tag @timothy_grayson on Twitter!

Photographs of Brothellian events 2009-2015

Quotes

'A "Brothellian Movement" has been growing apace in recent times, quickly spreading across America and Europe.  The point is to sex [the arts] back up so that [they] resemble the status [they] held in the Romantic Age.'
The Independent.

'In the candleflickered parlour
Were eleven seated maidens
Each as elegant as poetry
As beautiful as rhyme
One by one they'd sit beside me
Unfold paper, read a poem,
This one wants to be a cut-throat,
That one warns me of bananas
Whispered lust in lost iambics...
Then I'd tuck eleven dollars
In each hand.'
Neil Gaiman

TRADUCTION FRANÇAIS ICI !!!

Cliquez sur "Traduction Française ici" pour accéder à la page Française

To continue to help financially, you could donate directly to my paypal.

Click HERE To Donate

Paypal Address: Octaproduction@gmail.com



Hi everyone !

Let me introduce myself, my name is Emric L’huillier better known as  « Sian », my artist name. I’m 20 years old and I’m from France.

I started my first musical project two years ago under the name of Skynoize. It lasted for about a year, then I decided to make a fresh start on my own, with a new name but also with a very ambitious project.

I am very passionate about art in general, very open minded and interested in experimenting with new things. I am autodidactic in drawing, digital painting, musical production, piano, drums and singing.

Sian is a very complex and wide project that has goals to create a story that evolves everyday through new visual and musical creations. Sian takes place in a fairy world and is filled with mysterious adventures.

The main hero is an elf who comes from another world mysteriously connected to Earth, its name is Sian. Magic appears on earth after the destruction of our society and leads to a spiritual era. Sian and his friend Keyboard Kid find a map that leads them towards dangerous yet thrilling adventures.


You can find the beginning of a story HERE


Most of the personas of this story are retranscriptions of real people who helped me create this project. Keyboard Kid for instance is an artist that you can find here :  Keyboard Kid Soundcloud

Each album, EP and track follows the story in a very original manner. 

The final goal of this project is to propose a Japanese animated series of two seasons consisting of twenty five episodes with a duration of fifty minutes each as well as a video game allowing you to roam across the world of Elsia.



MUSIC


Sian already released a full length album and an EP. The album is free so that you can discover this adventure and its extremely rich and diverse music.

I personally have a lot of fun exploring, experimenting and mixing different styles of electronic music. Still, I am greatly influenced by style that I appreciate such as j-pop, k-culture and EDM. I also use « chiptune » sonorities because my first ideas came from some of my childhood video games.

Here are the links to discover the album as well as the EP :

                                BOAS Album                    -                          Elsia EP


Both, the album and the EP, have been produced this year. I am myself someone who produces extremely fast, regularly releasing rich and complex content.


This year will also see the release of my second Sian album, named Gravitalia. I invite you to discover a little taste of this upcoming album down below-PS : this is work still in progress-



VISUAL


Visually, I started creating the design of my characters from the story in order to give it more depth and perspective.  In the year 2015 there will be a technical and graphic sheet of each persona available on LIENWEBSITE. There will be approximately fifty different characters throughout the entire story.

Here are the first two designs I made as well as the wallpaper of my recent EP Elsia in which you can already find four important characters of the story.


I am also creating the cover of my second album which will reveal three new characters as well as Sian's definitive costume. Here are some basic drawings I’ve been working on :


I also started to design the map of the Elsia world which will be available in 2015 on my WEBSITE, with about twenty other artworks (digital paintings). Here is a little preview :


Sian is extremely important to me, it allows me to channel of my creativity and to create the whole world I’ve been imagining throughout my entire childhood. Sian allows both you and me to travel inside a world full of love and mysterious adventures, and gives me the ability to communicate with my audience, push myself harder everyday and, most importantly, meet extraordinary people.

Sian is my life, I’ve spent a lot of time on it. This is all I have and I’ll do everything I can to keep this adventure going because this is the most concrete thing I have ever done in my life. I believe in the saying  « when you really want something, you can achieve anything you want ».

WHY DID I CREATE THIS FUNDING PROJECT ?


Unfortunately, Sian needs your help in order to continue the adventure.

A year ago I enrolled in a sound engineering school in order to improve my work as well as my musical production techniques. The school tuition was 10,000 Euros for one year. I had no other choice but to take a student loan in order to enroll in the program.

Throughout this formation, I had a lot of personal problems which caused me to miss a few days of school. The school did not allow me to take the final exam due to my absences. The production of my first album was almost done and I had a 4-year contract with a music label between my hands which would have assured me a regular income. 

In order to honor this contract I had to produce  two albums and one EP before the end of the year. The only way I could think of to meet the requirements of this contract was to quit the school I was in, which in the end was useless.

A few days later, I heard the « good news» that my contract was cancelled for a reason that still remains very fuzzy ; thus, I found myself dropped out of a 10,000 Euros program, no contract and a loan of 10,000 Euros to give back.

The reimbursement of the loan will start January 2015 and I still haven’t found anywhere to perform in shows or any sort of income.

Right now, I have two choices :

- Stop the Sian project and look for a job. 

(a job on top of the Sian project would not be possible due to the Sian project being very time consuming)

-Ask you for donations in order to pay back my loan and keep the Sian project going.

This funding project will allow me to buy some professional equipment necessary for any type of electronic music creation. It would also help me improve the quality of my tracks, thus have more opportunities to get a contract with a label.


Equipment includes:


- 2x Yamaha HS 8 ( Enceinte de monitoring) - 550 €

- 1x Nektar Panorama P6 - 425 €

- 1x Native Instrument - Razor VST 99 €



WHY DID I CHOOSE THE FLEXIBLE FINANCING ?


The amount indicated is the amount needed to pay back the entirety of the loan. Even if I do not achieve that goal, the money I do receive will be used to buy myself the equipment and pay back a part of my loan, buying myself time to find ways to make money through performances and get signed to a label.


Time is running out and my ambition is quite big but I am sure that with your support, I will be able to overcome this situation.


If we achieve the total amount, the second album and EP will be free and available to download as a thank you for your support. I will keep you updated via my Facebook page and my website.

If you need any further information please do not hesitate to contact me via my Email address : Octaproduction@gmail.com

Thank you for your time and your support. I Love you All !!! <3

Artwork by : DariaP

story:
THE STORY

In the town of Freakville lies a dark secret. Always caught in the middle of the chaos is Tim and Ed. Tim being the easily frightened, reluctant one, always dragged in by Ed, a brave soul whom always needs to get to the bottom of things. Ranging from the un-dead to the mythical, there's always something stirring up trouble for the two.  In this episode entitled "The Witch Dog" The boys are dared by Ed's older brother Vince to visit the abandoned house down the street said to be haunted by the demon spirit of a witch transformed into a giant ravenous dog. Will they chicken out or become legends in the neighborhood? Your donation can help decide their fate.


WHY TIM&ED

An Episodic animated adventure with art and themes inspired by the Great Tim Burton, classic stop motion films, Gothic animation, and vintage horror. Did I mention it takes place in the 90's?! Bring on the nostalgia!

  • My name is Jeff Hagood and I'm a freelance Video director/editor, graphic designer, photographer and soon to add animation to that set of skills.
  • I was once the kid drawing unfinished comic books and dreaming up action films. I've turned those dreams into aspirations and becoming an animator would be the ultimate fulfillment of those childhood dreams. I'm transforming Tim&Ed from little sketches to an animated series that can hopefully be seen across the world through a digital canvas, your computer screen!
  • The goal for this fundraiser isn't as high as most. Fulfilling this goal will allow me to purchase the computer and software I need to animate the first episode of Tim & Ed titled "The Witch Dog". I had begun this animation journey already but due to misfortune, one of the essential tools needed to create Tim & Ed, my Macbook, died on me. I would be eternally grateful to those whom back this project. You will be helping me fulfill a childhood dream and in return be entertained with an epic tale riddled with horror and mysteries!



How You Can Help Make My Dream A Reality!

  • All donations funded will be directly used to purchase a 2014 iMac 21.5" and the Adobe Production Premium software Suite. The depth of animating and editing I will be doing requires a lot of fire power that only a high end desktop could provide.
  • I've acquired a set of special skills in my time as a student and freelance graphic designer. To those that help fund me I will lend those services to you by creating personalized art giving your choice ranging from digital paintings/ portraits to illustrations or even a cameo in my animation. You can also be credited as producers of the show!


Follow My Journey!

  • I will be keeping everyone posted on my progress on the animation start to finish and maybe even post tutorials for those also interested in pursuing animation.
  • Like me on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/DoomcloudProductions
  • Follow my moments on instagram at: @doomcloud
  • View the journey on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/user/xMJxPRODUCTIONSx 




If You Can't Donate

SPREAD THE WORD!

  • If you can't spare to donate at all it's understandable, but if this project interests you and you still want to see Tim & Ed become a reality share this campaign and spread the word. Who knows? Maybe it will reach the eyes of someone else who is just as passionate about film and animation and would love for this project to see the light of day.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
THE STORY
In the town of Freakville lies a dark secret. Always caught in the middle of the chaos is Tim and Ed. Tim being the easily frightened, reluctant one, always dragged in by Ed, a brave soul whom always needs to get to the bottom of things. Ranging from the un-dead to the mythical, there's always something stirring up trouble for the two.  In this episode entitled "The Witch Dog" The boys are dared by Ed's older brother Vince to visit the abandoned house down the street said to be haunted by the demon spirit of a witch transformed into a giant ravenous dog. Will they chicken out or become legends in the neighborhood? Your donation can help decide their fate.


WHY TIM&ED
 An Episodic animated adventure with art and themes inspired by the Great Tim Burton, classic stop motion films, Gothic animation, and vintage horror. Did I mention it takes place in the 90's?! Bring on the nostalgia!  My name is Jeff Hagood and I'm a freelance Video director/editor, graphic designer, photographer and soon to add animation to that set of skills. I was once the kid drawing unfinished comic books and dreaming up action films. I've turned those dreams into aspirations and becoming an animator would be the ultimate fulfillment of those childhood dreams. I'm transforming Tim&Ed from little sketches to an animated series that can hopefully be seen across the world through a digital canvas, your computer screen! The goal for this fundraiser isn't as high as most. Fulfilling this goal will allow me to purchase the computer and software I need to animate the first episode of Tim & Ed titled "The Witch Dog". I had begun this animation journey already but due to misfortune, one of the essential tools needed to create Tim & Ed, my Macbook, died on me. I would be eternally grateful to those whom back this project. You will be helping me fulfill a childhood dream and in return be entertained with an epic tale riddled with horror and mysteries! 



    How You Can Help Make My Dream A Reality!  All donations funded will be directly used to purchase a 2014 iMac 21.5" and the Adobe Production Premium software Suite. The depth of animating and editing I will be doing requires a lot of fire power that only a high end desktop could provide. I've acquired a set of special skills in my time as a student and freelance graphic designer. To those that help fund me I will lend those services to you by creating personalized art giving your choice ranging from digital paintings/ portraits to illustrations or even a cameo in my animation. You can also be credited as producers of the show! 
   
    Follow My Journey!  I will be keeping everyone posted on my progress on the animation start to finish and maybe even post tutorials for those also interested in pursuing animation. Like me on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/DoomcloudProductions

Follow my moments on instagram at: @doomcloud
View the journey on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/user/xMJxPRODUCTIONSx  





   If You Can't Donate SPREAD THE WORD!  If you can't spare to donate at all it's understandable, but if this project interests you and you still want to see Tim & Ed become a reality share this campaign and spread the word. Who knows? Maybe it will reach the eyes of someone else who is just as passionate about film and animation and would love for this project to see the light of day. Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story: Hi! My name is Robin Veerkamp. I am starting this campaign in order to get the funds to start my own gallery. I need the funds to rent a space, afford matting and framing and to have supplies so that I can teach and educate young and older alike about drawing and nature. I want to be able to sell my artwork and teach everyone interested about the importance and fun in nature sketching and drawing. It would allow me to focus on my passion for art and nature and share it with others. Thanks for all your help.
story_txt: Hi! My name is Robin Veerkamp. I am starting this campaign in order to get the funds to start my own gallery. I need the funds to rent a space, afford matting and framing and to have supplies so that I can teach and educate young and older alike about drawing and nature. I want to be able to sell my artwork and teach everyone interested about the importance and fun in nature sketching and drawing. It would allow me to focus on my passion for art and nature and share it with others. Thanks for all your help.

story:
Since I was a kid, I've always been drawing and experimenting with paints to create my own characters, stories or sketching what I see around me. 

 I've recently changed from traditional art to Digital and after trying a small basic Wacom Bamboo tablet, I thought I'd be able to push my skills further with a Wacom Cintiq and open up a whole other world of variety.

Any and all donations are most welcome and I thank you for all your help! 

Here are some recent examples of my work using a Basic Wacom tablet. I could only imagine what I'm capable of using a professional Cintiq!

I could only imagine what I'm capable of using a professional Cintiq!

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Jay CEO of the SupaFi64 Network and we are here to make artists dreams come true! We started a few years ago as just a Live online show talking about Nerd News. Now we have multiple shows under one roof talking about nerd and music topics but also promoting indy artists of all kind: Video Game Developers, Authors, Music Artists, Comic Book Creators, Drawing and Digital Artists as well, and everything in between! 

Imagine having a place in the world where if you create your artistic dream and want to get it out to the public all you have to do is contact us and come on our show. Thats what we are aiming for and thats what we can achieve with your help!

We would like to raise enough money to have a BOOTH at Awesome Con this year so we can get the word out that we are here to promote artists of all kind and their work!

By helping us get to Awesome Con you are ensuring that indy, creative and original art makes its way to the forefront of entertainment. This is the start of making sure that we become a society that promotes following your dreams! Who knows? By helping us now, maybe one day we will be promoting YOUR DREAM! 

Are We There Yet?

The grand total of the amount we need is: $4,800

Did YOU know a booth at Awesome Con costs $1,000? Well I sure didn’t which is why the first thing we will be doing after reaching $1,000 is securing a booth so that you can see our beautiful face while we are there! On top of that I would like to get the full promotional package that Awesome Con offers us which will gives us a 10x10 Corner booth, 4 exhibitor badges, one 1/2 page color ad in the show program, one full length company sign, and we can give them 15,000 postcard inserts for all of Awesome Con’s swag bags. All together this full package will cost us $1,700. If you guys are going to help to get us here then we are going the make sure the ENTIRE CON knows we’re there!

We will be using the next $800 for our own promotional material to put up around our booth which include: A banner with our name on it, Posters to promote us being there, Flyers and handouts for you guys to take with you when you see us there, business cards for you to take with you if you want to get involved with the show, and a Bose speaker system so that you can hear us and our Music Artists that we promote when you come to our booth. 

Unfortunately the wonderful package that Awesome con gives does NOT include electricity or wifi and we will have to pay for someone to come out and hook that up ourselves. We are devoting $500 to making sure all of our equipment doesn’t run out of juice for you guys, so the last person that comes up to our booth gets the SAME experience as the first!

We will be creating our OWN SWAG just for you guys! part of our giveaway during this fundraiser will be everyone getting a chance to have their own T-SHIRT and tons of other crazy mystery prizes with the SupaFi64 name and Logo printed across! We will be devoting $800 to making sure this happens. AND to make sure you get the biggest and baddest SWAG any company has ever given away! 

Like a T-shirt with this Swag-tastic Power Ranger Logo on it: 

The remaining $1,000 will be used for hotel stay as some of us are coming a long way to be at the Con. We also will have LOTS of Swag AND Artist materials to give out while we are there, and we want to make sure we don’t leave ANY of that stuff behind, and even if we do, this way we will not have very far to go to get it back! 

If we don't get to reach our goal then the money that has already been paid will go to securing the booth and making sure that you see our Beautiful faces at the Con! 

Why It Matters

We believe that we are the future of what Artist promotion should be and look like. We hope to one day not charge artists at all and get our money elsewhere so that we can fully promote artists without them having to worry about paying us! Until then we will go the extra mile with what they give us to ensure we make as many people interested in their work as possible! 

If you’ve ever seen the show TRL on MTV then you know what they were able to do for a lot of the music artists in the 90’s. We hope to be the same platform, not just for music but for all forms of artistry. We wish to bridge the language gap as well to show people that art lives on every continent and not just on the one where you speak the same language. 

Since our show started a couple of years ago we have received positive feedback from many different people! We were even able to get Eddie Mclintock Star of the television show Warehouse 13 to shout us out in a video:


(Eddie Mcclintock is in NO WAY associated with our campaign or IndieGoGo account but we do Thank Him for shouting us out at Dragon Con)

The Unfortunate Struggle

The truth is that not too many people in the world agree with our vision of how we wish to promote artists around the world. Many companies are already spending a lot of their time taking artists money and not giving them what they truly owe them. The only reason people go along with this method is because its something that has been done for years and it has been proven successful in the past. Well we are here to show you theres more then one way to reach your goal. 

As someone who has been driven by the arts since I was in junior high I feel as though allowing an artist to be an artist instead of trying to teach them how to be like others is something we are not known for doing lately. Its difficult for most people to get behind a business like this when they’ve never seen it done like this before. 

We can do this with your help! I plan to create Full Network talking about popular Nerd media and music. We also would like to give up and coming artists of all kind a platform to not only express their opinion of Nerd media but also share who they are and what makes them different then the main stream artists that are out there right now. 

The first step is to get the word out that we exist, and we do that by showing up on grand stages like Awesome Con and showing people that indy art is here to stay! We will be spending our entire time telling people about our dream, how they can help, and promoting all of the artists that help us make it there!


More Ways To Support!

Don’t worry everyone! If you just don’t have the money right now but you still believe in our cause then there are TONS of ways that you can help us! 

#1 You can let any artist OR anyone that you think shares the same dream that we do know about this campaign and put this on their Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, etc. We want the world to know what we’re doing right now! Don’t forget to use the IndieGoGo sharing tools to easily share this on all social media accounts! 

#2 You can go to our network and start watching and interacting with all of our shows! SupaFi64.com for the full list of shows and where you can find them! 

#3 If you are an artist of any kind that doesn’t have the money to be featured at Awesome Con when we go you can come on our show and let us promote you there! We will do a full length interview with you talking about your artistry which you can share with your fans! 

There are many ways to keep this dream alive! We just have to want true art to make it to the forefront of our society and not believe the industries that tell us this isn’t possible without them taking all of your money. We can do this together! 

We can't wait to see you there! Don't forget to show up at our booth within the First Hour to start the Big Give Away for an AWESOME sized prize!

story:
QUICK OVERVIEW

This campaign is to collect founds for printing basic amount of Magic:The Gathering Posters . What is included in this goal amount it is printing costs of 5 different posters x 200 pieces each + tubes for packaging +shipping worldwide. Everything else is extra struff Im giving as  awards for Your contributions. If this campaign is successfull:

I GET:
- regular Magic:The Gathering Prints Shop open which may produce some extra income to my family budget ,if so I will lose some freelance work and have more time to my kids Franky and Sophie.
- more space to my studio  which been cluttered  with free stuff (MTG cards mostly)  from Wizards of the Coast  regulary .

YOU GET:
option A - You are MTG fan already:
                  Really cool and huge poster(s) printed on top quality paper signed by artist himself
                  plus free MTG cards , orginal drawings , proof cards with sketches, other boxed games, or more personal
                  stuff like my tablet etc. Something very unique You can really impress Your friends with.  And all that for
                  price like half  of a regular MTG event's fee.
option B - You are not MTG fan at all or yet- still the posters look awsome and it is perfect for present . All the extra
                 items should be interesting for You too, traveler pack or orginal drawings of mine are not necessarily        
                 related to Magic The Gathering only. Plus , think about all those kids haveing their own orginal MTG Posters
                 Shop  running on regular basis.This a great investment too all those stuff You can sell later

WORLD GETS:
              - Regular Magic: The Gathering Prints Store open 24/7
              - more happy MTG fans
              - wonderfull or even monumental legacy when Im gone.


My Story

Hello everyone! My name is Tomasz Jedruszek aka Morano and I am freelance artist since almost 10 years. For two years I am working with Wizards of the coast creating art to their famous card game Magic the Gathering. Since the begining I have been receiving lots of  response from MTG fans intersted in buying prints and posters versions of the card artwoks I made. Unfortunatelly I had only two opitons ,print them individually agree to poor digital print quality and rising cost per piece to level unacceptable by fans or to print larger amount of posters at once which will be excellent offset print quality but  requires me to put some money out of my pocket at start without guarantee they will sell all. I do not have to tell You I do not have such extra money can be risk, especially as a husband and a father I have to keep my family budget first then think about my fans. Fortunatelly here comes Indiegogo with help.


The Impact

For years I 've been developing myown projects and ideas but because of lack of starting founds I had to keep them in a locker. Now it  a great chance to me to bring them out to the world. Before do that however I would like to try something smaller and Prints Shop seems to be right choice. Lets see how much will You apreciate my artworks and how indiegogo works then I do promise to bring the cool stuff much  more . If we fail to meet the goal money ,well that will be  a lesson to me  and an experience but I believe with Your help ,especially counting on Your commnets/advices here, I will have enough time till the deadline to convince You the project is worth to contribute.


What We Need & What You Get


As I said when talking about posters there is really only one option: to print them in huge amount, once to minimalize costs per piece, twice to get the best quality and offset printing is right there. I need 5000$ to cover the basic print of 5 posters. Why 5 ,well this is the starting point and I wanted You to have at least some of choice if You think that is too much anyways the entire collection of my works made for MTG reaches 50 pieces. So print costs are about 58% the exact number is hard to determinate because all will be paid in polish currency so the final amount is basicly what current USD/PLN rate is. Another 38% are shipping+packaging costs and they also needs to be secured in front mostly because of cartoon tubes for packaging I have to order them in large amount to cut the cost per piece. The rest are Indiegogo fees. The goal money covers first 200 orders in my MTG store and I am talking only about "regular Pack " all the rest is mostly covered from my pocket or those are free stuff I am receiving a lot as a freelance artist from the publisher.I decided to start with 200 pieces because it seems to be the optimal amount, there is no point to print 100 pieces as they cost almost the same amount as 200 ,from the other side just 2000 $ more would do another 200 packages -but I though 7000$ project will be just too much for my Indiegogo debut. If there will be more interest than the goal 5000$ I will be able to prepare more packs for You because printing costs running down with pieces printed rising up plus I should be able to expand the Prints Store by more posters and maybe even T-shirts and other gifts? I  believe You don't have to be Magic the Gathering fan really to find those posters or other uniqe perks offer interesting  so I am really counting on Your support.

DETAILS

There is lots of perks to choose








You will receive all 5 posters in downloadable desktop wallpapers version , digitaly signed.







Small Pack contains 5 postcards version of the illustrations ,signed plus 3 random MTG cards








This Pack contains 5 postcards version of the illustrations all signed plus 3 random MTG cards. Also there is so called "proof card" of  illustration (one of five) ,very rare and printed in limited number card type appreciated amongs MTG cards collectors. Each proof card had limited edition number , first to contribute this perk takes lower(more valuable)  number . This perk covers numbers 13-47








This Pack contains 5 postcards version of the illustrations all signed plus 3 random MTG cards. Also there is so called "proof card" of  illustration (one of five) ,very rare and printed in limited number card type appreciated amongs MTG cards collectors. Each proof card had limited edition number , first to contribute this perk takes lower(more valuable)  number . This perk covers numbers 1-12.







Regular Pack contains B2 (68 x 48 cm or 27x19 inches) 250 gr/sqrm UV potected glossy paper Poster of One of Five illustrations ,signed  plus 3 random MTG cards.









Best Pack contains all 5 posters ,signed plus 3 MTG cards. Even You do not like one or two of the posters it is a great choice because You save a lot on shipping costs while extra posters You didn't like still sounds like cool gift for friends of Yours.









This is extended "Best Pack"  so it has 5 posters and 3 MTG cards in it plus A4 ORGINAL pencil drawing of mine.









This is also extended version of "Best Pack" but more JRR Tolkien fans oriented. It contains 5 posters and 3 MTG cards -signed  plus "Middle Earth Quest" board game by FFG also signed





This one is for true Magic The Gathering fans. It contains all what "Best Pack" has plus  "Magic the Gathering Commander. The commander edition contains itself 3 Oversized ,foil commander cards and 100 card singleton deck,tuned for multiplayer play. First to contribute this perk has the  best color of the commander box choice. 









Whenever You plan to visit Poland feel free to visit my hometown Bochnia and be oficially my quest for 24 hrs. You just need to get here somehow but  once I will pickup you from the cracow airport or train station all costs are on me. Within 1200$ traveler pack cost ,you can expect one night at cozy hotel with view on the Tatra mountains+ breakfast , dinner and lots of drinks. I will be your tour guide for Bochnia which is wonderful and cute little town near by Cracow but just as interesting only more quiet. If you are drawing or painting yourself I can give you some lessons durring that time but I am sure we will find just plenty interesting subjects to chat about once you get here. I will ofcourse help you get back on the airport or station once the trip expires, there are aslo 5 posters and 3 MTG cards delivered peronaly with shake of my hand .







Send me the art description ,photo references or other materials and let me work on Your personal illustration ,just for You , one and only piece like that on the entire Planet. This can be Magic the gathering illustration like with a character looks like You  or  everything else really there are no limits. Once it is ready I will print it ,sign and send it back  to You , 5 posters and 3 MTG cards included.







I I am ready to give up my best friend -Intous 2 A4+ Wacom tablet . It is used and that is the best of him - it has skratches , cracks but it is working as new -which is even better about him. Ive been using it for almost 10 years already and it is really a hard deal to me to breaking apart with it.. So you better be quick as I can change my mind every minute now ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

Establishing those starting 200 orders should be enough to begin my posters shop earing and I be able to cut some freelance works and finally have more time for my kids. But ofcourse it would be most generous of You if You just spread teh message and bring as much of Your friends as possible.

cool stuff much  more . If we fail to meet the goal money ,well that will be  a lesson to me  and an 

experience but I believe with Your help ,especially counting on Your commnets/advices here, I will have enough time till 

the deadline to convince You the project is worth to contribute.


What We Need & 

What You Get
As I said when talking about posters there is really only one option: to print them in huge amount, 

once to minimalize costs per piece, twice to get the best quality and offset printing is right there. I need 5000$ to 

cover the basic print of 5 posters. Why 5 ,well this is the starting point and I wanted You to have at least some of 

choice if You think that is too much anyways the entire collection of my works made for MTG reaches 50 pieces. So print 

costs are about 58% the exact number is hard to determinate because all will be paid in polish currency so the final 

amount is basicly what current USD/PLN rate is. Another 38% are shipping+packaging costs and they also needs to be 

secured in front mostly because of cartoon tubes for packaging I have to order them in large amount to cut the cost per 

piece. The rest are Indiegogo fees. The goal money covers first 200 orders in my MTG store and I am talking only about 

"regular Pack " all the rest is mostly covered from my pocket or those are free stuff I am receiving a lot as a 

freelance artist from the publisher.I decided to start with 200 pieces because it seems to be the optimal amount, there 

is no point to print 100 pieces as they cost almost the same amount as 200 ,from the other side just 2000 $ more would 

do another 200 packages -but I though 7000$ project will be just too much for my Indiegogo debut. If there will be more 

interest than the goal 5000$ I will be able to prepare more packs for You because printing costs running down with 

pieces printed rising up plus I should be able to expand the Prints Store by more posters and maybe even T-shirts and 

other gifts? I  believe You don't have to be Magic the Gathering fan really to find those posters or other uniqe 

perks offer interesting  so I am really counting on Your support. DETAILS There is lots of perks to 

choose 



You will receive all 5 posters in 

downloadable desktop wallpapers version , digitaly signed.




Small Pack contains 5 postcards version of 

the illustrations ,signed plus 3 random MTG cards





This Pack contains 5 postcards version of the illustrations all
signed plus 3 random MTG cards. Also there is so called "proof card" of  illustration (one of five) ,very rare and printed in limited number card
type appreciated amongs MTG cards collectors. Each proof card had
limited edition number , first to contribute this perk takes lower(more
valuable)  number . This perk covers numbers 13-47





This Pack contains 5 postcards 

version of the illustrations all signed plus 3 random MTG cards. Also there is so called "proof card" of  illustration (one of five) ,very rare and printed in limited number card type appreciated amongs MTG cards collectors. 

Each proof card had limited edition number , first to contribute this perk takes lower(more valuable)  number . 

This perk covers numbers 1-12. 









Regular Pack contains B2 (68 

x 48 cm or 27x19 inches) 250 gr/sqrm UV potected glossy paper Poster of One of Five illustrations ,signed  plus 3 

random MTG cards. 






Best Pack contains all 5 posters ,signed plus 3 MTG cards. Even You do not like one or two of the posters it is a great choice because You save a lot on shipping costs while extra posters You didn't like still sounds like cool gift for friends of Yours. 






This is extended "Best Pack"  so it has 5 posters and 3 MTG cards in it plus A4 ORGINAL pencil drawing of mine.





This is also extended version of "Best Pack" but more JRR Tolkien fans oriented. It contains 5 posters and 3 MTG cards -signed  plus "Middle Earth Quest" board game by FFG also signed







This one is for true Magic The Gathering fans. It contains all what "Best Pack" has plus  "Magic the Gathering Commander. The commander edition contains itself 3 Oversized ,foil commander cards and 100 card singleton deck,tuned for multiplayer play. First to contribute this perk has the  best color of the commander box choice. 





Whenever You plan to visit Poland feel free to visit my hometown Bochnia and be oficially my quest for 24 hrs. You just need to get here somehow but  once I will pickup you from the cracow airport or train station all costs are on me. Within 1200$ traveler pack cost ,you can expect one night at cozy hotel with view on the Tatra mountains+ breakfast , dinner and lots of drinks. I will be your tour guide for Bochnia which is wonderful and cute little town near by Cracow but just as interesting only more quiet. If you are drawing or painting yourself I can give you some lessons durring that time but I am sure we will find just plenty interesting subjects to chat about once you get here. I will ofcourse help you get back on the airport or station once the trip expires, there are aslo 5 posters and 3 MTG cards delivered peronaly with shake of my hand .







Send me the art description ,photo references or other materials and let me work on Your personal illustration ,just for You , one and only piece like that on the entire Planet. This can be Magic the gathering illustration like with a character looks like You  or  everything else really there are no limits. Once it is ready I will print it ,sign and send it back  to You , 5 posters and 3 MTG cards included.








I I am ready to give up my best friend -Intous 2 A4+ Wacom tablet . It is used and that is the best of him - it has skratches , cracks but it is working as new -which is even better about him. Ive been using it for almost 10 years already and it is really a hard deal to me to breaking apart with it.. So you better be quick as I can change my mind every minute now ;)

Other Ways You Can Help
Establishing those starting 200 orders should be enough to 

begin my posters shop earing and I be able to cut some freelance works and finally have more time for my kids. But 

ofcourse it would be most generous of You if You just spread teh message and bring as much of Your friends as possible.

story:
We've updated our fundraising goal!

Our new goal is $5000 so that we can set up our digital darkroom in the studio. We plan on purchasing at least one high quality film scanner, additional photo editing software, and at least one high quality printer for use in the studio. The best part of this is that donations over $50 will receive extremely discounted memberships to the studio along with our list of quirky fringe benefits. Please help us continue to spread the word and we hope to see you at the studio!

A little bit about us...

Art Party Studio was founded by Amy Gardiner, Joseph Casciano, and RJ Barrios (a.k.a. Ms. Hors D’oeuvres). We’re looking to set up shop in Easthampton, MA, and open our doors to the general public by August 2012.

The goal of our business venture is to create a space where art and art creation is accessible to artists of all skill levels. The studio will be a shared artist space and gallery, like an “art gym”, providing members access to equipment, workspace, and the support necessary to realize their creative projects for a monthly fee. The true goal of Art Party Studio is to create a productive art community - artists that feel successful in their creative ventures.

Our membership structure:

Our “art gym” works on a payment scale based on how many times members want to have access to the space.

Part-time ($50/month): This level of membership allows customers access to Art Party’s equipment and space 3 days per week. Members at this level will also receive free admission to critique nights and be able to participate in the monthly gallery show.

Full-time ($100/month): This level of membership allows customers access to Art Party’s equipment and space 6 days per week. Members at this level will also receive free admission to critique nights and be able to participate in the monthly gallery show.

Day Passes ($20/visit): This allows artists to utilize Art Party’s tools and space for a single day.

How your contribution helps:

The $3,500 we are we are trying to raise will all be going toward tools for the space. Donations through Indiegogo will help purchase two computers, creative software, one printer, one sewing machine, 10 easels, $500 of power tools, $500 of assorted paint brushes and artist utensils, four work surfaces, and one giant box of crayons. These tools, along with some of the equipment Amy, Joe, and RJ already own, are the bare minimum that is needed to help Art Party Studio get off the ground. If we raise more money, we will set up a digital darkroom with film scanners and high quality printesr.

When will you get your stuff?

Art Party Studio membership, event passes, and day passes will be availble once we open our doors in August. Fringe benefits, like your awesome, new pet rock, will be delivered in the months following Art Party Studio's opening. We'll get them to you as fast as we can make them! Because we heart you! 

Other ways you can help:

Help us get the word out!
Tell your friends, your enemies, and people that walk by you on the street! We welcome everyone. To stay informed about our classes, hours, and events, visit our website at www.joinartparty.com. Lastly, you can also "like" us on Facebook at facebook.com/artpartystudio and follow us on Twitter at ArtPartyStudio.

Donate tools or supplies to the space!
Have a box of markers, a sewing machine, or any other art equipment just collecting dust in a storage space? We’ll gladly take them as a donation to the studio in exchange for various discounts.

story:
MiXER is a cross-disciplinary collaboration “playground” or experiment where artists from diverse art disciplines and cultural backgrounds are encouraged to engage, share methodologies and inspire each other.

 With the task of working in pairs artists are given the opportunity to regenerate their creative dynamism, exchange and develop new ideas. Experiment with no fear of failure and thus assess their own artistic processes – learning valuable insights from other art forms.

http://dclinicstudios.com

I won't find out who my collaborator is until the day I arrive in Hungary in a town called Zalaegerszeg, located on the Eastern side of the Country.  Art will become our shared language and our means to finding common ground. 

What happens during my residency?

  • I meet my collaborator 
  • We collaborate on an artistic vision that sandwiches both our individual art practices into one
  • We have an exhibition of the finished work in Zalaegerszeg
  • We publish a one of a kind artist book artifact (limited edition)
  • We create something for D'CLiNIC's store http://dclinicstudios.com/trgovinaa

        ... and YES we do all of this in ONE MONTH! 

Unfortunately this residency is not funded therefore this Indiegogo pays for my MiXER residency fee, my flight to and from Hungary, and material costs.


                          -->   I N C E N T I V E S  |  R E W A R D S  <3

This is a collaboration which ='s anything can happen! I'm going into this experience with an open mind and expect strange amazing things to take place.

Please share with your friends <3 Thankyou

 Hungarian trinkets- small gifts that I find or buy on my travels in Hungary

 Cardboard Cut-Out of an original photograph taken on my residency. This is an example of what to expect - approximately 6 IN x 10 IN - sizes will vary

 Screen printed t-shirt / tote bag / undies   with an original design by me!!!!! I'm actually in the midst of getting this image ready to print this week! (image above)These are the Granny panties/ Tighty Whites! They come in all sizes and can be worn or displayed however you choose! HOORAY!


Check out my website   --->  www.amybritter.com
This is a collaboration which ='s anything can happen! I'm going into this experience with an open mind and expect strange amazing things to take place.

    Please share with your friends <3 Thankyou

story:
Do you remember fire art?

We do, and we miss it. Don’t get us wrong -- a lot of our favorite Burning Man projects in the last few years have been of the “individually addressable LED” variety. But it’s time to go back to our roots – let’s light some stuff on fire!


The False Profit Labs BlimpCorps presents:
BATTLE BLIMPS

Battle Blimps is an interactive fire installation in which the denizens of Burning Man are invited to pilot miniature Hindenburgs in a battle royale -- like the infamous Black Rock City Thunderdome, but for tiny, remote-controlled, hydrogen-filled blimps.  Every round of blimp combat will include four red-hot-poker-tipped zeppelins, each of which will attempt to ram the others, puncture their gas envelopes, and cause them to crash to the ground in fiery balls of doom. Oh, the humanity!


How not to fly your Battle Blimp...

Let’s have some fun.

At False Profit Labs, we believe in fun. The kind of fun that ends in flames and glory.

Battle Blimps is an interactive game that anyone can play. Our zeppelins are light and maneuverable, and unlike radio-controlled airplanes or helicopters they are inherently stable -- if you let go of the controls they’ll just float calmly in mid-air, and they even bounce off obstacles instead of crashing to the ground. To make the controls immediately familiar and accessible to a wide audience, we’ve chosen to use off-the-shelf Xbox controllers. So far we’ve had overwhelmingly positive feedback on the ease of use and flight performance of the blimps from kids and adults alike -- you grab the controls and you’re zipping around in seconds!


Each action-packed round of blimp combat will be an event unto itself. Four lucky individuals will step into the False Profit Aerodrome to try their hand as pilots, seeking glory, fiery carnage, and victory. Combatants will be given 10 minutes to annihilate their rivals. Fierce alliances and devastating betrayals are inevitable! Some will win; more will lose!


What we’re building to create this experience

Airframes and Gas Envelopes: Each blimp is constructed on a three-foot-long airframe on which the brain, the motors, and all of the other machinery are mounted. Within the skeleton of the airframe is nestled the gas envelope, a custom-made bioplastic balloon that is designed to safely and gloriously burn as the blimp plummets to its doom.

Radio control: The brain of each blimp is a tiny bluetooth-enabled Arduino that communicates with our central station, which is hooked up to the pilot’s controllers and the monitoring panel that we use to keep track of the blimps.

Ignition system: Finally, each blimp is tipped with an ignition system that uses an array of needles to tear the gas envelope open, and a small nichrome wire coil (the same metal that glows red hot in your toaster) to ignite the escaping hydrogen.

Anatomy of a Battle Blimp

The False Profit Aerodrome: Each ultralight Battle Blimp weighs around 23 grams. To keep them from being carried off by wind (and to keep participants and observers safe), we’re building an arena worthy of the spectacle: the False Profit Aerodrome. Crowds will watch from an observation area around the perimeter, separated from a central arena by a wire screen. Pilots will battle from atop an elevated control tower, immersed in a three-dimensional dogfight that unfolds both above and below their vantage point.

We think this set up will enable a truly unique experience. But to bring this experience to the Playa, we need your help...


Where will your contribution go?

Your financial contribution will go entirely towards the cost of creating the Battle Blimps project and bringing it to Burning Man. The direct costs of this project are divided into two big areas: the Battle Blimps themselves and the False Profit Aerodrome; in addition, we need to tackle a number of indirect costs.

For the Battle Blimps themselves, we estimate the costs at roughly $3,500; of this, about $2,800 is budgeted for consumables (balloons, hydrogen, spares of parts that are expected to be damaged or destroyed by the flaming crashes each round), and the rest will go towards parts of the blimps that should survive for many rounds (the electronics, motors, batteries, airframes, and controllers).

We are budgeting $6,700 for the Aerodrome, which goes toward the structure itself (domes: more expensive than we thought), a fire-resistant dome cover, fire safety gear, the screen around the play area, lighting, the control tower, and odds and ends.

Finally, there are some indirect costs. First, transportation will cost about $1,500. Contributor perks come in at about another $500. That brings us to $12,300, but we’ve run enough big-budget projects to know that no matter how carefully you budget, you’re almost surely forgetting something, so it’s our practice to add about 6% for emergencies, which is another $700. Last but not least, Indiegogo’s cut is about $1,100, which brings us to $14,100.


Who are we?

Since 2003, False Profit Labs has delivered on the promise of Better Art Through Science, from exploding hydrogen soap bubbles to heartbeat controlled flame effects to multi-colored fire plumes to carbon fiber art. We are art engineers who fabricate, machine, weld, program, and construct larger-than-life art installations designed to create inspiring experiences for observers and participants.


False Profit Labs has exhibited interactive fire sculptures at Burning Man, NASA Ames, the Fire Arts Festival, Coachella, Electric Daisy Carnival, Maker Faire, and many other events around the Bay Area, Los Angeles, and beyond, receiving over 15 art grants from a wide range of commercial and non-commercial supporters. Our artistic focus has been interactivity and direct audience control of fire. Seemingly dangerous exploding things always fascinate, but we have strived to take that fascination to a deeper level -- “From Wow To How.”


Get involved!

We would really love to have you involved in this project, and there are a number of ways to jump in. If you can contribute financially, any amount it is hugely appreciated. You can also help spread the word! Please share the link to our campaign ( http://igg.me/at/battleblimps ),  join our facebook group, and send people mail by e- and snail!

If you want to take your involvement to the next level, drop us a line about volunteering. We’re looking for collaborators to join the project, both before Burning Man and on the Playa. This project has a lot of elements -- electronics, 3d design, fabrication, construction, and arts-and-crafts-type stuff -- so there are a lot of fun things to learn and do. And we’re looking for volunteers to help us staff the project at Burning Man, which is a spectacular way to spend an evening or two on the Playa. If any of this appeals to you, get in touch on our facebook group!


We ♥ open source

The Battle Blimp hardware is built on top of Arduino (RFduino to be more specific). Our control station is built with Python and currently runs on Linux. If you want to build a blimp of your own, you can check out our github repository to see our code. We’ll be publishing our final PCB designs and a complete bill of materials after Burning Man.


Risk and challenges

At this point, we have fully-operational blimps and we have successfully achieved blimp combustion, so the core of the project works today. However, we are planning around a few known risks. There’s almost no chance that Battle Blimps won’t be running in some capacity. And we will bring Battle Blimps to other forums closer to home after Burning Man. But some of these risks could force us to run battles at Burning Man without fire (or to run fewer matches).

  • Scaling up balloon production: We need to produce a lot of safely-combustible bioplastic gas envelopes. Several hundred, maybe a thousand or more. We have a couple dozen for testing, but producing our high target number by Burning Man may be a challenge. If we’re short, we’ll eventually have to switch to off-the-shelf balloons, which means no fire.

  • Ignition Problems: We know our ignition system works, but it doesn’t yet work as reliably as we want. This isn’t a show-stopper, but it might be a little irritating if a direct hit on another blimp doesn’t result in a well-deserved fiery demise.

  • Fire Inspection: We have submitted a fire safety application and are in contact with the Burning Fire Art Safety Team, and so far we’ve received positive feedback, but it’s always possible that the fire component of this project will not be approved.

  • The False Profit Aerodrome: This is the biggest set of all-or-nothing capital investments. We have to wait to see how this campaign is going before we procure the dome and aerodrome equipment. With less than a month before Burning Man, the risk is that we won’t be able to buy a dome and produce the other bits of the Aerodrome in the time available to us (despite having a few dome vendors lined up).

  • Burning Man: Burning Man eats art projects. It just does. Things that work flawlessly off the playa mysteriously give up the ghost once they land in the desert. Radios work less well than expected, heat/cold/dust causes electronics to fail, hippies cause project teams to fall into despair… anything can happen out there.


BlimpCorps Perks

We have some truly unique perks for everyone supporting Battle Blimps. Every dollar helps! Really: thanks for contributing in any amount, and for sharing this project with your friends.

For those contributing $20 or higher, we’ll send you one of our limited edition BlimpCorps Battle Blimps Safety Stickers, which highlight the hazards of incorrect Battle Blimp usage:

Flaming blimps: Not recommended for face

For those contributing $60, we’ll send you the sticker, plus a BlimpCorps Battle Blimps tank top or tee-shirt, and at $190, we'll add the Battle Blimps hoodie.

Tee, tank top, and hoodie/jacket.
Note that we'll be refining these designs before shipping.

For a really unique perk, check out the Battle Blimps souvenir PCBs. At $110, you get a sticker, t-shirt/tank top, and the awesome souvenir board below. For the ambitious, this board will actually be production hardware that (with some sweat and tears) you could turn into your very own Battle Blimp. (Note that these are offered without warranty or support, but see main text for our open source commitment.)

Note: We'll be refining the board design as well before shipping. 

But there’s more than just merch. We’re committed to delivering a high-quality blimp combat experience, and we want to ensure that you, our core community of backers, get to be involved in that experience. We have a few perks designed to make sure that people who have helped make this project a reality (and their friends and campmates) will get to participate in experience. Get your spot in front of the line to be a pilot, grab the mic to announce your very own Blimp Battle, or bring home an actual Battle Blimp. See the full list in the sidebar!

(Note that some of these participation perks are meant to be experienced at Burning Man 2015, but we will attempt to honor them at other events at which the Battle Blimps are present.)

Who are we?

Since 2003, False Profit Labs has delivered on the promise of Better Art Through Science, from exploding hydrogen soap bubbles to heartbeat controlled flame effects to multi-colored fire plumes to carbon fiber art. We are art engineers who fabricate, machine, weld, program, and construct larger-than-life art installations designed to create inspiring experiences for observers and participants.
False Profit Labs has exhibited interactive fire sculptures at Burning Man, NASA Ames, the Fire Arts Festival, Coachella, Electric Daisy Carnival, Maker Faire, and many other events around the Bay Area, Los Angeles, and beyond, receiving over 15 art grants from a wide range of commercial and non-commercial supporters. Our artistic focus has been interactivity and direct audience control of fire. Seemingly dangerous exploding things always fascinate, but we have strived to take that fascination to a deeper level -- “From Wow To How.”
Get involved!
We would really love to have you involved in this project, and there are a number of ways to jump in. If you can contribute financially, any amount it is hugely appreciated. You can also help spread the word! Please share the link to our campaign ( http://igg.me/at/battleblimps ),  join our facebook group, and send people mail by e- and snail!If you want to take your involvement to the next level, drop us a line about volunteering. We’re looking for collaborators to join the project, both before Burning Man and on the Playa. This project has a lot of elements -- electronics, 3d design, fabrication, construction, and arts-and-crafts-type stuff -- so there are a lot of fun things to learn and do. And we’re looking for volunteers to help us staff the project at Burning Man, which is a spectacular way to spend an evening or two on the Playa. If any of this appeals to you, get in touch on our facebook group!
We ♥ open source
The Battle Blimp hardware is built on top of Arduino (RFduino to be more specific). Our control station is built with Python and currently runs on Linux. If you want to build a blimp of your own, you can check out our github repository to see our code. We’ll be publishing our final PCB designs and a complete bill of materials after Burning Man.Risk and challengesAt this point, we have fully-operational blimps and we have successfully achieved blimp combustion, so the core of the project works today. However, we are planning around a few known risks. There’s almost no chance that Battle Blimps won’t be running in some capacity. And we will bring Battle Blimps to other forums closer to home after Burning Man. But some of these risks could force us to run battles at Burning Man without fire (or to run fewer matches).
Scaling up balloon production: We need to produce a lot of safely-combustible bioplastic gas envelopes. Several hundred, maybe a thousand or more. We have a couple dozen for testing, but producing our high target number by Burning Man may be a challenge. If we’re short, we’ll eventually have to switch to off-the-shelf balloons, which means no fire.
Ignition Problems: We know our ignition system works, but it doesn’t yet work as reliably as we want. This isn’t a show-stopper, but it might be a little irritating if a direct hit on another blimp doesn’t result in a well-deserved fiery demise.
Fire Inspection: We have submitted a fire safety application and are in contact with the Burning Fire Art Safety Team, and so far we’ve received positive feedback, but it’s always possible that the fire component of this project will not be approved. 
The False Profit Aerodrome: This is the biggest set of all-or-nothing capital investments. We have to wait to see how this campaign is going before we procure the dome and aerodrome equipment. With less than a month before Burning Man, the risk is that we won’t be able to buy a dome and produce the other bits of the Aerodrome in the time available to us (despite having a few dome vendors lined up).
Burning Man: Burning Man eats art projects. It just does. Things that work flawlessly off the playa mysteriously give up the ghost once they land in the desert. Radios work less well than expected, heat/cold/dust causes electronics to fail, hippies cause project teams to fall into despair… anything can happen out there. 

BlimpCorps Perks
We have some truly unique perks for everyone supporting Battle Blimps. Every dollar helps! Really: thanks for contributing in any amount, and for sharing this project with your friends.For those contributing $20 or higher, we’ll send you one of our limited edition BlimpCorps Battle Blimps Safety Stickers, which highlight the hazards of incorrect Battle Blimp usage:
Flaming blimps: Not recommended for face
For those contributing $60, we’ll send you the sticker, plus a BlimpCorps Battle Blimps tank top or tee-shirt, and at $190, we'll add the Battle Blimps hoodie.
Tee, tank top, and hoodie/jacket.Note that we'll be refining these designs before shipping.
For a really unique perk, check out the Battle Blimps souvenir PCBs. At $110, you get a sticker, t-shirt/tank top, and the awesome souvenir board below. For the ambitious, this board will actually be production hardware that (with some sweat and tears) you could turn into your very own Battle Blimp. (Note that these are offered without warranty or support, but see main text for our open source commitment.)
Note: We'll be refining the board design as well before shipping. But there’s more than just merch. We’re committed to delivering a high-quality blimp combat experience, and we want to ensure that you, our core community of backers, get to be involved in that experience. We have a few perks designed to make sure that people who have helped make this project a reality (and their friends and campmates) will get to participate in experience. Get your spot in front of the line to be a pilot, grab the mic to announce your very own Blimp Battle, or bring home an actual Battle Blimp. See the full list in the sidebar!(Note that some of these participation perks are meant to be experienced at Burning Man 2015, but we will attempt to honor them at other events at which the Battle Blimps are present.)

story:
Here's the story of love at first sight.
I had always wanted a motorcycle since I was young. My father had many Harley Davidson's when I was a boy. We went to many bike rallies locally and far away, including Sturgis, SD. I loved the way the open road beckoned, the feeling of wind in my hair, and the freedom! Ever since then, I'd been seeking a classic bike to call my own!

Now, snap forward to present day. While out on a drive, I saw this wonderful Honda CT70 sitting in a guy's yard, rusting away. I felt the overwhelming urge to stop and ask about it, and found that it was for sale! I knew right then and there, staring at that lovely green paint, that I had to have it. That day, I ended up taking home a halfway assembled, slightly rusty CT70 complete for only $40. I now owned one of my favorite classic bikes of all time, but it needed quite a bit! 

This bike truly is an art piece, the embodiment of everything the 70's was about. Chrome, revolution, and disco music! And no worries here, it won't become some museum piece, it will be ridden every opportunity I can. It will be shown at local meets, compete in events, and I'll even ride it to some of our bike rallies!

Here's where you come in! I managed to save this poor bike from rusting away and being a lost piece of history. I unfortunately am no millionaire and my current pay doesn't leave me with the spare money needed to bring it back to life! Every dollar you give goes towards fixing this bike up, and putting it back on the road in rust-free glory.

story:
Mon projet

Bonjour, je m'appelle Lilou et j'ai 15ans.

Je rêve de pouvoir faire des photos de part le monde et en général.

Il y a un an j'ai fait un stage de photographie chez un photographe à Lyon lors de mon stage de 3ème;

Et cette année j'ai l'opportunité de rejoindre ma cousine en Australie à Melbourne pendant 1 mois et demi en mai prochain, en y allant je pourrai faire de mon rêve une réalité...

De plus si je peux y aller je prendrai des cours d'anglais pour pouvoir me débrouiller seule si je voyage encore. Et je suivrai mes cours par correspondance.

Le problème est qu'il faut prendre un billet d'avion... Je ne suis pas encore majeure donc je ne peux pas encore être embauchée et travailler pour quelqu'un... Je gagne déjà un peu d'argent en faisant du miel de pissenlit ou en donnant des cours d'anglais pour mon père mais ça ne suffit malheureusement pas...


Mon budget


  • 1 billet d'avion aller-retour coûte environ 1200 €
  •  cours d'anglais pour 1 mois et demi coutent environ 500 €
  • les frais sur place seront assurés par mes parents et ma cousine

Ce qui fait un total d'environ 1700€

Suite à ce voyage

Je serai presque bi-lingue, ce qui me semble vraiment important pour mon avenir car vivant dans une station de ski parler deux langues est un vrai atout !
Je saurai me débrouiller de façon quasiment autonome; ce qui me permettra de pouvoir faire le programme ERASMUS quand je serai plus grande et ainsi de réaliser un autre voyage dans cette même idée.

un défi personnel

Un voyage comme celui la est dur à réaliser lorsque vous avez 15ans, le fait de voyager seule, d'arriver dans un pays étranger, ou les gens ne parlent pas votre langue et avec ses parents à plusieurs milliers de kilomètres de vous est un vrai défi même s'il y a votre cousine.


D'autres façons de m'aider

Votre contribution est extrêmement importante !
S'il vous plait parlez en autour de vous pour que plus de personnes puissent participer à réaliser mon rêve

  • N'oubliez pas d'utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo !

Et le tour est joué ! MERCI

story:
Hi! I'm Del, a Welsh girl living in South Africa who has many creative hobbies. I'm a firm believer in embracing your inner child throughout adulthood and one of the ways I do this is by doodling intricate patterns to colour in. I've already self-published one 'adult colouring book' full of my patterns, but I'd like to crowdfund a second book and offer some fun incentives along the way.

According to this article on HuffPo (and many others!), as well as being great fun, colouring in is a fantastic way to ease the stress we face in our adult lives;

"The practice generates wellness, quietness and also stimulates brain areas related to motor skills, the senses and creativity."

Colouring books are a great thing to own for yourself to unwind after a busy day or just to spend some 'you' time doing something fun, but they're especially useful for anyone who has a particularly busy or stressful lifestyle, anyone suffering from depression, or spending time at a hospital - any situation where taking care of your mental well-being through stimulating creative activity is paramount.

Campaign Summary:

  • 50 unique, original, hand-drawn illustrations to colour, printed in high-quality in an 8.5x8.5" square book with a full colour glossy cover
  • Rewards including digital (for printing yourself) and physical copies of the book, your own personal doodles, and signed postcards and original illustrations posted to you via 'snail mail'
  • Funds raised will cover printing costs of the book as well as funding further art supplies for continued pursuit of my hobby
  • Flexible funding - all backers will receive their rewards even if the main goal isn't met

What I Need & What You Get

The main product of this campaign will be a physical colouring book. The book will feature fifty unique, original hand-drawn illustrations printed on #60 paper at 8.5x8.5" with a full glossy colour cover. Each image will be designed to utilise the square format and will be printed on its own page (with nothing on the back), to minimise effects of ink-bleed through the paper when colouring with inks, but also so that each image can be removed from the book (to be framed, for example) without sacrificing another image on the back of the page.

Obviously the first thing I need is to cover printing and postage costs of the physical books, and this is where most of the funding will go. Reward tiers that include physical media are priced to include postage, so there'll be no extra to pay on top of your perk amount.

The remainder of the money generated will cover my time spent drawing and will pay for art supplies. Right now I'm using pretty basic gear - a small selection of pens and some of the cheaper colouring pens and pencils. I'd like to upgrade and expand on my tools, but art supplies are expensive. The funds raised here will help pay for that.

Further Information

As mentioned above, I've already self-published one colouring book;

www.lulu.com/shop/delyth-angharad/meditative-colouring-for-adults/paperback/product-22164140.html

The reviews have been great and everyone who's received their copy so far has loved it. I'm confident that this second book will be just as high quality and well presented by both myself and Lulu, and will be just as well received.


I'll be printing through Lulu again; their prices are competitive and their print quality is generally very good. I've used them before so I'm familiar with their process. Printing this way will also allow me to send copies directly from Lulu to backers, cutting down on postage costs.

Delivery Estimates:

Postage for all reward tiers will be available worldwide.

Lulu is a print-on-demand service and depending on which country you're in, physical copies of your book can take from one to four weeks to arrive, as Lulu prints out each copy after the order has been placed. This campaign is set to run for sixty days, during which time I'll be assembling the remaining doodles to include in the book and working on the extra rewards. At the end of the campaign I'll create the book through Lulu and then place the orders, so you should expect your books to be delivered within a month after that point.


For the other physical tiers, I'll be posting from South Africa, which can take one to three weeks to reach the rest of the world (but usually takes 7 - 10 days). 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Colouring books are great for people of all ages, so the potential audience here is huge. Your friends might like a copy, their friends might like copies, and they make fantastic gifts. Share this campaign on your social media feeds!


You can also direct people to my Deviant Art gallery for high-res images they can download for free and print themselves to colour, without needing to back this project;

http://welshpixie.deviantart.com/gallery/

I'll be promoting my campaign there too, so any visits to my images on Deviant Art will feed this campaign.
