story:
My Story

My name is Wanda Pepin and I am an internationally collected fine artist. One day, while meditating I asked myself, "What could I do to improve the world?" Since I am an artist, the way I figured I could help was to use my talents by painting bright cheerful paintings with symbols of love and peace for our public spaces. The many colors would bring joy and the symbolism would remind each of us of peace and love. I believe that if we can change the collective mindset of the world to a positive and loving one, then we could indeed have world peace and be filled with love for all. 

My vision is to donate 100, 10x10 gallery wrap canvas paintings to a community to fill a public space. These paintings will be from my floral series called Floralies. The goal is to continue this project until I have filled public spaces around the world. To determine where the first installation will go I will count pledges and the greatest number of pledges from a community will get these paintings (from my first project here on IndieGoGo) donated to their community. I will keep everyone informed with a graph and posted to this project here on IndieGoGo. 

Timeframe: 2 months from Feb. 24, 2011 from start to finish. Goal for this project will be 100 paintings completed and installed by April 24th. 


The Impact

This public art installation will fill empty stark walls with bright colorful paintings that will bring joy to the public. Think about it. . .  what if your community could have original paintings that portray peace and love filling your public spaces? Would it make a difference? I believe it would. I believe these paintings if installed in a hospital will lighten the burden of having a sick family member in the hospital. . . . if installed in a courthouse will relieve stress for those dealing with serious matters. . . . if installed in an airport would brighten a traveler's day as they journey through an airport and this is just a few of the public environments where these paintings could be exhibited. 

This is the breakdown of what I need:

Supplies: $900 for 100 canvases, hardware, paint, etc.
Transportation to the site: $800 (depending on where in the world the paintings end up, I'll use my frequent flyer mileage if it is more)
Assistant: (for installing hardware, web updates and video recording, installation): $600
Shipping out perks: $1200
Plaque with donors names on it: $200
Cost of using IndieGoGo and Paypal: $540
Perks $2000

Perks

Floralies Mugs 
Framed Tiles with an image from the project
Organic White or Black T-Shirts with either a heart, peace sign or heart/peace sign (donor choice)

Throw Pillows with either a heart, peace sign or heart/peace sign (donor choice)

10x7 Archival Floralies Print with 2.25" Mat (signed by Artist)

3 Original Paintings (24x24 each)


Additional monies over and above the $6250 will go towards any additional expenses (hotel for when I go to the location to install the paintings, etc) and an awesome unveiling party for all the donors! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, get your community engaged, let your city leaders know and encourage them to participate, let your local newspapers know about this and of course your online community. IndieGoGo has lots of share tools that you can use to get the word out via the internet. This public art installation is valued at $12,500 for the art alone, not including the installation. Your community is not only getting an uplifting piece of art but it is getting an incredible donation that will be enjoyed by the public for years and years. All materials used are archival and guaranteed to last for a long long time.
story_txt:
My Story
My name is Wanda Pepin and I am an internationally collected fine artist. One day, while meditating I asked myself, "What could I do to improve the world?" Since I am an artist, the way I figured I could help was to use my talents by painting bright cheerful paintings with symbols of love and peace for our public spaces. The many colors would bring joy and the symbolism would remind each of us of peace and love. I believe that if we can change the collective mindset of the world to a positive and loving one, then we could indeed have world peace and be filled with love for all. 
My vision is to donate 100, 10x10 gallery wrap canvas paintings to a community to fill a public space. These paintings will be from my floral series called Floralies. The goal is to continue this project until I have filled public spaces around the world. To determine where the first installation will go I will count pledges and the greatest number of pledges from a community will get these paintings (from my first project here on IndieGoGo) donated to their community. I will keep everyone informed with a graph and posted to this project here on IndieGoGo. 

Timeframe: 2 months from Feb. 24, 2011 from start to finish. Goal for this project will be 100 paintings completed and installed by April 24th. 



The Impact


This public art installation will fill empty stark walls with bright colorful paintings that will bring joy to the public. Think about it. . .  what if your community could have original paintings that portray peace and love filling your public spaces? Would it make a difference? I believe it would. I believe these paintings if installed in a hospital will lighten the burden of having a sick family member in the hospital. . . . if installed in a courthouse will relieve stress for those dealing with serious matters. . . . if installed in an airport would brighten a traveler's day as they journey through an airport and this is just a few of the public environments where these paintings could be exhibited. 
This is the breakdown of what I need:

Supplies: $900 for 100 canvases, hardware, paint, etc.
Transportation to the site: $800 (depending on where in the world the paintings end up, I'll use my frequent flyer mileage if it is more)
Assistant: (for installing hardware, web updates and video recording, installation): $600
Shipping out perks: $1200
Plaque with donors names on it: $200
Cost of using IndieGoGo and Paypal: $540
Perks $2000

Perks

Floralies Mugs 
Framed Tiles with an image from the project
Organic White or Black T-Shirts with either a heart, peace sign or heart/peace sign (donor choice)
Throw Pillows with either a heart, peace sign or heart/peace sign (donor choice)
10x7 Archival Floralies Print with 2.25" Mat (signed by Artist)
3 Original Paintings (24x24 each)

Additional monies over and above the $6250 will go towards any additional expenses (hotel for when I go to the location to install the paintings, etc) and an awesome unveiling party for all the donors! 


Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word, get your community engaged, let your city leaders know and encourage them to participate, let your local newspapers know about this and of course your online community. IndieGoGo has lots of share tools that you can use to get the word out via the internet. This public art installation is valued at $12,500 for the art alone, not including the installation. Your community is not only getting an uplifting piece of art but it is getting an incredible donation that will be enjoyed by the public for years and years. All materials used are archival and guaranteed to last for a long long time.

story:
Important massage regarding perks delivery time

Changes in plan of production and shipping. The perks will be made during the Campaign and will be shipped by express EMS so it will reach any destination in time For Christmas, by the 20th of december,and not By 25th of February 2014 as is Written in the perks estimated delivery time


Seven phases of metamorphosis And the consciousness Evolution of humanity

If you love art, have acceptance and open heart for ideas related to the spirit, and like To have a real treat limited edition artworks as perks –This project is for you.

This is an art project based on the “seven planetary seals” , made by Dr. Rudolf Steiner about a century ago.

The planetary seals are occult symbols, that represents seven stages in the evolution Of human consciousness and planet earth.


Among many other issues, Dr. Steiner wrote and lectured extensively about the Evolution of human consciousness, as it is revealed to occult vision and as it is Reflected in history, through religious and scholastic texts, mythology, art, and Specific events and individuals.

The development of mankind, as depicted by Dr. Steiner, is quite different from the General views on the subject.

It goes far more back and describes the events spiritually, rather than in terms of Brain size or bones structures.

Behind the countless complexities that were, and still are unfolding through our Development, there is an archetype, spiritual law of development. This cosmic law Have seven unique stages, each with its own characteristics. 

While in humanity and in each one of us this process is manifested spiritually, it also Expresses itself  tangibly, through the forms of plants development.

It will be out of the scope of this introduction to tell more about this process by words, Since all my effort is to express it, through art,  believing that art can and should Become the gate in the verge of awakening to a profound and deep aspects of Existence. Studding the details of this process is complementary to what I am trying To do by art, and by all means it can provide a much better understanding of what is Being expressed in the seals and in my interpretations of it.

Nevertheless, one thing is important to mention about the present time in relation to The evolution of consciousness:

The modern man and woman are the outcome of a development that started long, Long ago.

The last accomplishment of this evolution is the  individualization and personal Intelligence,

Outcome of half millennium of complete dominance of scientific materialistic thinking And Industrial revolution. 

Perior to this accomplishment, we had to be left alone, completely loose every trace Of our ability to feel our connection with the spiritual world.

We are now ready and capable to begin our cosmic breath out, transforming  the Passive receptiveness of the spiritual, that we had in  ancient times (humanities Breath in), into an activity toward the spirit, reshaping our union with the spirit in the Light of intelligence and free will.

Now that we all have something to ponder about.. I would like to introduce the art Itself.

What is unique about this project that makes it different from anything else in Contemporary art?

Methods of work – except of creating sculptures to the seals, I have integrated water Circulating in six of them. The water springs out and drained in specific points in each Sculpture , create a defined pathes of streaming water along the surface of the Sculptures. I experiment with water while I’m sculpturing the forms, and this is Apparent in the forms themselves. Water is actually a participator in creating this Forms.

I also use light and fire in specific places, to indicate about the nature of certain Motives in the sculptures.

The use of the elements – water, light, fire, is for me a way to use technology in a Different way than the usual.

Technology is not only flat screens, projectors and robotic apparatus. When you have The ability the put small water pump in a sculpture, it is technology too. If I can put Some led lights in a sculptures without having to worry about water , it is also Technology. I find that exploring and making use of the different qualitiesof the  Elements is important factor in this project, and without technology it could not have Been done.

Connection between dimensions – it is no secret that there is a great shift of attention Into the two dimensional realm ( anyone said smartphone? or ipad?). the exhibition Plan for this project combines  the third  and second dimensions. (see the pitch video For a illustration).

Metamorphosis – in this project there will be exhibited seven sculptures/vessels, that Are connected by means of form. Each form is connected to the former, and all Together create a meaningful form development, that also indicates and resonate With internal change,as soul qualities.  the viewer is trigged into activeness, to Complete the formative “gaps” between one sculpture to the next,  This is part of the Nature of metamorphosis, and it  creates  very different experience than being in the Mind, in the intellect , which is the general experience in contemporary art. 

Where am i at now?

I have almost finished four of the seventh sculptures planned for this project.
This are the prototypes that are in the pitch video.
I am generally happy with them,except that
Three of them need to be about 20-30 percent larger. this will allow bigger  volume of Water in the sculptures and the streams will become more vigorous and apparent.
It might seem like a lot of work but  actually it is more of a technical task and  not very Time consuming; i already started to create the enlarged prototypes and will post Updates here with pictures as the campaign continue.

I have a pretty good idea about how the rest of the sculptures will look, though it will Probably go through a lot of  changes . there is a lot of surprises and developments in The way water and light, and eventually also fire, will be integrated into this very Interesting stages,

What do i need and how can you help?

The finished prototypes of the sculptures needs to have molds. only than i will be able To produce the first sculptures and apply the specific desired finish for each Sculpture. and , it will become reproducible.

Each mold for this sculptures should cost, in a professional mold house ,between 2500-4000$, depend on the type of mold.

So molds for all the seven sculptures will cost between 18,000 - 28,000$.

The second thing that i need help for is with budget that will allow me to dedicate Myself to finishing this project. so in this aspect you will fulfill the traditional role of Patrons, that was an important and respected part in the realization of most art in Past times.

Perks

in addition to  the perks that are listed below, all contributors  to this project , will be Listed on the seven metamorphosis site ,  and will be joined to the mailing list, in Which i will publish,as a sequence of related essays,or chapters, a book about all that Is only hinted in  this presentation. this this is not a guaranteed perk, but rather an Attempt that i already started  to work on and i hope that will become reality. it is not Offered as a perk because i would not like to commit myself in this campaign to Anything but the art, but i will surely be encouraged to address this task if i will feel Demand for it.

Files of high res scans of seven drawings i made about about the archetype Sevenfold development, six years ago, when first studied about it. you can see low Resolution of this  drawings here.

"Mercury" wall lamp

 Wall lamp that was created especially for this campaign. it is based on the fifth stage of the planetary seals, named 'mercury'.

it is a symbol that have special importance and meaning to the modern human Condition, and also the next challange in my seven metamorphosis project, to be Sculptured.

This lamp is constructed of reflective concave plate . diameter 40 cm, and a cast of Crystal clear polyester resin. the light is a 3w power LED ,which is green and economic, and delivers pretty strong light, (around 180 lumens) , projecting light on the Reflective plate, thus creating a indirect ,atmosphere lighting.

Power supply 3v adapter




Produced by hand in a limited edition of 300,signed and numbered.


"Ancient sun" fountain 

It is a scaled version of my second stage sculpture of the planetary seals, named 'Ancient sun'. also, this was made especially as a perk for this campaign, and will be Hand made as to demand , not more than 120, signed and numbered.



Any donation , however small , will be greatly appreciated, and so spreading the Word.

Thank for your your time and attention.

Ron

about thi

story:
Thank you for your interest in the Arts & Soul Project.  

This is a capital campaign to establish and operate an expressive arts studio in the community for the community. 

The Soul(Art)iculation™ Studio is the magical place where men, women and children come to encounter and express their feelings in a tangible way.  It is a sacred space where experiencing the power of art making  transforms the art maker. Studio clients learn to allow their soul’s story to come forth. Via their creative practice, the client sustains and flourishes in increased vitality, wellness and joy.

Artist-Healer Leah Young returned to college at forty-three where she experienced an awakening via her own art making. “My teacher nurtured the spirit of art within me without judgment.  As a result, through my inner art maker,  I reconnected with my creative voice and my soul’s story. ”

Her experience led Leah to synthesize her professional skills as a coach, trainer, reiki master, therapeutic guided imagery facilitator, interfaith minister and sound healer with her newly discovered creative process into a multimodal expressive arts  system known as Soul(Art)iculation™.   More simply, the system is a way to play with sound, imagery, writing, movement, painting,  and drawing, to access and give voice to the client’s deepest feelings for improved quality of life.

The Arts & Soul Project aims to create an open studio environment within which clients can cultivate their soul’s voice through the expressive arts.

The Soul(Art)iculation™ Studio offers a combination of expressive arts healing programs including Young’s own Journaling Your Journey visual journaling program, her Soul’s Story™ Arts Play experience, other non-directive arts process such as drawing, sculpture, collage, mixed-media and guest artist programs.  Services will be offered to participants on a sliding scale.

“The vision is to make art, cultivate our soul’s voice and to be of service doing the work that I love.”

The first studio is slated to open in Las Vegas, Nevada  Fall 2013.  “Eventually, we see the concept changing the face of the global community.  Art lives in every soul.”

 

What We Need & What You Get

Check out the soul(art)iculating perks in the column to the right.  We will post updates throughout the campaign including sneek previews of the design process for the special edition pieces related to the studio! Saty tuned!

 

The Financial Picture

The Studio will operate four days per week for ten hours each day.

 

2000 sq.ft. Space

Rental for 12 months $24,000

Studio Director Salary 

2080 hours $70,000

Part-time Admin Staff

1040 hours  $18, 720

Art Supplies 100 clients per week

52 weeks  $63,000

Furniture (Easels, Desks, etc.)

$10,000

Utilities , Internet, Telephone 12 months

$6,000

Operations, Marketing, Advertising  12 months

$12,000

Visiting Artists Fees 12 months

$6,000

Professional Training/Seminars 12 months

$6,000

If we don't reach our goal, we will begin where we are and continue to work to get what we need.  First priority is securing the space and materials.

 

The Impact

In the short term your participation in funding and co-creating this project will result in a physical space  and operating resources for the Soul(Art)iculation Community Arts Studio.

The far reaching impact is incalculable for the local community as well as globally.  There is a great deal of research to show the benefits of the arts on artists and their audiences.  Making art is cathartic.  Art making is a safe, non-judging way for our soul to express our feelings.  It shifts emotion. Happier, less stressed people make for a happier, less stressful world.

I am committed to sharing with the world how it feels to make art, to sing, dance and paint.  I am committed to having fun, feeling good and voicing soul.  I am committed to opening and operating this community studio.  I am committed to guiding people to happiness, wholeness and less stress. Feel free to check out my resume here 

Join me and find out how it feels to be instrumental in creating a happier, less stressful world.  Participate, fund and co-create.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Believe me, we appreciate every dollar you contribute.  Yet, we know you may wish to contribute financially and not be in a position to do so.  We have been there.  Or maybe you want to know what you can do above and beyond. Here's what would be of great value to Project Arts & Soul:

You can get the word out and make some noise in your online and off line communities. Tell everyone you know.  Share Project Art & Soul on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinteres and all the rest.  Blog about it.  You get the idea.  Thanks.

And to make it all easy use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello!

 

My name is Stephanie Williams. I go by my shop name online (Rainbow Darkness.) I make and sell my art for a living!

 

I have been selling at conventions for a year and a half and normally attend a small handful a year. Currently, I'm limited in which conventions that I can vend since costs can be pretty expensive. I would really love to expand and vend at bigger cons all across the U.S! To do this, however, I need a little boost!

What does $2,000 cover?

This is my approximate cost for investing in more supplies to expand my art. Additionally, there are other associated costs.

These are the following estimated costs:

To get charms made (just from the selection in this campaign), it would cost $500.

Tables usually run from $100-$500.

Hotels can run anywhere from $200-$500 depending on the convention.

 

Additonally there are other costs such as gas, food, and preparing my car for long trips. 

Indiegogo also takes a cut (4%) as well. If I don't reach my goal, they take a bigger cut (9%.) So help me spread the word so I can meet my goal!

 

In short, the more money raised, the more conventions that I can attend! And of course you get sweet perks for helping out!

 

What are the rewards?

 

Buttons

 

 A mystery block bag filled with mystery goodies from my shop!

 Custom notecards:

 

I even do one of a kind sketches of any character or OC!

And original custom trading cards! 

Perks come with completely FREE worldwide shipping!

 

Even if you cannot donate, spreading the world helps! Share this on Facebook, Twitter, or any other platform that you're comfortable with.

 

Thanks for looking!

I even do one of a kind sketches of any character or OC!

And original custom trading cards! 

Perks come with completely FREE worldwide shipping!

 
Even if you cannot donate, spreading the world helps! Share this on Facebook, Twitter, or any other platform that you're comfortable with.
 
Thanks for looking!

story:
My Story

It took me years to get to where I am. I have overcome several obstacles from broken marriages to losing a great job to starting my dream job. I fought and continued to work long hours to make my dream come true of having my own personal training business. I love helping women transform their lives by changing their physiques. I also train, guide and prepare figure and bikini competitors for competition. This is my passion because I am also a figure competitor and have been for 10 years. After taking 6 years off from competing I found out the NPC now offers a division for figure over 45 and they are offering a pro card for the overall winner. I couldn't resist and got the bug to compete again at the age of 48. It was a challenge and I wondered if I could take my physique to that level of competition as I did 6 years earlier. I had to try and to my surprise I placed 4th at my first competition in age category 40 to 50 at The Emerald Cup. I then went on to compete at Masters Nationals at placed 4th in age category 45 to 50. It was a dream come true at my age. However my goal was to get my IFBB Pro card and the only one that is offered is in the NPC Masters Nationals. Hearing this you might understand why I have to try again and give it my all. My goal is to get my face out there competing in two other shows leading up to Masters Nationals. This will help when I get to Masters Nationals and the judges remember me from the other shows. Becoming a pro will not only be the most rewarding victory for me but it will also give me more credibility with my business and working with my figure clients. Growing my own business has been my dream from day one. I want to be the best I can be at what I do. I want to be the best coach for my figure competitors and other clients. My competitions run from June through July of 2011. I need funds for flight, hotel, competition suits, spray tan, my personal coach, make-up artist and food. Your donation will help me attain my goal!

The Impact

Realizing this dream will impact my family and friends in so many ways. The accomplishment will inspire other women around my same age to know they are empowered to pursue their dreams and know that at any age your dreams can come true.

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

The funds earned will go towards flight, hotel, competition suits, spray tan, nutrition coach, make-up artist and food for three competitions starting June through the end of July. Please help me become amazing at 49!

Be sure to check out my perk and pick your favorite.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you arn't able to contribute at this time you can still help by spreading the word about my journey. Any help you can give would be greatly appreciated. Please share my plea with others. Thank You!

story:
I'm Ryan van Steenburgh, a VFX artist based out of Toronto Canada.

This campaign is to raise funds to publish an art book of drawings done over the last several years.

By contributing you are helping realize a long term ambition of having an ever expanding stack of passionate drawings published. And help my work be recognized beyond my sketch books.

I'll need $5, 000 dollars to cover layout, design and publication costs. As well as costs to digitally paint some of the drawings to flush out their full potential.

By sponsoring this project you'll receive a digital version of the art book, or a hardcopy of the book, and even be acknowledged as a sponsor in a "Thank you" section at the back of this first edition print.

If the full fundraising goal isn't met, I'll still do a limited edition print of the book, so sponsors get a copy, as well as a digital edition.

This Art Book project is sure to be as rewarding to the contributor as it is for me the creator. It gives chance for these drawings to be seen and inspire others.

Be sure to check out, and share the sponsorship video. And in advance, Thank you.

story:
Our Story

The West Port is Edinburgh’s Soho, a heady mix of booze, bosoms, bespoke tailoring and BOOKS. It would almost be churlish not to celebrate this profusion of pages so we run an annual book festival that plays out over ten wonderful West Port* venues, ranging from singular second-hand bookshops to crisp art spaces and whisky-scented pubs. This year the 2011 WPBF will run from 13-16 October. All events are free.


Run on generosity and goodwill, rather than on any kind of feasible budget, the West Port Book Festival has evolved from a brittle idea into a redoubtable reality. Our aim has been to offer free events to a diverse audience who share our passion for books, bookshops and fun. We have also been creative, dipping into the dressing up box, casting our eye around for new talent and transforming local shops into intimate, innovative venues. Although fond of the past, we're also enthusiastic about the future. We organised the world's first Literary Twestival in 2009.


As a freewheeling community festival run by volunteers we're completely reliant on the generosity of our supporters. It really does make a difference if you can donate even $20 (£12)– or lend us a PA system, then we really would love you forever. Bottles of whisky for authors also go down a treat. This year we're going to be selling West Port Book Festival badges and hand-printed bags and t-shirts to raise money for the festival.


We've managed to scrape together enough pennies to run for the past three years, but there's no room for complacency. We need to go from broke to book festival in 50 days with the help of as many generous supporters as possible. You don't have to be in the US to donate through IndieGoGo; if it's any help, $20 is approximately £12.


Find us at: http://www.westportbookfestival.org


* West Port venues can include places that aren't technically in West Port but share our love of all things bookish.

** The photo of Hannah & Peggy, the directors, in Edinburgh Books is by Chris Scott: http://www.chrisdonia.co.uk



The Impact

The West Port has seven bookshops, one bindery, two vintage clothes shops, one rum club and much more. It's a lively and eclectic stretch just off Edinburgh's historic Grassmarket, below the castle. However, it's also an area unfortunately known for its strip joints and the customers they tend to attract. So, our aim has always been to promote the area's bookish assets at a time when bookshops, and other independent shops, need all the help they can get. 


Our festival has been running for four years now and has, we hope, made a difference to the brilliant shops in the West Port, and also to the local community. We hope we've made a difference, too, when it comes to giving bookish events, new authors and new ventures a chance. We began with an aim to be a book festival that people who'd never been to a book festival would like to come to: our audiences tell us we're succeeding.



What We Need & What You Get

We've always been a fan of 'making do,' as were our grannies before us, so we need very little - but what we need, we can't run without. The cost of our (beautiful, exquisite, beloved, collected, treasured) print programme is covered by the adverts within it. For everything else, we need your help. We're completely run by volunteers and no one gets paid. They might get some nifty presents though...

Here's the cost breakdown:

printing costs    £325
venue hire    £150
sound system    £239
stools   £44
misc (paper plates, emergency biscuits, duct tape, bottled water, etc.)    £50
bank charges for one year and transfer costs   £160
travel and accommodation for authors    £350
author presents     £150
grand total     £1468 ($2390)

If we don't raise the full amount we'll go ahead anyway. It would be much more amusing if we did have the money though and it would save us from chewing our nails in a filthy manner that our grannies would not be proud of.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can let people know about our campaign, or you can send us 'in kind' donations of anything that will get through customs. West Port Book Festival, c/o Edinburgh Books, 145-147 West Port, Edinburgh, EH8 9NJ.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About Jim Power and The Legendary Mosaic Trail

For over 25 years, Jim Power, aka The Mosaic Man, has created one of the largest and longest lasting public arts projects with his Legendary Mosaic Trail. The trail of whimsical mosaic designs on lamp poles, planters, sidewalks and storefronts throughout New York City are some of the most recognizable and universally acclaimed works by a local artist. The various pieces are often dedicated to an historical event, person, or landmark, i.e. 9/11 or the former Fillmore East, or simply act as sign-posts and markers. The works are, for the most part, created using recycled materials, built to last, unique to the city, and add a great deal to the quality of life in the neighborhood. In 1988, Jim was authorized by the DOT to build up to 80 light poles. In 2004, he was inducted into the City Lore Peoples Hall of Fame and received an official proclamation from Mayor Bloomberg recognizing him for his selfless contribution to the city. Over the years, Jim's work has been featured in countless television programs, newspapers, books and magazines worldwide.

All that, and Jim has never received any significant funding for his project from the city or outside groups. And, unfortunately, due to vandalism and destruction, only about a quarter of the lamp posts that make up the original trail are still fully intact.

So, he turns to you...

Now, you can help support the rebuilding of The Legendary Mosaic Trail!

Jim is as excited as ever to continue his work so that generations to come will enjoy where his whimsical imagination has taken him and his work throughout the years. He hopes you’ll join him on his quest to leave a lasting mark on the city and complete the trail!

What Jim Needs & What You Get

Jim seeks to raise $80,000 that will go toward rebuilding approximately half of the damaged lamp poles along The Mosaic Trail.

Not only will your contribution help support the rebuilding of a part of New York City history, but you will also receive exciting and unique perks related to the trail itself, from stickers or T-shirts featuring Jim's designs, to one-of-a-kind original pieces of art or "artwear," to opportunities to have your image or brand included on a pole for all to see! Read through the perks at right for all the details!

Proceeds will go toward supporting all facets of the rebuilding of the trail:

  • Crew: two teams of up to four workers who will assist Jim with all prepwork, as well as help build out the poles in the field.  
  • Artistic Materials: tile, salvaged dishware, glass, etc. (Material donations are welcome! Contact Jim if you have materials to offer).
  • Construction Materials & Tools: glue, grout, mesh, sealer, cutters, scrapers, sponges
  • Transportation: as you can see in the video above, Jim has severe hip deterioration and is partially disabled. Transportation of people and materials to and from work sites, be it by bus, cab, or motorized scooter will help streamline the daily routine and provide Jim and the crew as much time and relief as possible from the hardships of this very physical work so it may continue unabated.

The Impact

"My master plan is to draw the anxiety out of the city with beauty." – Jim Power

2012 was quite the year for Jim. With a renewed sense of purpose, he had one of the most prolific creative periods of his artistic career. From signage and a series of murals at several local businesses and residential buildings, to various workshops, his involvement with the Tiles For America 9/11 Memorial, producing one-of-a-kind mosaic belt buckles for his Etsy shop, and his continued work on The Legendary Mosaic Trail, Jim was extremely busy!

And his work did not go unnoticed. Jim’s work was featured in The New York Post, The New York Times, The Villager, The Etsy Blog, and he was thrilled when National Geographic named his Mosaic Trail a top downtown destination in their recently published guidebook, “Walking New York.” He was most recently selected as a Featured Artist at the first ever Etsy Holiday Pop-up Shop in SoHo.

But, Jim’s not out for fame. He makes his art for the community that he loves and that loves him so dearly in return. He is, most of all, thankful for the continued support from the people throughout the years. 2013 actually marks the 25th Anniversary since The Village Voice coined the name “Mosaic Man” for Jim. Time sure does fly, but Jim has no plans to slow down. His major aim for the coming years is to see his series of 80 lamp poles along The Legendary Mosaic Trail to completion. 

Jim actually started his very first mosaic lamp pole on Memorial Day weekend, so there would be no more fitting way for "The Mosaic Man" to mark the occasion than for him to start on the rebuilding following a successful campaign 25 years later! 

Help Jim fund his campaign by Friday, May 24th and join him as he completes his masterpiece!

Thank you in advance for your generous contribution.

— Jim Power, aka The Mosaic Man

 

P.S. Don't forget to help spread the word about the campaign, too!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools above to tell your friends about the project!
  • And keep up with all the latest from Jim:

On his official website MosaicManNYC.com

On Facebook

On Twitter

On Pinterest

On Google+

 

Video courtesy of Etsy as part of their Handmade Portraits Video Series. Special thanks to Tara Young and her team for the wonderful profile.

story:
Short Summary

I'm an artist and activist concerned about our fragile environment. In the last year, I've shifted my focus to the conditions of our rivers, shores and ocean and begun to scuba dive in order to take my environmentalism to new depths. One of the most horrific impact things I've learned is the destruction of invasive lionfish.

Lionfish were introduced by irresponsible aquaria owners who released the fish into the wild. With 18 venomous spines and no predators, the lionfish have proliferated into the millions!

In this campaign, I'm selling artwork to sponsor my volunteering in Florida.

Each contribution is greatly appreciated!

 

What 's Needed & What You Get

Funding defrays the cost of:

  • Travel
  • Chartering boats before the competition (to remove as many lionfish during the week I'm in Florida)
  • Renting equipment, filling air

Perks include:

  • photographic prints
  • ink drawings
  • satisfaction that you helped preserve marine biodiversity

The Impact

Your contributions help:

  • Protect our fragile coral reef marine life
  • Improve biodiversity
  • Share the importance of invasive species management
  • Educate the world about the coral reefs
  • Support contemporary art

Risks & Challenges

Scuba diving and lionfish removal are time intensive and dangerous. Each dive lasts about 25 minutes, due to nitrogen build up. It's also an activity that very expensive. To engage the problem of invasive lionfish I have:

  • Taken an 8-week course in safe scuba diving.
  • Taken additional coursework aimed at the specific issues of deep diving
  • Purchased scuba diving equipment

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help but can't afford a donation, please consider

  • Sharing the campaign on social media
  • Emailing friends who may be interested
  • Educate yourself about invasive species and responsible pet ownership

If you'd like to donate but do not want a perk, or donate another amount, please visit

https://www.gofundme.com/f/lionfishing

or send a check

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME REVIEWING THIS CAMPAIGN!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you'd like to help but can't afford a donation, please consider

Sharing the campaign on social media
Emailing friends who may be interested
Educate yourself about invasive species and responsible pet ownership

If you'd like to donate but do not want a perk, or donate another amount, please visit
https://www.gofundme.com/f/lionfishing
or send a check
 THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME REVIEWING THIS CAMPAIGN!

story:
I am an artist currently living in Brooklyn, New York. I have been working and showing for the last 20 years. For the last 4 years  I have been working and applying to Master programs.

This year I was accepted to a MFA studio arts program at Minneapolis Collage of Art and Design (MCAD). I have been able to pay for most of my tuition through working, scholarships and Government loans, but I still fall short.

This indiegogo campaign is to raise enough money to pay for the rest of the tuition and to afford to move.

I am trying to raise $4000. The move to Minneapolis, MN from Brooklyn, NY will cost close to $2000. The rest will go to pay the remainder of my tuition for the first semester.

As a thank you for donating everyone no matter how small a donation will receive a thank you letter/postcard from me. I am offering original works of art as "perks" for larger donations, I have pieces that are ready for you to chose from, but I also will be making the work especially for you. All donations of $25 and above will include a set of postcards of my paintings. Below you will find examples of the work in each size.

More work can also be seen at:

http://www.ericyevak.com

If you are in the Brooklyn, New York area you can also contact me for a studio visit.

At: ericyevak@gmail.com 

My studio will be open till late of August (I should be getting ready to move then)

I really appreciate all the help and support, but I understand that times are tough. If you can't help right now with a donation that's OK,  you can simply help by sharing this campaign that would be amazing and I do really appreciate it. Thank you.

Big thank you to Alain Moyal for filming my campaign video.


Some examples of the 13"x19" works on paper:


Some examples of the 12"x12" works on wood:


Some examples of the 24"x24" works on wood:


Some examples of the 36"x36" works on wood:


Some examples of the 36"x48" works on wood:

story:
What Are We? 

We are a production artist paper mill in Minneapolis Minnesota, one of the very few places in the United States still making paper by hand. We are dedicated to teaching interns how to make the rugged and rustically beautiful paper for which we are known worldwide. 

After 24 years of operation, we are transitioning to a worker owned cooperative so we can expand papermaking opportunities for artists, interns, and the all members of the community who want to follow their paper arts passions. One of the two original founders has left the business for health reasons, and the other founder would like to retire. Why not continue teaching and making paper as a coop? By Laws and Articles of Incorporation have been written, a business plan and feasibility study is underway, and a membership brochure is written and waiting to be printed. But we are at a critical financial point in our transition, and we need your support.

Where Your Contribution Goes

There are a number of one-time expenses related to our transition, which includes moving our production operations and equipment to a new space which will accommodate multiple worker-owners. It’s shocking how much new electrical wiring, a rigger that moves the machinery, and our raw material costs. Additional transition expenses include fees for accounting, tax filing, legal consulting, and travel to trade fairs and conferences to promote the coop. In the unfortunate event we are unable to meet our financial goal, your donations will go towards the expenses in the order listed. In appreciation for your contributions, we have a variety of cool perks including handmade paper, credit towards coop membership, handmade books, stationary, artist's books, and more.

What We Do These are just some of the wonderful endeavors that we have been bringing to its local and international community. If we close, here is what would be lost:

- The unique paper we produce, which is valued by artists worldwide for its strength, durability, deep coloration, rugged beauty, handmade quality, and lack of chemical ingredients. Our paper  been used for diverse art projects, including hand-bound books durable enough to be passed down for generations, and large sculptural works of art. Its loss would impact the creative opportunities of many artists, both current and those yet to come.

- An educational resource with a well-established internship program that has trained over 120 interns in all facets of hand papermaking production. Our interns have gone on to not only production hand papermaking, but also the fields of paper art, museum curating, paper distribution and sales, bookbinding, paper and art conservation, education and more.

- A facility where people can utilize and expand their skills in the pursuit of their own creative works. The facility provides an opportunity to pass along the knowledge and experience of production hand papermaking methods acquired over 24 years of operation to a broad community of people.

- A paper mill that caters to special orders for creative projects. For example, We made a 60 foot sheet of paper strong enough to be folded into a life-sized origami elephant.

- A creative force with a track record of expanding the potential of handmade paper by collaborating with respected and internationally known artists, and for promoting this underappreciated craft. Collaboration directs concepts and technical know-how towards a shared purpose. Artistic experimentation with handmade paper creates remarkable energy and produces dynamic work.

The Future Coop

We need your support to continue working towards opening as a coop. It will be feasible to secure the financial future of us with worker owner artists who will make and sell paper to provide continuing revenue, and investment owners to provide further funding.

Worker owners will also have the opportunity to pursue their own artistic and commercial paper arts projects with full use of the equipment at the mill.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to your contribution, or if you are unable to make a financial contribution at this time, please help us get the word out about our campaign. Use your social media favorites to let people know about us with a link to our campaign. We would welcome help in other ways too, such as legal input, accounting services, and more.

Keep Us Alive

Handmade paper is more than a means to an end, it is a carrier of knowledge. We help people realize their artistic endeavors, a romanticized version of its industrial counterpart.

Finished papers are works of art in themselves, exhibiting tactile textures and soft finishes on thick, crisp sheets, strong enough to make books and art that will be passed down many generations. Please help us pass us down to future generations.

We greatly appreciate your ongoing support. Every level of contribution helps.

Keep us alive!

About Us

Amanda Degener is one of our two original founders. It is her strong desire to pass along the knowledge and experience of production hand papermaking, and the legacy, to the next generation. She believes it is important to keep us open as an education center teaching interns the production of rugged and rusticly beautiful paper for which we are known worldwide.

Amanda Degener obtained her Master’s Degree from Yale School of Art, where she used her own handmade paper to realize ideas in large-scale sculpture. In 1985, she co-founded the not-for-profit organization called Hand Papermaking Magazine whose primary focus was publishing the biannual Hand Papermaking Magazine. (Hand Papermaking is based in Twin Cities and still publishing biannually), For three years Amanda Degener was the first Artist-in-Residence at the fledgling Minnesota Center for Book Arts and later became their first Artistic Director. She has co-organized four national hand papermaking conferences as well as lectured, taught, and exhibited her work around the world. Teaching locations include China, Sweden, Japan, Italy, Taiwan, and the United States. Her community service work includes serving on multiple local and national boards of directors including Forecast Public Art and Haystack School.

James Kleiner is our first employee, hired primarily to pull sheets of paper. He is a graduate of the Minneapolis College of Art and Design and is currently a member of Hack Factory and Leg Up Studio. James has exhibited his work locally, nationally, and in China. The Minnesota Regional Arts Commission awarded James The Next Step Grant to explore the crafting of traditional hand papermaking moulds. James was also featured in Hand Papermaking Magazine’s issue devoted to artists under 30 or the future of the hand papermaking field. The article included a tipped in paper sample of his making in each copy of the issue. He was chosen as a key player in the next generation of papermakers and paper artists because his work reflects technical and artistic experimentation in hand papermaking.

Quotes from Our Supporters

Mark Dimunation, Rare Book & Special Collections Division Library of Congress

“The Library of Congress holds in their collection books made with our Paper. Our willingness to work with artisans to produce just the right paper for a specific project can be seen in The Lost Journals of Sacajawea by Debra Magpie Earling and Peter Koch. The publisher, Peter Koch commissioned us to make Walnut dyed flax to look and feel like buffalo hide. This "hide" paper is an integral part of the success of this book.”

Timothy Barrett, MacArthur Fellow/Papermaker/Author/Educator

“Paper has a long history of perseverance, commitment, hard work, innovation, artist collaborations, training younger folks in the field, and generally inspiring the entire hand papermaking community.  Their new future direction is well worth our support and enthusiastic backing. Please contribute whatever you can and together we will help us make this transition as smooth and rewarding as possible for all concerned!”

Verra Blough, Paper Department Manager at Wet Paint Artists’ Materials & Framing

“We are very fortunate to stock Papers at Wet Paint…they are truly a beautiful collection of handmade papers.  That they are locally-made is a major plus, too! Papers are sought out by name by a variety of discerning artists, from book makers to designers, printmakers to photographers.  Anytime I show Papers to my customers, I get the “Whoa, I love that!” response! My personal favorite is the Solid Indigo. It’s so rich in color and texture, it’s really like nothing else. The skill and passion that goes into making Papers is evident in every single sheet.”

Helen Hiebert, Artist/Author/Educator

“Paper is one of the few studios in the world where artists, bookmakers and craftspeople can acquire sheets of unique and durable handmade paper. It is a studio where young artists, conservators, and bookmakers can learn about the traditional craft, as well as the art of handmade paper. Paper is approaching their 25th year in business, and they need a little help from us so that they can continue for another 25. Paper is an integral part of the papermaking scene, and I hope you will join me in supporting their new venture as well as the future of hand papermaking!“

Marge Salik, Principle of Talas

“Amanda Degener and Bridget O'Malley were the two brave women who pioneered the production of papers literally in a cave, hence our name. The papers are the strongest papers on the market and can be used for covering books if leather is not an option.  The colors and designs are unique, including Degener Black and O'Malley Crackle. Talas has had a wonderful relationship with the Cave company since we purchased Talas in 1994. The relationship is continuing with the coop. Our customers, bookbinders and artists love the papers for their unique quality and we recently added some new additions to our inventory.”

Jana Pullman, Bookbinder

“Because paper is strong and has great color it has helped me doing many different things. Book repair, new books, and boxes.”

 Winifred Lutz, Artist and Educator

"What a beautiful and impressive video you all produced for the fund raising campaign! I had to write and let you know. It was really moving. I have forwarded it .... (to others) in hopes that they will contribute. I have and send you best wishes for every success in this.  Clarity, organization, professionalism, and dedication to the craft radiate from all parts of this request for contributions."

 Hiromi Paper International

"As purveyors of multipurpose papers, one of our biggest pleasures is introducing people to Paper. When people come into our showroom armed with descriptors that so clearly define Paper--strong, thick, durable, striking, unique, artwork in itself, present, etc.-- they enter with little hope which quickly dissipates upon inspection of the Papers. Over the many years working with Paper, our community has not been disappointed. We treasure the value of Papers, always and forever."

Joe Stefko, Charnel House

Charnel House has produced 15 books to date using Paper. They are some of the most interesting and beautiful books to come out of this house. Amanda has even made paper with rose petals in and on her Degener Black for one of my for a Dean Koontz limited editions. This is something that must be preserved and handled with care. We have lost so much art to commerce but Paper must thrive. This is important. It is our duty.

Hans Koch, Coop Steering Committee

"When the viewers see all the value demonstrated in the video, they will see it in the context of not only what is special about Paper, but most importantly, what would be lost without their support."

story:
[日本語解説はこちら]


The concept behind BrushKnob


My name is Wataru Kami. I am currently working as a concept artist at a production company in Tokyo, Japan. I am also a creator in the broader sense when I go home to my keyboard and soldering iron.

About a year ago, I started to sketch in between my breaks at work, then testing these prototypes on real jobs which later led to the completion of this device: BrushKnob.

BrushKnob is a very simple control device that allows the user to intuitively operate Photoshop tools. There are only 2 functions: a) the knob controls the brush size, and b) the switch allows you to switch between the brush and the eraser tools.

Typical keyboard signals are used in the transmission with the computer so you will not need to install a special, separate driver. All you need to do is to connect the cable to your computer and the device will work.

The computer recognizes BrushKnob as an extra keyboard. When you turn the knob or press the button, the system interprets the signals as keyboard shortcuts. BrushKnob can therefore be used with any application (not just Photoshop) as long as the same keyboard shortcuts are assigned.

Of course if you so wish for it, you can change the keyboard shortcut settings on the application side. It is possible to use BrushKnob in various ways.

I am very confident that artists and creators throughout the world will find this prototype a useful and nifty tool to have. It is my dream for BrushKnob to eventually be bundled in a proper package and delivered to people around the world.


Features


BrushKnob not only has a GPLv3 license. It has through-holes at the bottom of the body enabling easy access to all pins of the ATtiny85 micro controller.


D.F.Mac. who is also making the devices using AVR has made MIDI library called VUSBMidiAttiny compatible with BrushKnob!

As such, you can customize BrushKnob easily, if you have knowledge of AVR or Arduino!


Featured on



Technical data


Signals Type

HID US Keyboard (USB1.0)

Knob: ‘[‘ ‘]’

Switch? ‘b’ ‘e’

Supported OSs

Windows

OSX

Body Materials

Knob: Aluminium

Case: Acryl

Bolt & Nut: Stainless steel

Connector: Stainless steel

Chip

Atmel ATtiny85

Code

GitHub

Size

Knob: ?20mm

Length: 75mm

Width: 30mm

Height: 35mm

Accessory

USB Cable (A to B)


* BrushKnob's behavior is dependent on the computer's keyboard settings. "BrushKnob Standard" is programmed to function correctly on computers connected to English keyboards. (and "JP Ver" sends Japanese keyboard signals. If you have US keyboard PC/Mac, please choose the "Standard" type.)

*BrushKnobの挙動はPCのキーボード設定に依存します。英語キーボードが接続されているPCでは「BrushKnob Standard」を、日本語キーボードが接続されているPCで使用する場合は「BrushKnob JP Ver.」を選んでください。また、OSの言語設定自体には影響されません。（たとえば、日本語キーボードが接続された環境の多くでは、「BrushKnob Standard」をつなげた場合、'[' ではなく '@' が入力されます。）


Funding Plan & Timeline


While I plan to modify and improve BrushKnob's design based on mass production numbers, most of the usable operations are already completed at this time. I really hope that many people will support my product!

If I manage to raise enough fund, I would also like to include printed logo stickers with BrushKnob too. Long live stickers!


Risks & Challenges


Although BrushKnob is a very simple prototype, I will need to overcome many, extremely complicated processes in order to have it mass produced and delivered to every one. I am a professional designer and prudent in my planning. This is not likely to change in the future. Nevertheless, I know that I am new to this and supporters of myself and my product will undoubtedly have to face some risks. Therefore I would like to express my deepest gratitude and thanks in advance to every one who decides to support me. I promise to do my best. Please help by purchasing BrushKnob!


Other Ways You Can Help


For those whose hardware/software is not compatible with my device, please feel free to visit my website. I will be very happy if anyone is interested in the anime, games, or even individual works listed there!

Last but not least, please introduce BrushKnob to your friends if you think they might be interested in it. Thank you.

Wataru Kami

*BrushKnobの挙動はPCのキーボード設定に依存します。英語キーボードが接続されているPCでは「BrushKnob Standard」を、日本語キーボードが接続されているPCで使用する場合は「BrushKnob JP Ver.」を選んでください。また、OSの言語設定自体には影響されません。（たとえば、日本語キーボードが接続された環境の多くでは、「BrushKnob Standard」をつなげた場合、'[' ではなく '@' が入力されます。）


Funding Plan & Timeline

While I plan to modify and improve BrushKnob's design based on mass production numbers, most of the usable operations are already completed at this time. I really hope that many people will support my product!

If I manage to raise enough fund, I would also like to include printed logo stickers with BrushKnob too. Long live stickers!


Risks & Challenges


Although BrushKnob is a very simple prototype, I will need to overcome many, extremely complicated processes in order to have it mass produced and delivered to every one. I am a professional designer and prudent in my planning. This is not likely to change in the future. Nevertheless, I know that I am new to this and supporters of myself and my product will undoubtedly have to face some risks. Therefore I would like to express my deepest gratitude and thanks in advance to every one who decides to support me. I promise to do my best. Please help by purchasing BrushKnob!


Other Ways You Can Help


For those whose hardware/software is not compatible with my device, please feel free to visit my website. I will be very happy if anyone is interested in the anime, games, or even individual works listed there!
Last but not least, please introduce BrushKnob to your friends if you think they might be interested in it. Thank you.
Wataru Kami
[日本語解説はこちら]

story:
I am doing a senior thesis project/exhibition on the artistic culture surrounding Madrid's democratic transition following Francisco Franco's death. I need help raising funds so I can acquire exhibition quality material and make sure my senior thesis show is the best it can possibly be. 

About Me

My name is Winona Bechtle and I am a senior at Scripps College in Claremont, California. I am pursuing a dual major in Hispanic Studies and Media Studies, which means I will combine my two areas of interest into one cohesive project at the end of the semester. 

I have spent the last three years of my college career working in as many museums as I can, learning more and more about public relations, exhibition design, and even things as seemingly simple as how to properly hang a painting on a wall. I am currently working at Pomona College Museum of Art, archiving work and documentation of internationally known artist James Turrell. I fully intend to continue my work in museums following my graduation from Scripps College. 

About my Project

I am creating a two-part thesis that explores the musical and visual culture of a period of time in Spain called “La Movida.” Occurring between the mid seventies to the mid eighties, “La Movida” is characterized by the disillusioned, apolitical, and largely unemployed young demographic that emerged following Francisco Franco’s death in 1975. I plan on creating an online presence in the form of a website where I will write a series of articles and essays on a variety of topics ranging from feminism, to Pedro Almodovar's role in Madrid's visual culture, to the dissemination and distribution of Spanish New Wave music during “La Movida.” I will include photographs and music videos alongside these articles to better illustrate the importance of visual culture during this formative decade. By the end of next semester, I plan on converting my website into a hard-copy bilingual catalogue.

As a second part to my thesis, I will present an exhibition on “La Movida” featuring original vinyl albums, poster artifacts, video projections, and exhibition quality prints from artist Mary Ellen Mark with the purpose of reviving this visual culture for a group of my peers as well as the Los Angeles community. 

How You Can Help

  • Donations! Any contribution will go directly to funding the best possible show I can make. With your help I will purchase exhibition quality prints, obtain original Spanish artifacts form this period in time, and design a high quality show.
  • I have already secured a location for my exhibition, but need help to fund its temporary transition into an appropriate museum space. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out about my show! Share my idea with your family and friends.

story:
WHAT IS IN HER WORDS ABOUT?

We know Black Girls Rock, but do we know how far back they were rocking in America? In Her Words takes us as far back as the 1920's,  a time when crimes like lynching were legal and the 1940's and 50's of McCarthyism dictated that you could be accused of treason for any arbitrary thing. Now, imagine creating– amidst that environment of oppression– art that transcended race, bled through inequality and uplifted a nation.

In Her Words is a 50 minute theatrical musical conceived and directed by playwright Khadijah Z. Ali-Coleman that explores the intersection of race, gender and social activism through the lives of six legendary African-American creatives. In Her Words educates the audience while engaging them with emotional theater and musical moments that are drawn directly from the lives of the women portrayed. During the 2014 season, the women explored are:

  • Zora Neale Hurston
  • Lena Horne
  • Nina Simone
  • Katherine Dunham
  • Billie Holiday
  • Lucille Clifton

Click here to meet the cast.

What We Need & What You Get

We toured "In Her Words" in 2012 and 2013 through Washington DC off of the fumes of love and commitment. We are hoping to broaden the audience for this powerful piece and need your help! We would love to earn $10000 but a start of $1000 could cover some bare necessities such as:

  • Travel expenses
  • Venue reservation
  • Costuming
  • Actor stipend

"In Her Words" has minimal staging requirements, but your kind contribution will help us maximize our presentation. If we exceed our goal of $1000, we will apply it to actors' stipend and venue reservation/application fees for possible showcasing in upcoming festivals. Additional funds will also help fund Liberated Muse Arts Group annual festivities.

The Impact

"In Her Words" is a significant work of theatre as it is written and directed by an African-American woman, performed by a talented cast of African-American women and showcases the work of women whose creative voices impacted the social and political landscapes of their times. This production is a must-see for everyone. We have been invited to perform at one of the prestigious Smithsonian Institute Museums in Washington DC, and have been asked to return to venues we've performed in the past. Unfortunately, what we are paid is never enough to cover fully the costs of production.

During our 2012 season, while presenting the piece at Oxon Hill Library, Lucille Clifton's family was in the audience and came to us to tell us what a wonderful job we did portraying their aunt Lucille Clifton. Lucille Clifton's neice had brought her young children to the production and said that the portrayal of Lucille Clifton by actress Colie Williams gave the children an opportunity to know who their aunt really was. This testimony has left an indelible mark on the cast that is returning to the production and the playwright/director.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. You can help by:

  • Getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Donating your products or services to the production-- we need sponsors!
  • Booking Us at Your School, Theatre or Organization

Visit our website here.

story:
Be immersed in the World of Geodo . . .

Cosmic Foam Creations

It's a brand new idea with a lot of love and creativity going into it. This means Geodos offer something that other building toys do not: the rapid construction of all sorts of creative objects and thing-a-ma-jigs.

Quite Simply, Geodos are:

Foam Interlocking Shapes

And they teach children to:

Make Discoveries

To see a child innovate and learn is priceless. With Geodo, you will be participating with your child in a creative process where everyone learns something new. What happens when you start putting these shapes together is amazing because one idea leads to another and before you know it, you and your child have made something truly unique together, that you may have never thought of before.

Real creativity is about being fearless with you own ideas, confident, and at the same time open for collaboration.


This is very exciting because the idea is simple and obvious and yet there are not any toys on the market that feature these kinds of shapes and allow you to put them together in this way. Take a look at what just a few of these Geodo shapes can create. Here is a little hideout that will cover the coffee table made in less than 8 minutes:

Humans like squares because they are just so practical. But what exists outside of our little world of practical? That is what your children get to discover with Geodo. 


How about a floating pyramid?

Invent new floating creations in minutes.

Geodo offers both a technical challenge and a creative challenge that helps children discover the potential of their own mind. Very quickly make things, but also discover what you can do with them. Make a ball that can roll, or a boat that really floats. Make a house or a hat, the possibility is endless.

After over 4 months of fun work dreaming up and answering the question, "What's a Geodo?", it feels really close to being a finished product. Geodo is simple and creative fun, but also a bit puzzling to keep the mind fully engaged.

Please pre-order your Geodo's today so we can build momentum and really go into this with a lot of enthusiasm and sucess.

After getting quotes and dealing with many of the manufactures who cut out foam mats and those ABC bath-time letters, I have developed and mocked up several really cool Geodo Sets. I have cut all these parts out by hand to save on start-up costs. But the real thing will be die cut out of the same EVA foam from a professional facility, yielding smoother edges and perfectly rounded corners.

The major cost involved in getting someone to punch these out is the tooling of the machine that will punch them and ordering all the colored foam stock in large rolls.  


Our rewards are priced as follows:

Prices include US shipping, for international shipping add $20.

About the Geodo BrainStorm Soundtrack:

Every Geodo set includes creativity enhancing music made by video game composer Bryn Braughton. I worked with Bryn continuously throughout the development of the shapes as he interpreted them into music. It really is a stunning production that gets kids dancing and playing freely. All of the music in the video comes from this exclusive soundtrack.


About The 100 Geodo Creations Instructional DVD:

We are also working on a 100 Geodo Creations Instructional DVD, chock full of ideas to get you started. This video production will offer step by step instructions for creating all kinds of float-able and wearable creations. This DVD is included with all donations of  $75 and above.


FUNDING BREAKDOWN

We need to raise $16,000 in order to bring Geodos from concept to reality! This will cover our start-up costs as well as the costs for artwork, countless hours of testing, and materials that have already been invested.

The Production Costs:

  • Manufacturing cost
  • Overseas Freight from Manufacturing
  • US Import Duties & Port Logistics
  • DVD & Case Manufacture
  • Geodo Soundtrack Music Royalty & Licensing
  • Toy Containers / Label & Packing
  • Shipping Boxes
  • Ship Reward to Donor 


Hi, my name is Noah. I am 28, a father of two and I love to create new things. I have worked on creative projects for many years. My experiences working as a 3D modeler for film and instructing university classes have given me a unique vision for new toys. I really hope you are inspired by the models I have made with my daughters. But there are a million other ideas to discover. That's why you should order some today!

100% Money Back Guarantee

This project is backed by a money back guarantee, both on my own part and by indiegogo, that if for some unforeseen circumstance the Geodo project cannot go into full production at this time, I will give you a full refund of your donation value. Or even if you are not satisfied with your Geodo Product for any reason, I will kindly refund your donation value. According to the terms of Indiegogo, I am legally bound to deliver or refund. I stand behind this 100%.

I have the essential skills and vision needed for following through and delivering a fantastic product and I want you to feel confident and positive about helping the cause. This really is a labor of love and I am excited to send you some.  If you are excited about this opportunity to create new things, then please donate today . . . to encourage us and spur our project along into full production!  We are greatful for all the support. And you will have a lot of fun with your Geodos, I guarantee it.

Geodos For Charity

While we were figuring costs, we decided to take the step and reach out. For every 100 Geodo shapes that are manufactured, we will be sending 10 Geodo shapes to orphanages around the world. Help us send these colorful cans of hope & inspiration to children everywhere!

Our Charity Shipments will be sent to:

Share Africa, Maya's Hope & Orphans Lifeline

Thank you for caring, donating, and sharing this page with your friends!

story:
My name is Quentin”kwenci”Jones, I’m a visual arts specialist since 1980. I have created a variety of multicultural, multidisciplinary artworks which include 2D Drawings, Graphic Paintings, 3D art Sculptures, Murals, Metal works, Wood and Interior Design Projects which can be seen in a few cities, with most of my productions in the Greater New York area.

This initial project Brooklyn Central is the restoration of a 16 year old mural. 

Located at Ocean & Flatbush Ave; it is one of the busiest intersections in Brooklyn, New York.  

I originally painted this 120ft panoramic scene in 1998 to cover graffiti. However the weather and years has taken its toll. So I started the restoration in the summer of 2012 as an art education initiative. I included college students from Pratt Institute, Kings Borough College, young men doing community service through the DA’s Alternative Sentencing program, interns from the Crown Heights Youth Collective and neighborhood volunteers in the set-up process. The funding was sparse, but with the help of the 20 participants the mural is set-up for me to detail.

 




What We Need & What You Get

The summer of 2014 there is no funding. I need to complete this restoration this summer. I need funding to buy paints, brushes, transportation, media & promotional costs, a stipend as an operating expense and most importantly and the highest cost in my budget; A UV mural treatment. I have to initially apply an isolation coat to protect the artwork and then a second coat of Ultra violet protective varnish. I have to purchase enough of each treatment to cover the entire 20' x 120' area to protect and preserve this iconic artwork for another generation.

The funding will assist in the completion of this restoration and/or contribute to the continuation of the Muralopolis mission: To provide public art programs and projects in the greater NYC area where people live, work and play.Your contribution to this project cannot be overstated.

We have some great gifts that say thank you and let others know you are a contributor that made that difference.

Post Card ($25)- You will receive a limited edition post card addressed to you of the completed mural .

T-Shirt ($50)- You will receive a Muralopolis T-shirt and a signed proclamation,

Signed Poster ($100)-  You will receive a poster of the mural addressed to you and signed by Quentin "kwenci" Jones, the artist.

Name on Website ($250)- You or your company will be added to our website as a supporter of the Mural project.

Name on Wall ($500)- You or your company will be added to the mural wall as a supporter of the Mural project, plus a signed poster.

VIP ($1000)- You or your company will be placed on the wall and you will be invited to the final reveal and introduced as one of the major supporters of the Mural project, plus a plaque proclaiming you as a major contributor to this worldwide project.

The Impact

Over the years this mural has become a Crown Heights landmark. Across the street from the Botanic Gardens and Prospect Park It has been viewed by thousands of New Yorkers and visitors from all over the world. In a community of residents, commuters, tourist, friends, supporters and young adults, who were teenagers when it was first painted. It is a landmark attraction in this neighborhood. People take pictures of themselves with their families under the images and point out the many animals to their children and friends. Other artist from various disciplines use this mural as a backdrop for their own projects. This is a working community mural. It's function and beauty has served many people since 1998. The restoration of this mural is paramount to this community. I have painted several large public art projects in the greater New York area with corporations, organizations and the private sector. I have three large murals in Brooklyn. Also as a teaching artist I have an extensive track record in the school systems of various municipalities. 

Feel free to  visit the website @ www.muralopolis.org. 

This campaign's purpose: The completion of this mural restoration and to continue creating all-inclusive and exclusive public art project like this continuing on a year-round basis.



Risks & Challenges

This is hurricane season. There is a risk of having to extend my completion deadline due to inclement weather. That's minuscule compared to the risk of losing all the work we have done to the the exposure of not having a protective coating. I have reached out to all the politicians, neighborhood associations and the public is asking for funding with emails. If I don't have the funds to purchase the materials.   I will visit the offices of the politicians, I will ask to be put on the agenda of every community board and agency involved, I will go to the media, whatever it takes to keep this landmark intact. I will not leave this mural unprotected.  I have dealt with many entities in my 34 years of doing public art. This is a campaign I know how to campaign.

Your contribution to this project cannot be overstated. Together we can make this happen. So please give generously. Thank you.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • In-kind donations
  • References of resources
  • Recommendations or endorsements
  • Forward the need for help through the social media
  • Petition your local politician
