Other artist from various disciplines use this mural as a backdrop for their own projects. This is a working community mural. It's function and beauty has served many people since 1998. The restoration of this mural is paramount to this community. I have painted several large public art projects in the greater New York area with corporations, organizations and the private sector. I have three large murals in Brooklyn. Also as a teaching artist I have an extensive track record in the school systems of various municipalities. 
Feel free to  visit the website @ www.muralopolis.org. 
This campaign's purpose: The completion of this mural restoration and to continue creating all-inclusive and exclusive public art project like this continuing on a year-round basis.



Risks & Challenges
 This is hurricane season. There is a risk of having to extend my completion deadline due to inclement weather. That's minuscule compared to the risk of losing all the work we have done to the the exposure of not having a protective coating. I have reached out to all the politicians, neighborhood associations and the public is asking for funding with emails. If I don't have the funds to purchase the materials.   I will visit the offices of the politicians, I will ask to be put on the agenda of every community board and agency involved, I will go to the media, whatever it takes to keep this landmark intact. I will not leave this mural unprotected.  I have dealt with many entities in my 34 years of doing public art. This is a campaign I know how to campaign.
Your contribution to this project cannot be overstated. Together we can make this happen. So please give generously. Thank you.
  Other Ways You Can Help 

In-kind donations
References of resources
Recommendations or endorsements
Forward the need for help through the social media
Petition your local politician

story:
" Freedom Fighter "

             A bust of Nelson Mandela     

                                                         ~  sculpture by Anne H. Pollack  


The effort of this fundraiser is to ensure that MANDELA Lives ON!
 
In the minds and the hearts of children in underserved areas      (in two local high schools, that are named after Mandela); and for a Community Center in Harlem, where outstanding community outreach echos all that Mandela stood for  (The Lt. Jos. P. Kennedy Center) the reminder of a true giant is a source of great inspiration and hope. This public art project is dedicated to keeping Nelson Mandela's extraordinary message, and his memory alive!


Castings of the sculptural bust will be placed on permanent display in the following locations:

  • The Nelson Mandela High School ~ Mt. Vernon, NY

(dedicated to 'giving underserved students a second chance to succeed')


  • The Lt. Joseph P. Kennedy Center ~ East Harlem, NY
(where comprehensive community resources are offered to people of all ages, providing physical, spiritual, creative, social, educational, and health support...all under one roof!)


 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The cost of casting the sculpture is not small...but it is within reach!  The expense of casting includes: mold creation, casting, pedestal expenses, and transportation of the sculpture and pedestal  

 Your donation is so appreciated.   Your contribution to:

                               MANDELA Lives ON! 

...will be acknowledged with an invitation to a reception at one of the three locations...at the time the sculpture is 'unveiled.'

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


      ~ All that you can do to get the word out is greatly appreciated! ~

story:
We are THRILLED to announce that we have hit our Indiegogo goal early.Thank you so much for your generous contributions to make Eternal Return a reality. We are immensely grateful to each of you for your belief and support of this project. 

Let's keep it going...
With your contributions we will now be able to purchase tons of needed material! We have logged thousands of hours, but still have a lot more to do - any funds that exceed our goal will be used to cover additional expenses including steel, rent, transportation and more material. Please continue to share and post as we near our deadline. Perks are still available. 

••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

Let the countdown begin! We have five months to complete Hudzo's long awaited and most dynamic piece yet, Eternal Return, and we need your help!

Who is Hudzo?

Meet artist and designer, Peter Hudson. Hudzo creates large-scale kinetic sculptures, best described as stroboscopic zoetropes, that animate universal questions and metaphorical states to transport the viewer into contemplative, transcendental realities

What is a Stroboscopic Zoetrope?

Zoetropes are remarkably qualified to portray the cyclical nature of life. A zoetrope is a cylindrical device that produces the illusion of motion from a rapid succession of static pictures. Instead of drawings and shutters, Hudzo uses sculptures and strobe lights to achieve the same effect, creating a three-dimensional motion picture. 

The central focus of Hudzo's art is dedicated to creating these large-scale stroboscopic zoetropes that engage environment, body, and spirit, while pushing the boundaries of kinetic sculpture. All of these works are interactive, and often bear the visual hallmarks of pure invention – incorporating a whimsical mix of interlocking gears, spinning wheels, repetitive motion, and cyclical action. Through touch or physical labor, the public is invited to power the sculpture directly, activating dream-like optical effects or mesmerizing mechanical events.  Beyond the meditative imagery involving cycles or fortitude, the frenetic aspects of his sculpture impart serious questions regarding existence, progress (or lack thereof), consumption and routine.

Earlier works have focused on darker themes, the Sisyphean drudgery of repetitive , never-ending punishment, such as Charon,

and, Homouroboros, which was recently on exhibit at The Exploratorium, the museum of science, art and human perception, in San Francisco.

In contrast, Eternal Return celebrates the joy and ecstasy of life, not just repeated, but begun anew.

Tell me about Eternal Return...

The concept of the Eternal Return speculates that the universe has been recurring, and will continue to recur, in a self-similar form, an infinite number of times across infinite time and space. This concept is touched upon in virtually all cultural and religious narratives.

Hudzo likes to leave his work a mystery to be unveiled only at the Playa, so the rest is up to imagination [and some updates along the way], however rest assured, you will not be disappointed, 

"I have been blessed with the opportunity to realize some of my wildest fantasies. And I’d like to have you be part of the next fantasy. Trust me, if you've liked my earlier works, you'll love Eternal Return!"

How can I help complete Eternal Return?

The creative process begins with the vision of the artist but requires the hands, hearts, and support of a dedicated community to transition from the drawing board to a fully immersive experience. We would be honored if you participated in making this a reality. Your contributions are essential to the success of Eternal Return. 

We have been working on Eternal Return since early 2013, these sculptures take thousands of hours to build and cost hundreds of thousands of dollars to create. We are halfway to completion, and we really need your help! 

Please, Donate now and receive some great perks!

Our goal is to have Eternal Return complete for Burning Man 2014. We'll send every generous funder a perk that represents the sculpture and be Eternally Grateful. 

Monkey Mask:

Opening Night Party on the Playa; photo with Peter Hudson: 

Don't forget to spread the news about the campaign by sending this page to your friends and family! 

Thank you very much for your support, we are eternally grateful,

hudzodesign.com

story:
Please join us as a supporter in what may be a one of a kind traveling adventure.  This trip involves Vito Bonanno, a nationally recognized artist with Autism, and is called Truck’n With Vito!  Akin to the concept of food trucks in the culinary world, Vito has transformed a regular van into a roaming art gallery showcasing his art and art merchandise traveling to various art events and happenings in CT, NY and beyond.  We believe this may be the only truck/vehicle of its kind in the country.

This campaign will bring strong awareness, dare we say even START A MOVEMENT, with regard to the lack of choices for young adults with autism spectrum disorder and other similar neuro-diversities after they graduate high school.  Think of it this way; If you want to open the door but have been given the wrong key, is the door broken?  No, you just need the right key and the door easily opens.  The same is true for people with ASD and the key they need is modified classroom settings and curriculum for higher education and adult vocational training opportunities in art related studies that can lead to employment and professional careers.

TRUCK’N WITH VITO!  will be an inspiration to those on and off the spectrum.  The goal is to promote awareness of the untapped creative and productive lives of these individuals, which may never have a chance to be realized unless the public, businesses and communities change the way they perceive these artists.

Vito was fortunate to have a support group able to seek out and either find or create private instruction situations that have and continue to develop Vito’s talent and craft.  Without this help it seems likely he would not have realized his true artistic talent and current success.  So here is the disturbing question:  How many other Vito’s are out there?  People like anyone with hopes, dreams, desires and talents, but no way to gain access to instruction, education and funding to hone their craft and teach them how to turn it into a profession.  We fear the answer is alarming.

This truth is what fueled the concept of Truck’n With Vito. We feel compelled to bring attention to this educational deficit to all that will listen including state and government agencies.  Please take this journey with us and make a difference in the lives of countless adults.  The cause must start somewhere—let it be here—TRUCK’N WITH VITO!

Learn more about artist Vito Bonanno at www.vitobonanno.com


Check out our great PERKS below to thank you for your support!





Come visit Truck’n With Vito! at the locations noted below.  More will be added as the journey unfolds and announced on Facebook.com/trucknwithvito , Twitter @VitoBonannoArt/trucknwithvito


May 24-June: Vito Bonanno Solo Exhibition, Truck’n With Vito! , Umbrella Arts Gallery NYC Popping up here over the two months. 

May: Indigogo Truck’n With Vito! Campaign Launch Celebration May 24, 2014, Opening Reception 5-7, Umbrella Arts  Gallery, NYC

May: Bushwick Open Studios NY, May 30, 31 and June1

June: Land Gallery NYC

June/JULY:  Umbrella Arts NYC Special Events to be announced


July/Aug:  Uarts at Connecticut Commission on the Arts

September:  Dumbo Arts Festival, NY

September:  IAM Festival, CT

September 22:  Envision Fest, CT

October 3:  LAMP, CT

October:  Open Studios, CT


December:  Wynwood,  Art Basil Miami

January 2015: Metro Curates, NYC





BUDGET:

Our estimated costs per month are:

Driver Payroll    $2,000.

Artist Assistant    $1,500.

Parking expenses    $  550.

Fuel    $  450. 

Auto Insurance    $  125.

Travel/accommodations  artist/staff  $  550.

Admisitrative/social media   $  400

Campaign and Advertising Costs  $  500

Misc supplies  $  100


Total Monthly Estimated Expenses   $6175.00


It is our hope we can raise 3 months of expenses, at which time we also hope that as Truck’n With Vito! travels and gets attention and momentum, it will realize enough sales from the truck’s showcased art, art merchandise and new corporate sponsors to become self sustaining, continuing its journey and message of hope through 2015 and beyond.




Vito Bonanno and the Truck’n With Vito! team would like to thank its current sponsors:

Just Gui Enterprises, llc

Chapel Haven

Taylorvision

Kosmoworks

State of Makers

Uarts

I3 imaging

Absolute video

Umbrella Arts Gallery

Miami Arts Scene

story:
My name is Natalia and I am an artist. However, for most of my life I didn't allow myself to embody it. Fearful of the term "starving artist" and all that society has heaped on the artist's shoulders, alongside being a full time single mother, I have created a work life for myself that is neither emotionally fulfilling nor monetarily sustainable. After many years, I am finally realizing how the arts are an integral part of society and without the artist our lives would be very dim indeed. I believe there is a paradigm shift happening where peoples' true callings are being put into play and we are allowed to flourish. It is no longer necessary for an artist to be starving - we feed the world and ourselves with what we create.

Life has taken us all down many paths. We have all known joy, fear, happiness, longing, and love. There are some paths I might not have chosen knowing the outcome, but they were certainly the ones I was meant to walk. These avenues have made me who I am today, but I am now ready to choose a path that is calling to me - the path I am meant to walk. This path whispers to me and causes little champagne bubbles of joy to fill my heart. I know now that art is my true vocation; to inspire others through my creations and in turn encourage them to create. 

                                     "Gaia" mixed media on aquabord, 2015 - SOLD

﻿My vision as an enterprising artist is to create a sizable body of work so I can produce my very first show by the middle of 2016! With this foundation of heart and soul-inspired work, I will revamp my website as well as set up sites on society6 and/or Etsy, so I can share my art beyond those who personally know me and into the world.

Part of my growth as a professional artist and entrepreneur includes researching grants, residencies and fellowships so I can further my education and broaden my experiences.

As my vision expands, it is a dream of mine to share my knowledge as an artist with both adults and children. The outlet of creating is such an important means of expression and I feel too little of it is taught and encouraged in communities and schools today. Artists communicate through their work and I want to guide others to find this expression within oneself. One of my goals is to get to a point where I can build a studio to teach and mentor students to explore their own uniqueness and allow this expression to flow into the world through art of their own.

There are many opportunities I am excited and eager to explore including book illustrations and commissioned work!

                                       "Untitled" mixed media on aquabord , 2015

To be completely honest the entire idea for my campaign came when I completed my taxes earlier this year. I work multiple jobs, including administrative work, caring for a beautiful woman who is living with Alzheimer’s, and freelance graphic design - all while being a full-time single mom. In 2014, I grossed a little over $25,000.

Last spring, I sold my first painting and was encouraged when a patron offered a considerably larger amount of money than what I had asked for initially - because she said it was worth more. Many times over the years, I have been asked why I am not full time artist? Due to my full work schedule, I can only carve out so much time to create. Would you consider investing in this vision and make a generous contribution?  Your support to help launch my career is all it would take. I know by using your gift coupled with my marketing, administrative, and organizational skills and experience - as well as my talent - I can live into my calling full-time... if I have seed funding to launch. 

I am so grateful to you for supporting me in my journey to living and sharing the most abundant and fullest version of myself.

Please take a peek to the right. I have listed many Perks for you in an array of price ranges. I would love to have to opportunity to share my work with you! You are also able to donate any amount of funds, so if you would like to donate $1 or $100,000, you can! Any amount would be acknowledged and seriously appreciated!

All gifts will be acknowledged in my first show brochure and on my website.
Perks to be delivered no later than December of 2016.

                                                     "Hope" collage on paper, 2014

If you cannot currently contribute, I would appreciate any shares on social media, via email or word of mouth.  I would be extremely grateful for any form of help from you!  Tell your friends, followers - anyone you feel might be interested in some of the perks, or who would just want to lend a helping hand.

At the top of this page you can find Indiegogo's share tools and use them to share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.

·  Thank you to Lisa Genova, my unofficial and much revered mentor She is an advocate for artists to whom I humbly give my gratitude.

·  Thank you to Jennifer Currie, my friend and ceaseless encourager. Without her gentle nudging, I would not be where I am today.

·  Thank you to my daughters, Miranda & Fionna, who inspire me with their amazing courage and self-assuredness. To my sister, Nadia, and brother-in-law, Jared, for their love and support - and to my incredible parents, Wasyl and Daria, immigrants from Ukraine, who would have never dreamt of this possibility for me even with their unyielding faith in me.

·  Thank you to Gregory for inspiring me to embrace the best version of myself.

·  Thanks to YOU! Whether you contribute to my campaign, share my campaign, or just silently send me well wishes. I honor you and hope you will strive to achieve your dreams!

Thank you so much!

 "Untitled" mixed media on canvas done in collaboration with Jennifer Currie, 2014

 you cannot currently contribute, I would appreciate any 
shares on social media, via email or word of mouth.  I would be extremely grateful for any form of help from you!  Tell your 
friends, followers - anyone you feel might be interested in some of 
the perks, or who would just want to lend a helping hand. 
At the top of this page you can find Indiegogo's share tools and use 
them to share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.·  Thank you to Lisa Genova, my unofficial and much revered mentor She is an advocate for artists to whom I humbly give my gratitude.
·  Thank you to Jennifer Currie, my friend and ceaseless encourager. Without her gentle nudging, I would not be where I am today.·  Thank you to my daughters, Miranda & Fionna, who inspire me with their amazing courage and self-assuredness. To my sister, Nadia, and brother-in-law, Jared, for their love and support - and to my incredible parents, Wasyl and Daria, immigrants from Ukraine, who would have never dreamt of this possibility for me even with their unyielding faith in me.·  Thank you to Gregory for inspiring me to embrace the best version of myself.·  Thanks to YOU! Whether you contribute to my campaign, share my campaign, or just silently send me well wishes. I honor you and hope you will strive to achieve your dreams! 
Thank you so much!




 "Untitled" mixed media on canvas done in collaboration with Jennifer Currie, 2014

story:
We empower artists and consumers. 

Kick & Push aims to facilitate the conversation between artists and the skateboarding community. We provide a platform for artists to design custom skateboards and the opportunity for the community to influence what we make.

We put static designs into motion. The community supports the designs they love and if the goal is reached, we handle the rest. The end results are top-quality, custom skateboards shipped to supporters in beautiful packaging.

As unique as your skating style, these decks give skaters and enthusiasts another level of self expression on the streets or a one-of-a-kind art piece for the wall at home.

About the Artist :

Dylan Gordon. Photographer. Ventura, California.

As a photographer, I am constantly looking into the lives of my subjects. Looking with everything I have lived, my knowledge, experience and total involvment, enabling me to relate to my subjects. Understanding this allows me to share these relationships with the world. Creating is my love and passion. I'm driven by something given to me by my father that I cannot manage to articulate; my mind is constantly driven by new concepts, ideas and visions of what I can create, achieve and do. I work to spend my life exploring and experiencing everything this life can give me, everywhere and anywhere I can. Meeting and telling the stories of the people that fill my life. Family and Friends are everything to me, without them I would likely be a shadow of the person I am today.

Living life behind the lense is my muse. I am forever infatuated by where my camera will take me and the things I will capture with this amazing tool.


Deck & Design :

This deck is a 8.5" wide, 32" long, standard popsicle shape. The design is a vibrant collection of black and white images of skateboarding, surfing, motorcycles, and adventure that breathes Dylan's passion for the outdoors and living life on the road.


Print :

For people purchasing the print + deck package, you'll get an 11x14 of this image.

Kick + Push for a Cause:

As an ambassador Dylan chose to use this campaign to help raise funds for the Surfrider Foundation. A non-profit environmental organization dedicated to the protection and enhancement of the world's oceans. Learn more here


Our Boards :

Each skateboard deck is Canadian-maple and manufactured at the highest quality and performance standards. The deck will be delivered to your doorstep in our custom Kick & Push box including a signed artist thank you card. 

Risks and challenges

Kick & Push has completed 2 successful campaigns. We have confidence that once funding is reached, production and fulfillment will take no longer than 2 months. However, as with any manufacturing process, there is the possibility for unexpected delays in production.

story:
Nathan's Art Studio at EFA, the Elizabeth Foundation of Arts Center (323 West 39th street, New York, NY) this summer 2015. I'm offering my sincere gratitude and hundreds of original paintings, artworks, prints, and other art gifts in exchange for your contribution of $1 or more. Share Nathan's Art Studio with your friends and family. Every dollar will help my cause and career of making inspirational art. Thank you, I appreciate your support. Be Well. -Nathan Jalani Taylor


There will be an open studio tour for my floor on Wednesday July 15, 2005. Private studio visits are available by appointment only, beginning July 7th until August 30th, 2015. Typical hours are 11am to 7pm, 7 days a week.

______________________________   PRESS  ___________________________________

"Visual artist Nathan Jalani Taylor’s cover art for Play With The Changes instantly drew me in with its primal simplicity. The Rorschach ink blots boiling into the heavens like an apocalyptic tar pit. It is a perfect visual representation of 4Hero’s sound." - Brian Hull.﻿  okayplayer.com

"Powerful art." -Jared McCallister, NY DAILY NEWS

"Nathan Jalani Taylor makes expressive semi-abstract works whose subjects speak to contemporary life, with a feeling of music in their bones. Strong, graphic and colorful. they add light and stimulation to any space they inhabit."
-UPTOWN MAGAZINE

"Artwork Focusing on liberation, both physical & spiritual" -NYPRESS.COM
___________________________________________________________________________

The Perks

$1 | Every Dollar Will Help. Thank You.

$5 | Receive A small art card and a note of thanks.

___________________________________________________________________________

$15 | Receive a collection of (5) assorted art postcards randomly selected by artist.

___________________________________________________________________________

$40 | Nathan's Art Book. A complete catalog, hundreds of original artworks by Nathan Jalani Taylor, including paintings, drawings, writings and the new work created this summer, 2015. Book size: 7" X 7" Page Count: To be determined. Available October 2015.

___________________________________________________________________________

Original Paintings by Nathan Jalani Taylor

Starting at $100 (extra small), $200 (small) $300 (medium), $500 (large), $1,000 (extra large). Make your contribution today to claim an original painting of your choice. First come, first serve. Review artwork online and/or visit art studio for viewing. Check updates for new art to come.

story:
Hi my name is JT Liss. I am a 32-year-old artist and educator living in East Harlem. About 4 years ago I resigned from a full-time teaching position to pursue my passion in photographic art and use it as a catalyst for social change. Since then I have had numerous exhibits in NYC, and throughout the US, and have been able to raise money from the sales of my work to help support organizations advocating for social change. My work is rooted in storytelling, so much of it is paired with a poem or story to further explain each piece. My belief is that if a new thought can enter the mind, even for the briefest of moments, then change has a chance. 

The past year has been extremely exciting with exhibitions, benefits, and most recently, being asked to have a solo exhibit at Crisolart Gallery in Barcelona, Spain. 

This is where you all come in. It may seem like a strange request to ask you to help to fund my trip. The truth is, I feel weird about it, myself. However, the other truth is that I am an artist. An artist who hustles day in and day out to keep this dream alive. An artist who is proud to say that he has sold enough work to be able to afford to live in New York City without the help of others. An artist who needs a little extra support to reach the next step in his career. With your help, I will be able to reach that next step by exhibiting in a gallery, who prides themselves on discovering new up-and-coming talent, for the entire month of August (see image below). Every bit helps and I will be forever grateful for your contributions.

Thank you,

J.T.

www.jtlissphotography.com

@JTLissPhotoArt 


What is Needed

Support for travel and accommodations. I will be stretching my own artwork on canvas to save money, but need to print and ship everything overseas, which really adds up.
- 2 roundtrip tickets for myself and my assistant - $2,676.00
- accommodations (August 5-13th) - $500.00
- 20, 40x60 rolled canvas prints via Canvasfab - $2,090.00 ($104.50 each)
- Wood Frames - $400.00
- Canvas Stretcher Plier - $25.00 

Perks

A number of perks will be given out such as a personal listing in the exhibit's program, East Harlem T-shirt (below), 8x10 signed print of "Underground Dreams" (below), an 11x14 signed gallery canvas print, an 18x24 signed gallery canvas print, a limited edition signed & numbered copy of "Strung Out II" (below), a personalized bottle of Cristolart Gallery's "Author's Wine" (below), a personal photo shoot with J.T. Liss and a trip to Barcelona! All perks will be mailed out in the fall, around October/November.



Risks & Challenges

The major risk for this exhibit has been finding the most cost effective and safe way to ship artwork to the Gallery. After discussing options with my manager we decided that our partnership with Canvasfab was the best choice. They will provide us with 20, 40x60 rolled canvas prints and the wood frames at a fraction of their normal cost (big thanks to Canvasfab for their support). The artwork and wood frames will then come with me in a huge duffle bag to Spain where I will stretch and frame all 20 pieces with the help of my assistant and staff of the gallery.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Send an email blast to friends. Share on social media. Every little bit helps including getting the word out!


"Life" by J.T. Liss - Life is your story. You choose the characters, create the plot, play the lead, and direct the vision. It is up to you if you want your story to be a drama, comedy, or horror. For it is through your eyes, thoughts and intuition that make the sum of these decisions your life. Whether it be short film or epic, black & white or technicolor, you are at the center of it all and all of it is at the center of you. The question is, after the credits roll, will there be talks of a sequel?

story:
About //

Martina Trchova Trio is a folk/blues/jazz fusion band based in Prague, CZ. The main singer, Martina Trchova, taught a handful of students from Syracuse University, Bowdin College, Elon, and American University.

My name is Iara and I was one of the students from Syracuse University and director of the music video. During my time abroad, Martina and her band helped me feel at home in Prague. Their music brings memories and emotions of the past and present in a way that is reflective and quaint. As a human, Martina is someone who is invested in every single student and person and acts as their number 1 supporter/fan for their artistic dreams. Her quality of life is inspirational and reflective and this music video is a chance for people to give back to her and all that she has given to us.

What I set out to do for this music video was to create a compilation of people’s passions and artistic expressions. How I like to describe the video is a collaborative music video where the talents of each crewmember, dancer, and member of production are visualized and captured.

With your help in making this music video we can make everyone’s creativity seen. Specifically, we can buy materials to build the set, give the shadow dancers unified costumes, feed and nourish the crew and dancers, and reserve slots at the soundstage in Onondaga County, NY.


Story //
An unfaithful girl walks home and is faced with obstacles brought on by a one-night-stand. On the walk-of-shame back home, she encounters memories of people who have come into her life, led her to a new path, and then disappeared in an instant.



Short Summary //

This music video serves to invigorate emotions and show a woman being unfaithful to a man, rather than visa versa.

There’s a main dancer, Tina who wakes up next to her last night passion and leaves to walk home on the cobble streets of Prague. On her walk home, she is surrounded by shadowed figures that dance around her trying to bring her down one path or another. She overtakes them with a dance of her own passions and then arrives at home alone, hiding from her past mistakes.


How You Can Help //

With the monies we will nourish our crew and dancers, have a baller set that is a mix of a surreal Prague street and New York skyline. Any excess money, we will be passed over to the band, dancers, and/or SeriousFun Children’s Network. 


ESTIMATED FINANCIAL BREAKDOWN


Set Cost Breakdown

Set 1: Affair Bedroom  

  • Cardboard Boxes                                                                           $150

Set 2: Street

  • Bridge/Doorway                                                                            $80
  • Homemade Lamp posts                                                              $75
  • Street                                                                                                 $60
  • Set Piece Home Fronts                                                                $100

Set 3: Home

  • Window                                                                                              $20
  • Home Front                                                                                      $80

Craft Services Breakdown

  • Coffee                                                                                                 $30
  • Granola/Power Bars                                                                     $20
  • Dinner                                                                                                 $70

Transport Breakdown

  • Rent a UHaul (transport set)                                                   ≈ $55


This is our estimated financial breakdown if we reach our goal. If we overtake our goal, though, we will be able to create a much more beautiful and real set. If we raise more than our goal, for example, we'll be able to buy real lamp posts ($200) as opposed to making them. If we continue to succeed our goal, we'll be able to help provide money for the dancers' costumes. After that, we'll be able to provide better quality food and more snacks. Basically, our goal amount gets us enough supplies to make a decent set and provide a little for our actors and dancers, but overtaking it will allow this project to soar to levels we can't even imagine! Excess money after that will go to SeriousFun Children's Network.


Why? // Por Que? // Como?!?

Your contributions will make many students' dreams possible. We want to make this film for art, for expression, for the time that we have put into the project. This project has been in the works since early May 2015, it will only make the end product grander to have your backing and love and friendship and love and pocket and mula and support.

CAN’T DROP THE BILLS?   Do not fret!    Pass the campaign to 2-3 friends and you’ll fill our lives with joy and Dunkin’s Box O’Joe!


Risks //

Time and money. We are trying to rent out the Onondaga soundstage and with that comes pressure of time and commitment level. With a backing and support from you all, our crew will have benefits as seen through free costume and food and drink.

About
//Martina Trchova Trio is a folk/blues/jazz
fusion band based in Prague, CZ. The main singer, Martina Trchova, taught a handful
of students from Syracuse University, Bowdin College, Elon, and American
University. 
My name is Iara and I was one of the students
from Syracuse University and director of the music video. During my time
abroad, Martina and her band helped me feel at home in Prague. Their music
brings memories and emotions of the past and present in a way that is
reflective and quaint. As a human, Martina is someone who is invested in every
single student and person and acts as their number 1 supporter/fan for their
artistic dreams. Her quality of life is inspirational and reflective and this
music video is a chance for people to give back to her and all that she has
given to us. 
What I set out to do for this music video was to create a compilation of people’s passions and artistic expressions. How I
like to describe the video is a collaborative music video where the talents of
each crewmember, dancer, and member of production are visualized and captured. 
With your help in making this music video we

story:
What and Who is Afrigraphix?

Afrigraphix is the trading name for CAS Graphix cc a registered Close Corporation in South Africa. (Reg. No. 2007/244345/23)

My name is Clive Steele. I am an artist who does oil paintings and pencil drawings of South African wildlife.

Afrigraphix was established to sell Limited Edition prints of my paintings and drawings through my website - www.afrigraphix.com. The prints of the oil paintings are done on canvas and the prints of the drawings are done on high quality paper. Each print is signed and numbered. The will be 1 000 Limited Edition prints in small and large of each painting and drawing.

I am experienced in graphic design, advertising, advertising sales, marketing, exhibition organising, public relations and Pastel Accounting to trial balance.

Agreements have been reached with a talented Web Designer, Bobbie Nash, a top South African photogrpaher, Neil Kirby and two highly rated printers, Silvertone International and WetInk, to guarantee the quality of the prints being sold.

Payment systems have been established with Paypal, Paygate and China Payment Services - Union Pay.

Once the website is established as a viable business, I intend to develop the site into a platform to sell the art of young artists in South Africa to help them establish their careers.

Apart from my own work and financial investment in the project, my family and friends have invested over $ 25 000 to launch the business and website.

Why do I need funding?

One of the most important parts of internet marketing is Search Engine Optimization. Most of the funds raised will be used to employ the services of a Search Engine Optimization company, iLead, to lift the rankings of afrigraphix.com on Google, Yahoo and other search engines.

A seperate company will be engaged to raise the rankings on Baidu, the Chinese Search Engine. As mentioned before, an agreement with China Payment Services - Union Pay has been concluded. Union Pay has over 500 million cardholders.

There are also paintings and drawings that need to be photographed professionally so that they can be loaded onto the website and printed.

Your Involvement.

My success will only be possible with the help of many people. I will be extremely grateful for your help by making a contribution of any size. Indiegogo is a great way for me to reach these people. If you pay via Paypal, I am able to access funds as soon as they are pledged and will be able to have the photographs taken and employ the services of iLead the Search Engine Optimization company and then the company in China.

I have listed the perks on the right hand side of this page, available from as little as $25. The perks are all Limited Edition prints depending on the size of the contribution.

If you are unable to contribute at this time with a pledge but are enthusiastic about my artwork, your enthusiasm is contagious! Please spread the word through Facebook, Twitter, Linked In and blogging and you can use the share tools or links at the bottom of this page. Good old word of mouth is great too!! I will be really grateful for your support.

Why I need your help.

I am passionate about my painting and drawing and have done my utmost to move my website up the rankings and now need to raise sufficient funding to employ the services of a top Search Engine Optimization company.

I also have a desire to help young aspiring artists in South Africa to reach great heights. South African art is appreciated around the world. We have millions of visitors to South Africa each year who often leave carrying art and sculptures. I would like to make this art availble to people who are not able to visit our beautiful country.

My Team

Webmaster                  - Bobbie Nash         - A search on Google for Winklebee Websites will show you the quality of her work.

Photographer               - Neil Kirby             - www.kirbybros.co.za

Printers                        - Dennis Da Silva   - www.fine-art-printing.co.za

                                    - Frank Marshall     - www.wetlink.co.za

SEO Company            - Ilicus Marais         - www.ilead.co.za

My Website

Please visit my website at www.afrigraphix.com to view more of my paintings. The drawings will be added to the website as soon as possible.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Julia Escriva de Carvalho, I am a Visual Artist/ Photographer who has been researching the cultural / social and ambiental changes whithin Amazonian Indigenous Tribes.

My life`s mission is to raise awareness about the beauty and wisdom of these Ancient tribes, throughout my art and documentaries.

It talks about how contemporary men has lost their connection with nature, consequently losing the connection with the nature within themselves.  The series will work as a tool that will create awareness about Ancient Wisdom and living in harmony with Nature and their fellow men.

This campaign is to raise funds in order for me and my crew to work on a series of documentaries which will serve as tool to spread this timeless wisdom from those tribes and preserve their cultural value.

Each one of you can make a difference contributing to this project which will be spread as much as possible once it`s finalized in order to reach the intented goal, which has a beneficial social cause.

In order to film the series my crew and I would need time and patience in order to record moving images which can inspire and inform.

Thanks in advance for making this dream happen!

Much love,

 

Julia Escriva de Carvalho

Visual Artist/ Photographer

What We Need & What You Get

We need sufficient funding in order to buy the communities specific tools they might need while we are there filming. For Instance, the Kalapalo`s community in Xingu have asked us a boat in order to sail us around for footage recording and for their further use within the jungle.

The Impact

Each one of you can make a difference contributing to this project which will be spread as much as possible once it`s finalized in order to reach the intented goal, which has a beneficial social cause:  The timeless wisdom from those tribes and preserve their cultural value

Other Ways You Can Help

There are alternative ways you can contribute besides raising money for the project:

Share this campaign with as many people as possible in order to make this dream project come true!

story:
The FUNnel of Creation is an art project to be displayed at the 2014 Burning Man event. It will be produced by a group of Reno, NV artists who worked together over the last 3 years to create projects representing northern Nevada. The lead artist is Jeremy Evans, a Reno artist who has worked with artists overseas and in North America to create projects representing Czech Republic, Israel, Maui, Lithuania, Holland, and South Africa.

Reno is the largest city near the Burning Man event, which takes place about 120 miles to Reno's northeast. The FUNnel of Creation represents Reno's gateway location and de facto build site for large Burning Man art projects. Almost everything and and everyone going to Burning Man passes through Reno.

The FUNnel of Creation is a visual representation of the vortex of activities spinning through Reno. At the base of the piece is a three-dimensional Mercator projection of Earth. Swirling up from the center of the map -- which is Reno, naturally -- are eight arms painted and lit with bright colors. At the top of the piece is a Burning Man city street map. 

The FUNnel of Creation will be lit with LED light. The LEDs on the swirling arms will be powered by hand-cranks held on stations around the piece. As more participants turn the cranks, more lights will illuminate the piece.

Risks For this Project

The team has worked together for 3 years, so the risks we foresee are low and manageable.

Our group's past projects were constructed entirely of wood. The main challenge to FUNnel of Creation is it will be constructed with metal tubing, steel cables, and wood laminates. This is a new construction technique for us. Construction of the FUNnel of Creation is already under way, and so far the transition to welding is not difficult.

We are constructing FUNnel of Creation with steel so we can install it permanently in Reno after Burning Man. We do not yet have a permanent installation site.

story:
The Bus Party is a touring group of Scottish artists, listening across Scotland in the run up to the Referendum. The writers and singers on the bus will include James Robertson, Neal Ascherson, Billy Kay, David Greig, Karine Polwart and Mairi Campbell. Through the Bus Party's mix of celebration and conversation, they will be encouraging everyone to vote and asking, "However you will vote, what kind of Scotland do you want?" 

The artists on the bus will be exploring this question in music and song, poetry and readings that reflect Scotland's diversity.  Above all, the Bus Party will be listening to local communities from Wick to Wigtown, Stromness to Stirling, discussing the society they want to live in the day after the Referendum.

If you long for this kind of civil conversation in the Referendum, your donation will make it happen in a matter of days, the length and breadth of Scotland!


What We Need & What You Get

The Bus Party needs £7,000 to cover the cost of taking a minibus, car for the support team and a rotating group of artists from Stromness to Stirling between May 24 to May 31, holding 16 events over 8 days. What are our costs?

1. Minibus Hire - £630

2. Minibus & Support Car Fuel for a journey of 1,000 miles - £650

3. Bed & Breakfast for 3 of the 7 nights (4 with free hospitality) - £2000

4. Lunch & Dinner for 8 days for artists and support team - £2,000

5. Press launch, publicity banners, pamphlet printing - £1,000

6. Ferry to Orkney for bus and passengers - £330

6. Venue Hire and Incidental Expenses - £390

Happily, we have already received pledges of £2,000. So we need to raise another £5,000 in 30 Days! We can do it thanks to your generous support!

We are grateful for every online donation towards our goal, large or small.

Everyone who gives up to £25 by May 21* will be recorded as one of the total number on our Thank You Banner, displayed at every event across Scotland.

Every person who gives £25 or more by May 21* will get their name on our Thank You Banner (if they wish), displayed at every event across Scotland. 

The first 25 people who give £100 or more will receive a signed and personally dedicated work of art by one of the artists on the bus by December 31 2014.

Everyone who gives £250 or more will be listed by name in the credits of the film of the Bus Party's "Listening Lugs Tour" (if they wish) and receive the DVD.

Any surplus funds at the end of the May and September Listening Lugs Tour will be donated to the Scottish Youth Parliament to support active citizenship among young people in Scotland and around the world.

* gifts made after May 21 will not be recorded on our tour banners but will be deeply appreciated in helping us to meet our £5,000 target.

The Impact


Your donation will foster the civil conversation on our future that we all aspire to in the Referendum. Your gift to the Bus Party will help bring our artists and civil conversation to smaller and remoter communties across Scotland. The organisers of the Bus Party 2014 ran the successful Bus Party tour of Scotland during the 1997 referendum. You can be confident they will do it again in 2014.


Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand if you are not in a position to give money to our Bus Party appeal. We greatly value your support in other vital ways. You can tell your friends about our tour and encourage them to come along to our events.

story:
Garden decoration (sample - each one is different) - size ~25cm / 10"

You see...

As a newborn, it was only due to my lack of coordination that I wasn't out of my bassinet tying little ribbons on the hair of the other girls in the baby nursery. I was pretty much in control of my passion for creating things until recently, when my house exploded into a full-blown art studio…(Yeah, OK, there have been a few exceptions, including the series of 'Rachel comics' that I'm going to post for-the-first-time-EVER to the project gallery - see the little tab at the top of the page...)

I then realized I’d better do something about it. Seeing as crafting is an activity I both enjoy and do fairly well (somewhat well? depends who you ask? :-)) I decided to take my passion to help support my family.

What You Get & What I Wish For

  • $5 – My sincere thanks (really, I promise I'll appreciate it!)
  • $10 – A set of 5 random handmade paper clips
  • $25 – A wall decoration in the color of your choice
  • $25 – A candy dish or CD candy dish in random colors
  • $35 – A suncatcher mobile 
  • $45 – A garden decoration – you choose the main colors (shown at the top) - or a large bowl
  • $65 – A large bowl and a matching candy dish in color(s) of your choice
  • $100 – A set including a large bowl, a garden decoration, a candy dish and 8 napkin decorations or gift card clips – all with your choices of main color(s)
  • $250 – A permanent sponsor link on my “About” page, including your company’s logo, a link to your blog or whatever page you choose + the $100 reward set
  • $500 – The $250 rewards + the ability to name a product line of your choice
  • $1000 – My eternal gratitude, the $500 rewards & all the materials from my clip :-)

Paper clips / bookmarks / gift tags - some are clippier than others :-). Sizes vary.

Wall decoration (sample - each one is different) - size ~15cm / 6"

Candy dish (sample - each one is different) - size ~10cm / 4"

CD dish (sample - each one is different) - size ~12.5cm /  5"

Sun catcher mobile & windchimes (sample - each is different)
- they make a beautiful sound

Large bowl (sample - each one is different) - size ~25cm / 10"

I’ve got basic supplies and plenty of items I’ve made. In fact, I’ve spent the past few months developing a product line of different items to meet a variety of needs. I’m still missing a few things to get my business on the right path:

  • Branding and Packaging. A professionally designed logo and packaging are essential for enabling me to sell not only face-to-face to individuals, but also shops and online. (~$1000 for design of logo and packaging). The packaging itself will require additional funds.

  • Photography. Ideally, I’d like one professional photo shoot and to buy a portable studio. Later on, I may want to work with a professional photographer on a more regular basis, as each item is handmade & therefore unique. ($250 for a single photo shoot and purchase of portable studio)
  • Online store. I have experience with building websites and I would like to buy a storefront platform (e.g., Shopify; Magento)  and create an online store to sell my work. I plan to do the work on my website on my own. ($250 for platform, domain & hosting)
  • Additional supplies. I’m currently working with basic tools that I found around the house (needle nose, cake trays, etc.). I would like to buy special tools for working with wire and bowls and trays upon which I can mold the plastic I work with. If I am able to raise enough money, I will also buy a storage system to organize both the materials and the finished pieces. 

Although I really hope I'll reach my goal, if I don't, then branding & packaging will be put on a back burner until I start making enough sales to justify it.

The Impact

Contributing to my campaign will make a whole lot of people happy:

  • Anyone seeing the colorful projects - color makes people happy, it just does :-)
  • Me & my family - I know that doing creative work is what makes me happy. Being able to market it and make some money will make my whole family happy.
  • Local kids - seeing kids' eyes light up when they learn new skills or create beautiful art is awesome. I have recently started a free weekly group for kids who are interested in arts & crafts. If I'm able to quit my day job and focus on crafts, I'll have time for better ideas & take on more kids (free or very low cost).
  • It seems a far away goal right now, but ideally, I would love to write a craft book with useful crafts for children - ones that actually come out like you hope they will.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you choose to contribute or not, I'll be so thankful if you can help get the word out - let people know about my campaign! Use the Indiegogo tools :-)

Thank you so much!

Rachel
story_txt:
Garden decoration (sample - each one is different) - size ~25cm / 10"

You see...
As a newborn, it was only due to my lack of coordination
that I wasn't out of my bassinet tying little ribbons on the hair of the other
girls in the baby nursery. I was pretty much in control of my passion for
creating things until recently, when my house exploded into a full-blown art
studio…(Yeah, OK, there have been a few exceptions, including the series of 'Rachel comics' that I'm going to post for-the-first-time-EVER to the project gallery - see the little tab at the top of the page...)



I then realized I’d better do something about it. Seeing as
crafting is an activity I both enjoy and do fairly well (somewhat well? depends who you ask? :-)) I decided to take my passion to help support my family.



What You Get & What I Wish For



$5 – My sincere thanks (really, I promise I'll appreciate it!)

$10 – A set of 5 random handmade paper clips

$25 – A wall decoration in the color of your choice


$25 – A candy dish or CD candy dish in random colors


$35 – A suncatcher mobile 


$45 – A garden decoration – you choose the main colors (shown at the top) - or a large bowl


$65 – A large bowl and a matching candy dish in color(s)
of your choice


$100 – A set including a large bowl, a garden decoration,
a candy dish and 8 napkin decorations or gift card clips – all with your choices
of main color(s)


$250 – A permanent sponsor link on my “About” page,
including your company’s logo, a link to your blog or whatever page you choose
+ the $100 reward set


$500 – The $250 rewards + the ability to name a product
line of your choice

$1000 – My eternal gratitude, the $500 rewards & all the materials from my clip :-)



Paper clips / bookmarks / gift tags - some are clippier than others :-). Sizes vary.

story:
A special fundraiser to raise $4000.00 for the collaborative project of master artist, Patricia A. Montgomery and the African American Museum & Library at Oakland (AMMLO) is in progress, to complete the installation of Patricia’s dramatic and moving June 2015 exhibit “Heroines of the Civil Rights Movement.”

Various Design Phases of Heroines' Swing Coats 

The Story

Hi, I’m Patricia A. Montgomery, master artist. I am in collaboration with the African American Museum & Library at Oakland (AAMLO). Over the past year, I have been creating a new series of work using African American quilting tradition, with digital images and pastel drawings that tells the stories of African American women involved in the Civil Rights Movement. To date we have raised $21,000 for the installation of my exhibit, “Heroines of the Civil Rights Movement”, but are short $4,000 to complete the installation for the June 2015 exhibition.

The exhibition company of Gyroscope and Gizmo is designing an unique environment consisting of the replication of a 1955 bus from Montgomery, Alabama. The exterior bus walls will be covered with digital images of various Civil Rights events, marches, and women’s organizations.  One of the unique aspects of the exhibition is the quilted swing story coats representing the African American heroines of the Civil Rights Movement. The second unique aspect is the idea expressed by AAMLO Chief Curator, Rick Moss. To house the coats in an environment familiar to a majority of people puts the inspirational designs in context. The viewer will have the opportunity to stand next to, walk among, march along, and hear speeches from Fannie Lou Hamer and Ella Josephine Baker.

This unique installation honors these unsung heroines who were more than foot soldiers. They were warriors who participated in the Montgomery bus boycott, the integration of schools and colleges, sat at lunch counters and marched for voting rights. These social nonviolent actions changed the world.

Please contribute to the “Heroines of the Civil Rights Movement” and help us raise the $4,000 needed to complete and install an unique environment for the unsung warriors’ swing story coats.

Machine Quilting of Claudetta Colvin's Swing Coat

About Us & The Impact

In 2010, Patricia A. Montgomery was acknowledged by the Alliance for California Traditional Arts as a Master Artist for the 2011 Apprenticeship Program. Over the years, she has created several mini-series story quilts with digital images. One series was commissioned by the Asian & Pacific Islander American Health Forum (APIAHF) to create three textile memory quilts for their 25th Anniversary event in Washington titled “A Journey Celebration: Honoring the Past – Living in the Present – Moving towards the Future.”  The quilts were installed in their San Francisco Office.

The African American Museum and Library at Oakland is dedicated to the discovery, preservation, interpretation and sharing of historical and cultural experiences of African Americans in California and the West for present and future generations.

Together we are creating an interactive installation to honor the lives and stories of the African American women who participated in the Civil Rights Movement.  Your contribution to the “Heroines of the Civil Rights Movement” campaign allows the viewer to learn about these warriors and their contributions. Heroines like Dorothy Height who was known as the Godmother of the Civil Rights, and Amelia Boynton Robinson who was a leader and key figure in the 1965 march in Selma, Alabama that became known as “Bloody Sunday” will be showcased among other heroines in the exhibit. The march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama led President Johnson to sign the Voting Rights Act, which outlawed discrimination in voting. It’s important for this generation to understand how these nonviolent actions changed the world.

Adding the story to Carlotta Walls' Swing Coat
What You Get
To show our gratitude for your contribution, you will receive:
  1. $10.00 Donation - Original 4" x 6" Fabric Post Cards 
  2. $15.00 Donation -  AAMLO bracelet or mouse pad or cup holder
  3. $25.00 & $35.00 Donations - Individual & Family Membership to the Friends of AAMLO; DVD about Unsung African American Heroes of the Second Division  and CD about African Americans in the California Gold Rush and AAMLO signature tote bag 
  4. $100.00 Donation - Framed & Signed Digital Image of one Heroines' swing coat
  5. $200.00 Donation - Original Mixed Media "Spider Mandala with Beaded Spirit Figure" 
  6.  $1,000.00 Donation Package - Private Reception to "Heroines of the Civil Rights Movement" and curator talk and tour for 50 invited guests Acknowledgement in the exhibit catalog plus a one free copy. Also a set of 6 Fabric Post Cards
  7. $2,500.00 Donation Package - Original Thread Painting from the abstract series titled "Reflections" - Tour of Dragon Art Studio in Oakland, CA and a Mediterranean Luncheon for two; Acknowledgement in the exhibit catalog plus  one free copy. Also a set of 6 Fabric Post Cards

Spider Mandala XIII , 13 1/2" x 15", Handmade Felted Fabric with Beaded Spirit Figure c. 2015 Patricia A. Montgomery

Other Ways You can help

If you are unable to contribute, please pass on this campaign to your family and friends through emails and social media.  Thank you so very much!

We're so close! Please help us finish this exhibit dedicated to the women of the Civil Rights Movement.

story:
Yes, now your Tattoo can like and be liked by other Tattoos around it! TatChat is the body art gallery of real people’s tattoos or body piercings around you.

You can like, skip and even post a TatWall comment to anyone.


Like a “Piece” and if it likes you back, you can chat. Spread the word and join us in making TatChat the biggest walking & talking body art gallery worldwide, where one body art piece can talk to another.

TatChat provides anonymity to all that want it, eliminating stage fright and giving way to emotion, joy and pleasure. 

People may put their real names or pick an alias username and exhibit photos of their tattoos at their best.


A beautiful feature is the option of sound tracking ones tattoo photos.


A voice message, tune or 30 seconds soundtrack recording makes a tattoo much more expressive, appreciated and heard – a piece of body art and sound engulfed in one, stirring passion and emotion to the eye, ear and soul. An unbiased memorial journey that constantly measures how liked or skipped one’s body pieces are.

Yup to like or Nah to skip! Once you are Yupped back then you may chat.


The body art community under one roof can now socialize with living tattoo pieces around or browse any other country or location.

View live ranking of the Top 100 Most Yupped pieces worldwide to see and compare your personal performance.


Evaluate the appeal of your tattoo or piercing by the number of Yups you have been granted by admirers. View live ranking of the Top 100 Most Yupped pieces worldwide to see and compare your personal performance. Your name, face, gender, nationality or age is of no importance here! The ultimate emphasis and attention belongs solely to the living ink art or piercing you are constantly baring – where is it placed, the style, theme, color, art school and category it belongs to.

Benefit from TatChat even if you do not have a tattoo or piercing. Make TatChat your gateway to the biggest living walking and talking body art gallery worldwide and be better informed on trends, most liked colors, styles, themes and placements. To become a member you don’t need to have any body art Piece at all! To join though, you will need to set up a TatChat profile and take a photo of the place on your body where you are considering placing a tattoo. Once you are a member this will allow other members to post suggestions and comments on your TatWall. You may choose to be the active and seek advice by posting queries on other members TatWalls, or even chat when Yupped back. On such permanent matters, there is nothing better than making a well-informed final decision and choice of action. TatChat works on a tit for tat principal and highly values and cherishes everyone's privacy. If you choose your online status and location to be invisible to others, then others will be invisible to you too. Changing from one status to another is instant, quick and easy.

Using the TatChat service is free. There are some optional paid features available only to TatChat Plus paid subscribers. We have to highlight that the basic version of TatChat is just as rewarding and enjoyable throughout. The plus subscription will be unlocking some extra features, such as:

- Upload extra photos on your profile – upped to 10 photos;
- Extended personal in app ConTat list – unlimited;
- Extended personal in app FavTat list – unlimited;
- Extended quota of daily remote location journeys and searches – unlimited;
- Extended quota of daily Yup likes used- unlimited;
- Extended quota of daily TatWall message posts – unlimited;
- Extended quota of daily TatChat message used – unlimited;
- Extended filtering parameters for more precise and specific quest searches;
- Access to the live Top 100 Worldwide Yup Ranking.

Both TatChat basic and Plus subscribers can purchase various thematic emoji icons or special key board fonts for a more colorful and expressive chatting experience.

Why wait! Start exploring and socializing with all the walking and talking body art pieces that are nearby you or around the world. A picture is 1,000 words while a carved tattoo is closer to a million. Have fun and enjoy the journey.


Why our Project is needed by the Community

No doubt that there is need, interest and potential for a TatChat service out there, which is beneficial and hugely informative to all. Uncovering well hidden body art beauty and gems to be admired for what they’re worth and not because of whose skin might be the canvas. There are so many master pieces out there, and TatChat is the stage and living gallery for that art to reach its fullest potential and widest reach..

Different studies show that in the USA alone, there are approximately 50 million people who have a Tattoo on their body, and statistics indicate that at least two thirds of them have placed their tattoos on non-visible parts of their bodies not seen by others. In addition, at any one moment of time there are millions considering having a Tattoo. Equally as many, if not more, are with body piercings or intentions to put and ear ring, nose stud or some sort of piercing somewhere on their body.

Just imagine the value TatChat adds to all these various groups through establishing the biggest walking & talking body art gallery worldwide, where one body art piece can talk to another. Now imagine all these hidden away tattoos on living souls and people, made available to all without having to link them to any specific face, name, gender or age. The art piece is all that matters.

Imagine a TatChat living encyclopedia of body art tattoo pieces. A source of information for why to have or not to have a tattoo, what to do or not to do, what is liked and what is ignored, while providing open and non-intrusive communication channels amongst all these people, their art and motives.

Yes, TatChat turns all this imagining into reality and will be available for Apple iOS Phones in August 2015 and for Android Phones in November 2015.

Help us fulfil this fantastic project to its fullest potentials. We know that we have, in abundance the necessary expertise, passion, love and motivation to do it, but we cannot do it without your support and help. Every Dollar you entrust brings us closer to our goal. We know that together with you and your friends, we will achieve it. We are a small company among the Big Boys. Although we have gone a long way so far, we are only a start up, with a well-defined route, expansion and development plan ahead of us. Help us, and become our ambassador in spreading the word about us and our project with family and friends. We will not let you down! 

A Tat in need is a Tat in deed, and we are in need of you!

Yes, to unite, we are in need of you!

story:
Plein Air 365x5:   2014 DAYS, 5+ YEARS, 1 ARTIST’S JOURNEY…

This is the World's Largest One-man Plein Air Art Show and a first of its kind. 

Plein Air 365 x 5, an exhibition and sale of the 2,014 paintings created by pleinair painter, Ted Garcia, during his five-year journey of painting daily from January 1, 2009 thru July 11, 2014.
In January 2009, Ted Garcia challenged himself to paint plein air every day. For five years (2,014 days exactly), he continued his daily commitment facing the challenges with discipline and perseverance which come with a commitment of this magnitude, along with blizzards, heat waves, illness, deaths, births, impalement, wild animals, and even losing his way, finding his way, and surviving an earthquake to complete this journey.

Seeing all 2100 plus paintings hanging in our new gallery space is more amazing then we could have imagined, and the opening reception was great! We were excited and inspired by all the positive comments and feedback. 
Please help keep the positive momentum going and donate today! 
Only through our Indiegogo Campaign can you get a limited edition,
signed print of our highly popular Colorado Columbine or even an original
commissioned painting. What a great Christmas present for someone special!
Please share with family and friends and be a part of history!

This Week's Featured Wall:
"Eats and Treats"

Stay tuned for next week's featured paintings!


The visual diary of this journey needs to be seen.

Why? Because it is an inspiration to all who dream!

It shows that if you are willing to do what it takes, your dream can come true.

By helping Ted show this journey to the world – he will show others what can be done – with a dream, discipline and perseverance.

It is a story that needs to be shared, with spectacular art that needs to seen.

With your financial support – Ted and his team can do just that.



        


Who is Ted Garcia?

Ted Garcia has been a successful Evergreen, Colorado plein air artist for over 12 years and has sold many paintings to collectors. Holding to a true plein air painting philosophy, all of Ted’s plein air paintings are painted on location and are completed in one setting, as he works to capture each scene before changes in the light and atmosphere occur. 

For more information www.tedgarcia.com.  



The Money it Takes to Put on the Show

This visual diary will be a sight to see!

After searching over a year for an affordable gallery large enough to showcase all 2,014 paintings, he has finally found the perfect space. The contract is signed and the date is set! But (eek!) the rent alone is $11,600! 

The location and the availability of the space at this time of year is exciting. Aspen Grove Lifestyle Center is an upscale shopping destination – with at least 4,000 visitors per week day and 6,000 on the weekends.  During the holidays those numbers will double, even triple.  This opens ups the opportunity for many visitors to the gallery; many opportunities for sales.   The gallery is large enough to show all 2,014 paintings – Ted is building the system to hang the paintings in chronological order; and they are priced for collecting and gift giving.  It could just be the perfect storm – location, time of year, number of shoppers to find many of the paintings a home. 

There is also a need for money to successfully produce and promote the event. Funds are needed for the following:

  • Advertising and marketing including mailers, signage, ads, promotions
  • Business support – insurance, licenses
  • Artists Reception to celebrate the show


What do you get? 

In return for your help - the details are in the Perks! But here’s a glimpse….depending on your contribution

  • A chance to be part of history – as a card carrying ART PATRON

    • OR

  • A print of Ted Garcia’s Original Oil Painting: "The Columbine”

    • OR

  •  An embellished print Ted Garcia’s Original Oil Painting: "The Columbine”

    • OR

  • An Original Commissioned Oil Painting by Ted Garcia


Risks & Challenges

The main risk is covering the cost involved in producing and marketing a show of this size correctly. Ted really appreciates whatever help you are able to contribute!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please use the Indiegogo share tools, your Facebook and email lists to help spread the word! We would love for anyone local to join us at the event. Say you helped us on Indiegogo and we will put your name in for a free drawing for a limited edition print of "The Columbine" in a 16x20 giclee, ready to frame!

    Gallery Opens November 10 - December 31, 2014
    Artist’s Reception • November 15, 2014 • 4-8pm

    Aspen Grove Lifestyle Center (Next to Pier One)
    7301 S. Santa Fe Dr.
    Littleton, CO 80120
    303-885-5112

    To help Ted Garcia show his visual diary, please consider donating toward the show.

    To view the show online visit www.tedgarcia.com
story_txt:
Plein Air 365x5:   2014 DAYS, 5+ YEARS, 1 ARTIST’S JOURNEY…
This is the World's Largest One-man Plein Air Art Show and a first of its kind. 


Plein Air 365 x 5, an exhibition and sale of the 2,014
paintings created by pleinair painter, Ted Garcia, during his
five-year journey of painting daily from January 1, 2009 thru July 11, 2014.In January 2009, Ted Garcia challenged himself to paint plein
air every day. For five years (2,014 days exactly), he continued his daily
commitment facing the challenges with discipline
and perseverance which come
with a commitment of this magnitude, along with blizzards, heat waves,
illness, deaths, births, impalement, wild animals, and even losing
his way, finding his way, and surviving an earthquake to complete
this journey.







Seeing all 2100 plus paintings hanging in our new gallery space is more amazing then we could have imagined, and the opening reception was great! We were excited and inspired by all the positive comments and feedback. Please help keep the positive momentum going and donate today! Only through our Indiegogo Campaign can you get a limited edition, signed print of our highly popular Colorado Columbine or even an original commissioned painting. What a great Christmas present for someone special! Please share with family and friends and be a part of history!
This Week's Featured Wall:"Eats and Treats"


Stay tuned for next week's featured paintings!



The visual diary of this journey needs to be seen.


Why? Because it is an inspiration to all who dream! 

It shows that if you are willing to do what it takes, your
dream can come true.

By helping Ted show this journey to the world – he will
show others what can be done – with a dream, discipline and perseverance.

It is a story that needs to be shared, with spectacular art that needs to seen.


With your financial support – Ted and his team can do just that.

story:
I am looking to raise funds for the printing costs for a small poetry chapbook in an edition of 200.

The Book and What It Means to Me:

My name is Robin Bernat and I have been writing poems since I was a child. Beginning in 1997, I have self-published three previous volumes, waiting: eleven poems of love and anticipation (1997), blue: twenty love poems and a song of despair (1999), and Sentimental: poems and short stories (2007). Those editions have been carried at a few local bookstores in Atlanta including the Emory University bookstore, and also several museum shops around the country. They are also for sale at Whitespace gallery and Poem 88.

Saudade is a collection of love poems some in sonnet form, others in quatrains. The title of the volume is a Portuguese word meaning a feeling of longing, melancholy, or nostalgia that is supposedly characteristic of the Portuguese or Brazilian temperament. Many of the poems touch on classical themes: love and loss, memory and anticipation. Influenced primarily by the  confessional poets, the poems draw on my own life experiences of requited and unrequited love, the sudden death of my partner in December 2000, and how that conjured memories of my father’s death in 1979. On a lighter note, there are poems written for my two cats and happier poems written for my husband, Jon. 

My work, written and visual, was once aptly described by a colleague [where ideas of classical beauty co-mingle with their dark cousins].

Saudade combines poetry with lush, arresting images to create something of a cross-breed between the traditional chapbook and an artist book.  The books are small enough to fit in a coat pocket for easy contemplation.

Biography:

Robin Bernat is foremost an artist and writer and secondarily the owner and curator of Poem 88 gallery in Atlanta, Georgia. Her work has been exhibited locally, regionally and nationally and has been collected by many important institutions including The Whitney Museum of American Art, The Kemper Museum of Art, The High Musuem of Art, MOCA-GA and The Weatherspoon Museum. Working primarily in film and video, Bernat's work explores the fleeting and the provisional. 

Besides her self-published volumes, she has published monographs under the imprimatur of Circle B Press for artists Rick Berman and Susan Seydel Cofer and published a collection of images, Pictures Take You Places (2014) by Phillip March Jones under the imprimatur Poem 88 EDITIONS. She has also been a contributor to Art Papers Magazine and Burnaway.

Through Poem 88, Bernat brings to the fore the work of significant and emerging artists in Atlanta and the Southeast many of whom were former classmates. She is a graduate of The University of Georgia and The Atlanta College of Art; in 2001, she was a Visiting Artist at the American Academy in Rome.

Where I am with the book:

All of the poems have been written and the book has been designed by me with assistance from my husband. All that is left is to raise the $1450 to digitally print and bind the book. I am hoping to complete production on the book so they are ready for Valentine’s Day, 2016. Every year, we host a Valentine’s Day Salon at my art gallery, Poem 88, and I would very much like to have the book available for that occasion.

Here is a sample poem:

Several storms later and everything 
smells of loam and rotting wood. But 
there is beauty, too, in this city: varying 
shades of emerald adorn it. Each summer 
the wet tumult topples trees -- giant poplars 
lay over the road and Mrs. L’s shady 
playground is now completely exposed.
Sun-fearing bushes have been uprooted to 
be moved to another part of the garden.  It’s 
not so different for you and me, really.  The 
atmosphere shifts and we can see more 
clearly that what we hoped was deep 
affection is shallow-rooted after all. When 
I removed the limbs and vines, love had fled.

Here's another sample page spread:



REWARDS!!

$25 earns a copy of the book!

$50 earns a copy of the book + a poem written on the topic of your choice

$100 earns a copy of the book + a poem written on the topic of your choice + a digital color print in the style of the book, or previous books.

story:
Once Upon a Time...

A man and a woman met at a festival. When they saw each other, they knew they would spend their lives together. When they spoke, they knew they would share the same dream together: the dream of owning a shop at the Renaissance Festivals and traveling the roads, until they were old and weary.

My husband Armand and I have worked and dreamed and hoped since we met. When he was growing up in California, he attended the original pleasure faire in Agoura. When I was little, I would go to the Michigan Renaissance Festival. Now we are grown, and are finally ready to take our place on the road, and in the Faires. We are Nomadic Mind: Traveling Games.

But, we need a way to travel. We deeply want to have no other home but that which we travel in, and a bus would be ideal. We can get an old school bus with ease, and build up from it. With reclaimed wood, scrap metal, a lot of love and hard work, we could have an art-home like no other: a modern gypsy wagon, on the road. A dream fulfilled.


What We Need & What You Get

We aren't asking for something, for nothing. We have some FANTASTIC rewards for your, much appreciated, donations. From patches announcing your pride in a nomadic lifestyle (pictured above) to a weekend in the very bus you helped create!

If we get fully funded, our money will go to:

$4000 to a used school bus

$1000 to building the loft, using scrap metal and reclaimed lumber

$1000 will go to paneling, using reclaimed flooring

$2000 is for the bathroom, the kitchen, and a front dividing wall between the driver's seat and the rest of the bus (or else we would have cats underfoot while driving, and we don't fancy that kind of hazard. Safety first!)

The rest of the money will go to the fees for launching this fundraiser (about $850) and go into making the rewards for you! And everything will be build, sewn, welded, and glued by us!

There will be no electricity on the bus. Our light will come from oil lamps, our heat from a wood-burning stove. We will have a propane range. Truly a step back in time!


Get Us To You

We know this sounds great, but what would you get in the long run? You get us! You will be helping us get our art to the festivals, to be enjoyed by all! When joy is given, it is returned three-fold, and we can spread the joy you give to others! Art and Joy! Love and Life!

If you have any questions, please email me at

Nomadic.Mind.Games@gmail.com


Other Ways You Can Help

We know, sometimes you just don't have it to give. But fear not! There are still ways you can help! Share this link on facebook, tell your friends, and just get the word out!

*A special note: Please allow up to 3 weeks after the campaign ends for us to make and send out your rewards. If you donate for a weekend pass, or a weekend with us, we will email you and coordinate. If you are not in Michigan or Texas, and don't plan on being, I would suggest picking another reward.
