story:
My name is Ashley Jane Laird

After graduating from Washburn University with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in 2011, I have focused on developing my skills as a facilitator and designer of community-based murals. I have worked on numerous public projects across the country, including: Joplin, Missouri; Arkadelphia, Arkansas; Waco, Texas; Queens, New York; Sioux Falls, South Dakota; Songdo, South Korea and five murals in here Topeka. I also have led women and children in collaborative projects for Survivor Art Night at the Topeka YWCA Center for Safety and Empowerment for which I was honored with a 2012 Arts Advocate Award.

For me, this work is the most fulfilling and meaningful work I have ever done. The stories we tell are often ones that are over looked. These projects give us a chance to reclaim public space to share, remember and celebrate these important aspects of our culture.  In the end, it feels like a real accomplishment and gives me a renewed sense of hope.


The Kansas Women’s Mural

In conjunction with the Great Mural Wall of Topeka (the soon to be longest mural in the state at 900’ feet), I will be leading a community-based process that culminates in a 12’ x 70’ foot mural panel that honors the history, accomplishments and continued spirit of Kansas Women. The project will involve Topeka citizens directly in the research, design and painting of the mural. Beginning with workshops in April, a volunteer mural team will learn about the techniques and traditions of mural painting as well as the work and lives of significant Kansas muralists. The team will create and gather raw material for the mural from sources including local libraries, museums, interviews, community meetings and drawing workshops. The finished design will be painted collaboratively by the design team and any interested passersby. We will celebrate completion of the first ever Kansas Women’s mural in June with a formal dedication and great street party.


Why we need your support

We are two thirds of the way to fully funding this important project. Your contribution will help us raise the one third ($2,500) that remains. Funds raised in this campaign will go to pay for paint, scaffolding and design materials. All of the other costs have been covered. Any funds raised over our goal will be rolled forward into the next mural on the Great Mural Wall.

For folks who contribute, I am offering special perks:

$10 a signed postcard of the completed mural

$25 a selection of five signed postcards from the Great Mural Wall

$50 all eight postcards signed by the artists from the Great Mural Wall

$100 an original signed stencil print by Ashley

$250+ an original signed drawing by Ashley


The impact of your contribution

I have worked on many murals, but this is the most personal one to date. Topeka is my hometown and I care about it deeply, especially now and especially when it comes to the recent struggle of Kansas women to safeguard their rights from those who would like to turn back the clock on all the progress we have made. With your support, this mural project will take a bold step in showcasing the remarkable contributions of Kansas women as well as the challenges we face. It could not be more timely.

For those who would like to help but can’t spare the change, we still need your support. Tell your friends about our fundraising campaign, share your ideas for the mural via our blog and come to Topeka and help us paint in May!

story:
Help launch and support a new community art center in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn! Window Studio is a unique art space that offers much needed resources for local artists, youth, and families. We’re growing everyday but we need your donation to become a thriving, sustainable art center!

With your help, Window Studio will be able to offer three core programs at low or no cost to the public.

Window Studio Artist-in-Residence (AIR): An intensive 6-month studio artist residency designed to immerse artists in their studio practice while sharing their process with the community. Artists from all media are invited to apply. Four residencies, two held concurrently, are offered each year. Emerging artists living and working in the Bedford-Stuyvesant community are given preference but all New York City artists are welcome to apply. Stipends are provided.

Window Studio Workshops: Artist-led workshops are offered evenings and weekends for all ages and skill levels. In keeping with the open, inclusive nature of Window Studio, workshops are available to the public on a drop-in basis or for a monthly membership. Supplies and instruction are included in the low-cost membership fee ($10/session; $40/month) with financial aid available upon request. Workshops include: drawing, painting, sculpture, animation and video production.

Artist Resource Center and Open Studio Space (OSS): Window Studio is committed to supporting local artists from Bedford-Stuyvesant, emerging and/or disadvantaged artists & arts professionals through a variety of resource programs and studio space. Window Studio also hosts quarterly exhibits of artists-in-residence work, as well as one open-call juried exhibition by an emerging curator each year. Other cultural events open to the public include Art-in-the-Garden parties held in collaboration with other Bedford-Stuyvesant arts organizations.

There are only a few visual arts organizations in Bed-Stuy and art programs in the schools have been severely cut. According to a recently released report quoted in the New York Times, “more than 42 percent of the schools that do not have state-certified arts teachers are clustered in the South Bronx and Central Brooklyn.” 

Jamohri and Kimora with their artwork after class. Photo by Anne LaFond.

The workshops at Window Studio have become an increasingly vibrant part of the project. Most of the kids who come are middle school age. While some, at least initially, are accompanied by a parent or another relative, several of them come on their own initiative. – Anne LaFond, Founder & Artistic Director (See more stories in “Pictures in Words”)

Window Studio’s programs offer opportunities for artists from the Bed-Stuy neighborhood to be an integral part of the local arts community. I admire any artist who displays the courage to fulfill their life’s purpose despite the myriad of daily challenges artists face. I am honored to facilitate their artistic realization here at Window Studio. – Nicholas Rispoli, Director of Programs & Operations

Our goal is to secure funding in order to expand from being a neighborhood art project to a full community art center in the coming year. It is our hope to become an independent non-profit organization with 501(c)3 status. At this stage, with our limited staff and resources, we are launching a fundraising campaign to cover our start-up costs and operating expenses.

Your donation will help us:

  • Purchase art supplies and storage for workshop materials ($5,000)
  • Fund stipends for our artists-in-residence ($2,000)
  • Allow us to paint our walls and make other needed renovations ($1,250)
  • Obtain basic office furniture ($2,000)
  • Buy office computers and software ($4,000)
  • Purchase video production equipment for multi-media workshops ($10,000)
  • Upgrade our lighting ($2,000)
  • Contribute to our rent and utilities ($11,900)
  • Pay our hardworking minimal staff and extend our operating hours ($20,000)
  • Market our programs ($9,500)
    (*Estimates based on current projected budget)

Given the economic circumstances of the majority of Window Studio’s audience, it is essential that our residencies, workshops, exhibitions and other programs be offered for no or low cost to the public!

With your help, will we be able to do this. We thank you for your support!

Tiffany B. Chanel, an artist and sneaker designer, at Window Studio.
Photo by Anne LaFond.

FAQs:

What happens if Window Studio doesn’t meet its initial funding goal?

Every little bit helps, and we will get started with whatever amount we raise in this campaign! We will expand the programs over the coming year as our funding increases.

What are your funding priorities at this stage?

We want to meet the tremendous demand for our programs. First, we need to be open more days, with more artists working in the studio through the residency program. We want to offer more workshops and of course pay for the art supplies required. We also need to take care of necessary renovations so that we can function efficiently in the space. These include setting up the program office with basic equipment and storage for supplies and artwork. A fresh coat of paint and an upgrade to the lighting will enable us to hold exhibits and other arts events open to the public.

How do you plan to continue Window Studio after this fundraising campaign?

We are already hard at work applying for grants from the Brooklyn Arts Council, and from arts organizations such as Creative Capital, Art Place and others. We will apply to our local councilperson, Robert Cornegy, Jr., who represents Bedford-Stuyvesant to receive discretionary funding from the New York City Council. We will host a fundraising event in October 2015, and have already won the support of individual sponsors. And we just received word that an anonymous donor will be matching what we raise in THIS campaign dollar for dollar, so your donation will go twice as far!

What are your qualifications for running this type of organization?

Great question! To learn more about us, visit our websites:

Anne LaFond
Founder & Artistic Director

Nicholas Rispoli
Director of Programs and Operations

Angel Garron
Director of Development & Communications

Visit Window Studio to see all the artwork and stories so far!

Like us on Facebook!
story_txt:
Help launch and support a new community
art center in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn! Window Studio is a unique art space that
offers much needed resources for local artists, youth, and families. We’re growing everyday but we need
your donation to become a thriving, sustainable art center!With
your help, Window Studio will be able to offer three core programs at low
or no cost to the public.Window Studio Artist-in-Residence (AIR): An
intensive 6-month studio artist residency designed to immerse artists in their
studio practice while sharing their process with the community. Artists from
all media are invited to apply. Four residencies, two held concurrently, are
offered each year. Emerging artists living and working in the Bedford-Stuyvesant
community are given preference but all New York City artists are welcome to
apply. Stipends are provided.

Window Studio Workshops: Artist-led
workshops are offered evenings and weekends for all ages and skill levels. In
keeping with the open, inclusive nature of Window Studio,
workshops are available to the public on a drop-in basis or for a monthly
membership. Supplies and instruction are included in the low-cost membership
fee ($10/session; $40/month) with financial aid available upon request. Workshops
include: drawing, painting, sculpture, animation and video production. 
Artist
Resource Center and Open Studio Space (OSS): Window
Studio is committed to supporting local artists from Bedford-Stuyvesant,
emerging and/or disadvantaged artists & arts professionals through a
variety of resource programs and studio space. Window Studio also hosts
quarterly exhibits of artists-in-residence work, as well as one open-call
juried exhibition by an emerging curator each year. Other cultural events open
to the public include Art-in-the-Garden parties held in collaboration with
other Bedford-Stuyvesant arts organizations.
There are only a few visual arts organizations
in Bed-Stuy and art programs in the schools have been severely cut. According
to a recently released report quoted in the New
York Times, “more than 42 percent of the schools that do not have
state-certified arts teachers are clustered in the South Bronx and Central
Brooklyn.”  


Jamohri
and Kimora with their artwork after class. Photo by Anne LaFond.The workshops at Window Studio have become an increasingly vibrant part of
the project. Most of the kids who come are middle school age. While some, at
least initially, are accompanied by a parent or another relative, several of
them come on their own initiative. – Anne LaFond, Founder & Artistic Director (See more stories in “Pictures in Words”)
Window Studio’s programs
offer opportunities for artists from the Bed-Stuy neighborhood to be
an integral part of the local arts community. I admire any artist who displays the courage to
fulfill their life’s purpose despite the myriad of daily challenges artists face. I am honored to facilitate their artistic
realization here at Window Studio. – Nicholas Rispoli, Director of Programs & OperationsOur goal is to
secure funding in order to expand from being a neighborhood art project to a
full community art center in the coming year. It is our hope to become an
independent non-profit organization with 501(c)3 status. At this stage, with
our limited staff and resources, we are launching a fundraising campaign to
cover our start-up costs and operating expenses. 
Your donation will help us: 

Purchase
art supplies and storage for workshop materials ($5,000)

Fund
stipends for our artists-in-residence ($2,000)

Allow
us to paint our walls and make other needed renovations ($1,250)

Obtain basic office furniture ($2,000)

Buy office computers and software ($4,000)
Purchase video production equipment for multi-media workshops ($10,000)

Upgrade
our lighting ($2,000)

Contribute
to our rent and utilities ($11,900)
Pay
our hardworking minimal staff and extend
our operating hours ($20,000)
Market
our programs ($9,500)(*Estimates based on current projected budget)

Given
the economic circumstances of the majority of Window Studio’s audience, it is
essential that our residencies, workshops, exhibitions and other programs be
offered for
no or low cost to the public!

your help, will we be able to do this. We thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

The Affirmative Art Tour is a collaborative art experience to help identify what you truly want in life, and build a community of support to Empower Your Dreams. Finding your true purpose in life is one of the most important things you can do for yourself and your community.

Magnitude

In May 2016, the Affirmative Art Team will tour the United States from Boston to Los Angeles to further develop the process and grow Affirmative Art. We will reach over 21 cities with planned workshops in each one. In collaboration with diverse groups ranging from community arts centers, senior centers, populations with disabilities, farmers markets, teen centers churches, and educational institutions, Affirmative Art will provide free two-hour long workshops to empower the dreams of over 420 people. We will develop a complementary digital platform to connect participants to each other for ongoing support. Through building these relationships, we can also share Affirmative Art to those who want to continue programs in their local communities. To continue this work, a 2017 Tour will return to the places visited in 2016 to take stock of outcomes, learn, and further develop Affirmative Art!


What We Need & What You Get

Affirmative Art needs funds to travel across the United States to facilitate free workshops and create a community of shared experience and support.

We need:

·  USD 10000 - Vehicle: purchase van, insurance, and fuel on the way 

·  USD 800 - Materials: drawing and painting materials for 21+ workshops.

·  USD 200 - Internet connection

·  USD 1000 - Food and accommodation for three facilitators 

·  USD 3000 - Stipends (The Affirmative Art Team) 

You get:

USD 25 - Post card with a personal thank you note.

USD 50 - Tote bag or Affirmative Art T-shirt

USD 100 -  Tote bag, Affirmative Art T-shirt, and 2 Affirmative Art post card

USD 250 - Your name/company name on Affirmative Dream Machine (van).

USD 1000 - Your name/company name on Affirmative Art Dream Machine, and custom made Affirmative Art workshop in your location.

All funds collected will go towards the Affirmative Art Tour 2016, amounts in excess of total budget will go towards Affirmative Art Tour 2017. 


Why Affirmative Art Tour

Most people go through life without asking what is in their heart, what is their true purpose. If we find our true purpose, doors open, and life becomes more joyful. Affirmative Art offers tools to empower dreams, and provides a community for mutual support. 

Why a tour in USA?

Affirmative Art started in Africa because to dream big is a daring act in the face of so many thinking all you need to worry about is survival. In the US, we were surprised to find that here to people sometimes forget to dream big and follow what is in their heart due to pressures from others’ expectations. The current instability of the American Dream adds to the need to discover each individual’s true dream. For women and minorities, the “Traditional American Dream” was never a reality; now is the time to Empower Your Dreams that are already in your heart. 

Success track record

Affirmative Art workshops have been successful in Africa for the past five years, empowering hundreds of people to discover their own vision for what they truly want in life. Here in the Boston area, workshops successful workshops have been conducted at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Roxbury Community College (RCC), and Sudanese Immigrant groups, and with Harvard fellows. Affirmative Art has inspired participants to ongoing support through a larger of Affirmative Art Community.


Risks & Challenges

Many of the workshop hosts are already confirmed, there is a risk that some may be cancelled. Another risk is that some participants may not fully understand the concept and/or join the Affirmative Art community that helps encourage dreams and provides a supportive environment.

The Affirmative Art team consists of 3 members, 2 with substantial experience in Affirmative Art and/or community art engagement. 2 of the team members have been associated with MIT. 1 team member has lived 15 years in Africa and overcome many challenges in previous Affirmative Art work there. The team has experience and a great age balance, with team members in 20s, 30s and 40s. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help by sharing the campaign with your network - sharing the message of empowering dreams, and the opportunity of finding one's purpose using Affirmative Art. You can also help us identify potential partners for future workshops.

Thank you for your support!


More info about Affirmative Art, the tour and the team: www.affirmativeart.org

 Follow us on Instagram @affirmativetour | facebook.com/affirmativeart


Empower Your Dreams with Affirmative Art

story:
Hello INDIEGOGO

My name is Clayton Windatt, I work at the White Water Gallery Artist-Run Centre and I would like to introduce you to our Youth Arts Initiative.

Over the past few years a group of young emerging artists have grown from doing little things here and there to a group of youth focusing on professional development and outreach activities on a huge scale. The Youth Arts Initiative or YAI focuses on collaborative community projects and work together to make the world a better place. They also work to better themselves by bringing in professional artists for workshops, artist-talks and help give them the skills needed to succeed in life. This is the third year that the program has been in place but the first year that we have started seeking funds to run our program.

Up until now the program has been running as volunteer-only with small funds being raised by youth to cover supplies and workshop costs.  Our campaign is raising money to fund the core aspects of the YAI program and increase its capacity dramatically. This means that it will pay for space, supplies and employment to run the program year-round bringing the program to new heights. Our goal of $25,000 will create a new employment situation giving the youth group a coordinator to help run the program and create 12 new professional development workshops, artist talks and seminars that will be provided on-site and online on our website.

This is a big deal to us as it helps the existing youth have better opportunities for success in life but also will encourage and engage additional interest from new emerging artists in our region and abroad.

We have created a series of unique perks as incentives to donate to our campaign. These range from personalized postcards signed by all of our youth participants to Awards of Honour that will be given out at a big award ceremony later in the year.

The success of this project is the success of creativity in our community as this is our new generation of artists. Our community needs artistic growth of this kind and this funding will make life in our region a more beautiful, vibrant and a wonderful experience for everyone!

Get involved and spread the word! Like us out on Facebook and share our message of celebration and community through youth engagement in the arts! We are making change happen in our community, get out there and make things better for yours!

story:
SPINDRA is Coming to Flipside!!

SoS and Fireball looked at Flipside last year and said what this place needs is MORE ART!!!! 

And when we asked ourselves what kind of art, we said Sparkly BIG art. So we put our heads together and what we saw was a 10 foot tall Momma spider, filled with sparkly bouncing eggs on the Flipside sight that need help to hatch.


 Spindra Details

Spindra is a 10 foot tall steel spider, created by SoS and Fireball and friends  to play with. Her sparkly bouncing eggs are stuffed into her belly and  need your help to be turned. Yup that's right - she's interactive!!! Step right up and give that big old belly a turn to light up your eyes and heat up the night. She's going to be near the Fire and Ice Camp so come visit her there.

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget exceeded our expectations because we made her BIG- I mean REALLY BIG. All funds collected will be accounted for and contributors will get a summary emailed to them at the end of the project so you can see where your money went (transparency is sexy). Any leftover funds will be put into the Fire and Ice Art Grant for other artists to access so people can  BRING MORE ART!!

PERKS:
A $5- $10 donation gets you  our undying gratefulness, hugs (IF you consent) , and a big smile when you spin the belly. 

A $20 donation will get you your very own sparkly spider egg to take home and play with, our undying gratefulness, hugs (IF you consent), and a big smile when you spin the belly. If you don't pick it up at Flipside, it will be will delivered in June (I promise). 

A $50 donation will get your name etched onto Spindra's belly to let the world know that you are A SEXY ART SUPPORTER, a picture of that etching emailed to you, your very own sparkly spider egg to take home and play with, our undying gratefulness, hugs (IF you consent), and a big smile when you spin her belly.

A $500 donation will get Spindra delivered and erected on your property for a 3 month stay (if you have the proper space and city and/or HOA  permission, and you are in TEXAS), your name etched onto Spindra's belly to let the world know that you are A SEXY ART SUPPORTER, a picture of that etching emailed to you,  your very own sparkly spider egg to take home and play with, our undying gratefulness, hugs (IF you consent), and a big smile when you spin her belly.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are totally broke and cannot help financially (or just don't wanna see a 10 foot spider Momma come into being), you can still help us. Spread the word! Share this Indiegogo so SoS and I can make this happen.

story:
Help Me Spread my Tentacles

Noadi's Art is traveling and needs your help. I want to bring my octopus necklaces, tentacle earrings, and Cthulhu art all over New England this Fall.

This fall I'm exhibiting at three Comic Cons in three different states. It is a big step, before I've been limited to events in western and southern Maine but I'm busting out of my local comfort zone.

First up will still be in my home state but on the far opposite side at BangPop! Comic Con in Bangor, Maine, September 20-21. Then October 25-26 at Vermont Comic Con in Burlington. Finally I will be traveling to the farthest (and to the biggest) of the three: Rhode Island Comic Con November 1-2 in Providence.

Who am I?

Noadi's Art is just me, Sheryl Westleigh. Everything I sell is my own creation, every necklace, every earring, every sculpture I've made with my own hands. I do have prints of my 2 dimensional work printed for me but that's the only exception.

I started sculpting as a hobby in 2005, creating small sculptures and jewelry for friends and family. In 2008 I started Noadi’s Art as a part-time business and by early 2010 Noadi’s Art was my full-time job. Through my online store I've sold to all 50 states and over 20 countries.

I create jewelry from polymer clay, resin, and even actual petri dishes. Everything from steampunk cuttlefish, to deep space squid, tentacles, Lovecraftian horrors, and really anything that is a little weird and creepy.


What I Need & What You Get

Here are the estimated costs for attending these three conventions:

  • Registration fees: $485
  • Travel costs: $150
  • Motel Rooms (for BangPop! and RI Comic Con, I will be staying with friends for VT Comic Con): $400
  • Food: $100
  • Miscellaneous cost (printing, perks, and promotion): $265

Perks:

  • $1+ gets a heartfelt thank you.
  • $5 gets mt thanks and a 5% off coupon for my Etsy shop
  • $15 gets my thanks and a 15% off coupon for my Etsy shop.
  • $25 gets my thanks, the 15% off coupon, plus a signed 4"x5" Cthulhu Spawn print.

  • $50 gets my thanks, the 15% off coupon, and a signed 8"x10" Deep Sea Tentacles print.

  • $100 gets my thanks, the 15% off coupon, and either a mini Cthulhu figure or a Blue Ringed Octopus necklace.


  • $500 gets an original one of a kind sculpture. What will the sculpture be? I'll work with you to create a concept for a 4-5 inch tall sculpture or you can leave it up to me as a surprise.

What happens to the money if I don't reach my goal? Well I've already registered for all three Comic Cons so I'm going one way or another, though I will have to borrow money or use credit to afford all three.

      The Impact

      Noadi's Art is my sole source of income and as you can imagine being an artist is not an easy way to make a living.  Being able to expand my opportunities and reach a wider audience by attending these three events will be a big step forward for me. I will hopefully make enough money and gain exposure this fall at these three Comic Cons to do the following:

      • Fund attending conventions in 2015.
      • Expand my business so it is almost equally online and offline.
      • Further expand the sculpture side of things. Right now most of what I make and sell is jewelry because having full sized sculptures molded and cast is beyond what I can accomplish with my budget.
      • Reach new customers and network with other artists.
      • Have a blast! Comic Cons are a load of work but also fun. This is the most amazing job I've ever had.

      I get to make cool stuff like this for a living! Being able to exhibit at more events means I can keep doing this.

        Risks & Challenges

        One of the hurdles involved is the travel aspect. I can't drive so for every event I vend at I have to arrange transportation. Luckily for me I have great friends who are willing to help me out but I need to cover their costs too since they are taking time away from home (and sometimes work) to help. I'm trying to keep costs down as much as possible, but if there's nothing else I've learned in the years I've been running Noadi's Art it's how to stick to a budget.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you can't contribute to the campaign but would still like to help please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, wherever you can.

I create jewelry from polymer clay, resin, and even actual petri dishes. Everything from steampunk cuttlefish, to deep space squid, tentacles, Lovecraftian horrors, and really anything that is a little weird and creepy. 


What I Need & What You Get Here are the estimated costs for attending these three conventions: 
Registration fees: $485
 Travel costs: $150
Motel Rooms (for BangPop! and RI Comic Con, I will be staying with friends for VT Comic Con): $400
Food: $100
Miscellaneous cost (printing, perks, and promotion): $265

Perks:

$1+ gets a heartfelt thank you.
$5 gets mt thanks and a 5% off coupon for my Etsy shop

$15 gets my thanks and a 15% off coupon for my Etsy shop.
$25 gets my thanks, the 15% off coupon, plus a signed 4"x5" Cthulhu Spawn print. 

$50 gets my thanks, the 15% off coupon, and a signed 8"x10" Deep Sea Tentacles print. 

$100 gets my thanks, the 15% off coupon, and either a mini Cthulhu figure or a Blue Ringed Octopus necklace. 

$500 gets an original one of a kind sculpture. What will the sculpture be? I'll work with you to create a concept for a 4-5 inch tall sculpture or you can leave it up to me as a surprise.


What happens to the money if I don't reach my goal? Well I've already registered for all three Comic Cons so I'm going one way or another, though I will have to borrow money or use credit to afford all three.


  The Impact Noadi's Art is my sole source of income and as you can imagine being an artist is not an easy way to make a living.  Being able to expand my opportunities and reach a wider audience by attending these three events will be a big step forward for me. I will hopefully make enough money and gain exposure this fall at these three Comic Cons to do the following: 
Fund attending conventions in 2015. Expand my business so it is almost equally online and offline.
 Further expand the sculpture side of things. Right now most of what I make and sell is jewelry because having full sized sculptures molded and cast is beyond what I can accomplish with my budget.
Reach new customers and network with other artists.
Have a blast! Comic Cons are a load of work but also fun. This is the most amazing job I've ever had.



I get to make cool stuff like this for a living! Being able to exhibit at more events means I can keep doing this.
  Risks & Challenges  One of the hurdles involved is the travel aspect. I can't drive so for every event I vend at I have to arrange transportation. Luckily for me I have great friends who are willing to help me out but I need to cover their costs too since they are taking time away from home (and sometimes work) to help. I'm trying to keep costs down as much as possible, but if there's nothing else I've learned in the years I've been running Noadi's Art it's how to stick to a budget. 
  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't contribute to the campaign but would still like to help please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, wherever you can.

story:
HELP US FINISH RESTORING THIS HISTORIC SAN FRANCISCO MURAL


In 1984, more than 30 artists and activists came together to form the project PLACA. We wanted to express - in visual terms - our opposition  to our government's wars of intervention in Central America, our solidarity with the people of these nations and our respect for refugees from these wars, who were arriving in San Francisco's Mission District by the thousands . 

PLACA transformed the neglected Balmy Alley, in the heart of the Mission District, into an incredible outdoor art environment. Our mural, "Culture Contains the Seed of Resistance that Blossoms into the Flower of Liberation," is the last remaining complete mural from 30 years ago.

Each year the mural is viewed by thousands of people from around the world, and photos of it have been published in many books and magazines. But over the years it deteriorated badly. Here is how it looked before we began our restoration.



Thanks to many generous contributions, we have nearly completed our work. Here is how the mural looks today.



A definite improvement! But we have more detail work to do and we've run through our paint and worn out our brushes. Once we finish painting, we need to cover both the  mural and the back of the garage doors with several coats of a costly varnish that will protect and preserve the mural for decades to come. So we are asking for your support. Please donate if you can, and get the word out to your friends. No donation is too small. Every dollar helps.

Thank you! ¡Gracias!

Miranda Bergman and O'Brien Thiele

story:
About Me and Why?


Hi, my name is Chianti-pronounced like the wine to all my wine aficionados-and I'm a Carolina Girl! I did not attend the University of South Carolina nor Clemson University *smile*, I am an alum of Coastal Carolina University- GO Chanticleers!!


I am launching this campaign to create greeting cards. Yes, I said it, greeting cards. Not your average greeting cards though, greeting cards that give EVERYONE a voice! While in a relationship with a past girlfriend, I searched high and low for a card that expressed exactly what I wanted to say. Suffice it to say, I found nothing and ended up creating the card myself. Here it is, ten years later and the same thing applies. There aren't any cards that correctly express the LGBTQ community including situations, relationships, and holidays-THIS is something that I aim to change!

How You Can Help

Your first love. Your first break up. Your wedding proposal. The adoption or birth or a child. These subjects and countless others all have value and deserve the same spotlight as Christmas or a first birthday. With your help, this dream can be a reality! There is no such thing as free lunch in business, nor in life. Quality paper card stock, printing services, marketing, and great artwork are not free.  Because of this, I need your help to raise $5000 to accomplish this launch. Your contributions will assist with:

-paying our graphic designers and illustrators

-printing and shipping of greeting cards

-ordering supplies such as recycled card stock and envelopes for printing

-proper licensing and copyrighting of images


    The Impact

    As I start this journey, I am finding so many talented artists in the LGBTQ community. I foresee art exhibits to raising funds for HIV/AIDS research, funding organizations that assist with Hospice, to name a few. I see youth outreach that addresses the ever-climbing rate of suicide among our LGBTQ youth. The future is endless, and I don't see it ending there. I know that I will not be able to accomplish this in one day, but if I can see it, it can be!  I think this is a GREAT opportunity for personal expression and to further affect change for the LGBTQ community. "To whom much is given, much is expected." Failure is NOT an option for me. The only way to make lasting change is one person and one day at a time.

      Risks & Challenges

      I realize that I am being optimistic about this endeavor and like any business, there will be challenges that will arise.  An immediate obstacle is procuring a mixture of art and illustrations. A more long term obstacle would be that of prejudice. In addition to featuring greeting cards that highlight various occasions in the LGBTQ community, we also aim to educate by introducing uplifting, magnificent, and great works of art from LGBTQ artists and causes affecting and benefiting our community. We will also partner with various organizations both local and nationally to do our part with educating and lifting the stigma surrounding the LGBTQ community. 


        Other Ways You Can Help

        I realize that everyone will not be able to contribute monetarily, here are other ways you can help:

        -share my campaign on your various social media accounts

        -spread the word about KS Publishing and our products

        -like our Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Tumblr accounts

        -visit our website at kspublishing.net on our "Coming Out" day of (National Coming Out Day) October 11, 2014 to spread the word and join in the festivities.

        THANK YOU!!! I sincerely thank you in advance for taking he time to read about me. I know that this is the internet, and because of that, there is an inherent anonymity built in.  However, by reading this, you took the time to get to know me.   I am putting everything into this project, putting it all on the line.  Again, I thank you for not writing this off as unimportant.

I know that this is the internet, and because of that, there is an inherent anonymity built in.  However, by reading this, you took the time to get to know me.   I am putting everything into this project, putting it all on the line.  Again, I thank you for not writing this off as unimportant.

story:
Aus aktuellem Anlass:

Leider funktioniert die Kreditkartenüberweisung ohne Paypal nicht zuverlässig. Deshalb haben wir ein Extra-Konto dafür eingerichtet. Alle die mit Kreditkarte überweisen möchten: Nutzt bitte das folgende Konto der Gründerin Franka. Euren Perk-Wunsch sowie eure Kontaktdaten vermerkt entweder im Betreff oder schreibt uns eine Mail an: franka@kiezladen-blank.berlin. Das Geld wird dann mit leichter Verzögerung auf die Crowdfunding-Seite überwiesen. Entschuldigt bitte die Umstände! Berliner Sparkasse – Franka - Isabel Eisenschenk – Iban: DE 12 1005 0000 1063897293 – BIC: BELADEBEXXX

Kurzbeschreibung

Dem Team des Kiezladens Blank ist besonders eines wichtig: ein bewussteres Konsumverhalten anzustoßen. Deswegen verkaufen wir, passend zu unserem Namen, „nackte“ (also unverpackte) Ware. Wie das funktioniert? Ihr bringt eure eigenen Verpackungen (Tupperdosen, Schraubgläser, Flaschen oder Beutel) mit oder leiht sie bei uns aus – und ihr füllt die gewünschte Menge des jeweiligen Produktes ab. Das ist nämlich auch so ein Vorteil, den unser Konzept mit sich bringt: Ihr kauft genau die Menge, die ihr braucht. So landen weniger Lebensmittel auf dem Müll. Und ihr spart Geld. Selbstredend ist unsere Ware komplett biologisch, regional und vegan oder vegetarisch. Außerdem bieten wir saisonales Obst und Gemüse an, das nicht der EU-Norm entspricht – und normaler- und unsinnigerweise im Abfall der Bauern landen oder verfüttert werden würden. Unser leckeres Bio-Essen To-Go soll euch dabei helfen, dass auch auch in einem stressigen Arbeitsalltag gesunde Ernährung ihren Platz findet. Mit diesem Konzept möchten wir dazu beitragen, ein wenig mehr Bewusstsein in den eigenen Konsum zu integrieren – denn ökologisch verantwortungsvoller zu leben ist gar nicht zu aufwändig, wie es zuerst scheinen mag. Zudem möchten wir mit unserem Kiezladen Blank ein Treffpunkt für Menschen sein, die Wert auf bewussten Genuss legen und gerne die Menschen aus ihrem Kiez näher kennenlernen wollen. Unser Café- und Kuchenangebot laden nach dem Einkauf zum Verweilen ein. Und wir freuen uns, euch kennenzulernen und gemeinsam eine neue Bewegung anzustoßen.

Was sind die Ziele und wer die Zielgruppe?

Wir setzen uns mit Herzblut für ein bewussteres Konsumverhalten ein. Denn wir finden, dass man unnötigen Plastikmüll vermeiden kann – und zwar in der gesamten Lieferkette. Deswegen arbeiten wir auch mit ausgewählten Bio-Höfen Berlins und Brandenburgs zusammen und sorgen dafür, dass bei keinem Schritt der Lieferkette sinnlose Verpackungsmaterialien verwendet werden. Außerdem sorgen wir so für mehr Transparenz für unsere Kunden: Wir wissen genau, woher unsere Produkte stammen – und können so Vertrauen schaffen.

In unserem Kiezladen Blank freuen wir uns über offene, aufgeschlossene und genussvolle Menschen, die bewusst leben und konsumieren möchten. Menschen unterschiedlichsten Alters, die an ihrem ökologischen Fußabdruck arbeiten wollen und bereits erkannt haben, dass ein wesentlicher Schlüssel für Veränderung reflektiertes Konsumverhalten ist. Aber die vielleicht im Alltag nicht die Zeit dafür finden, sich mit diesem Thema so konsequent, wie sie es möchten, auseinanderzusetzen. Deshalb möchten wir euch den Schritt zu diesem Ansatz so einfach wie möglich gestalten. Zudem freuen wir uns über ein Kiez-nachbarschaftliches Miteinander. Denn wir legen Wert auf einen persönlichen Austausch mit unseren Lieferanten und Gästen.

Warum sollte man dieses Projekt unterstützen?

Dieses Problem kennt jeder: Wir alle produzieren einfach zu viel Müll. Und alle zahlen dabei auch noch drauf. Dabei sind viele Verpackungen einfach unnötig – seien es Milchtüten, Shampoo-Flaschen oder Nudeln in Plastik. Doch spielen hier nicht nur ökologische Aspekte eine Rolle – sondern auch die Zeit, die für Ein- und Auspacken und Recyclen bzw Entsorgen vertan wird.

Außerdem werden viele Produkte ausschließlich in normierten Größen angeboten, die oft nicht der Lebensrealität (zum Beispiel von Singles, Pendlern oder auch Großfamilien) entsprechen. Das ist ein weiterer Punkt, der unsere Müllberge anwachsen lässt. Wir denken: Das muss nicht sein.


Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung?

Wenn wir 30.000 Euro zusammen bekommen haben, möchten wir ein Ladenlokal in Berlin anmieten. Da wir unsere Ware ja blank, also unverpackt, anbieten, brauchen wir Gefäße, in die die einzelnen Produkte nach Anlieferung durch ihren Erzeuger abgefüllt werden. Das werden zum Beispiel Gravity Bins (Bulk Bins), Holzkisten für Gemüse oder Theken mit einzelnen Schüttgut-Gefäßen sein. Außerdem müssen wir die Gefäße, die wir unseren Kunden ausleihen, noch anschaffen – zum Beispiel verschließbare Glasflaschen, Schraubgläser und Ähnliches … Dazu kommen Kühlmöbel, eine Kaffeemaschine und weiteres typisches Equipment, das für einen laufenden Café- und Ladenbetrieb benötigt wird. Unser Ladenlokal soll mit Holz reduziert und gemütlich ausgebaut werden. Und sich so zu einem Ort entwickeln, in dem ihr als Kunden gerne zurückkehrt – sei es für einen Einkauf, einen Kaffee oder auch einen netten Plausch unter Kiez-Nachbarn. 

Wie ihr uns sonst noch helfen könnt...

Neben finanzieller freuen wir uns auch über eure tatkäftige Unterstützung. Schließlich wollen wir unser Ladenlokal von der Pike auf selber gestalten. Falls also jemand von euch handwerklich begabt ist und Lust hat, uns ein wenig zu helfen, würden wir uns natürlich sehr freuen. Außerdem benötigen wir noch jegliche Einrichtungsgegenstände – von Möbeln über Kühlschränke bis hin zu Regalen oder einer Kaffeemaschine. Vielleicht hat ja der ein oder andere einen gewissen Lagerbestand … ;)
Und schaut euch unbedingt unsere tollen Dankeschöns an!

Warum Crowdfunding – warum Indiegogo?

Wir möchten mit kleinen Schritten versuchen, etwas mehr Bewusstsein und Transparenz in unser Konsumverhalten zu bringen. Doch damit wir anfangen können, brauchen wir Starthilfe: Dafür bietet sich unserer Meinung nach das Netzwerk von Indiegogo besonders gut an – so eine Reichweite würden wir alleine nicht unbedingt erreichen. Außerdem beinhaltet diese Finanzierungsmöglichkeit wenig Risiko für junge Unternehmer wie uns.

Wer steht hinter dem Projekt?

Mein Name ist Franka, ich komme aus Berlin und arbeite seit mehreren Jahren in der Werbebranche und bin dadurch fast täglich mit Verpackungen und allem, was sich um Produkte herum abspielt, beschäftigt. Meiner Meinung nach werden viel zu viele Ressourcen auf das „Drumherum“ verschwendet, anstatt sich mit dem eigentlichen Produkt auseinanderzusetzen. Deshalb möchte ich einen Kiezladen eröffnen, der Lebensmittel ausschließlich unverpackt anbietet.

Alleine ist so ein Projekt natürlich nicht zu stemmen – und macht auch nur halb soviel Spaß. Deswegen möchte ich an dieser Stelle auch mein großartiges Team vorstellen, das mir hilft, dieses Herzens-Projekt zu realisieren – und mich zugleich immer weiter zu inspirieren:

Philipp - Sparringpartner & Innenausbau

Kristina - Grafik-Design & Illustration

Heike - Filmdreh und-schnitt, Fotografie

Sonja - Social Media Beratung

Kathrin - Text/ PR

Stella, Christoph, Bartholomäus, Lena, Kristina - Statements

Mama, Papa & Oskar - seelische Unterstützung

Ein besonderes Dankeschön geht an:

Lobetal Molkerei Biesenthal

Hofladen Melchhof Melchow

Engels Neukölln

Lars Fischer, Hans Christian Fuss

Danke an euch alle <3


What is the project about?

The team of Blank cares about one thing more than any other: promoting a
more conscious and sensible consumer behavior. That's why we sell exactly what it says on the tin: blank, naked and unpackaged, products. How does that work? You just bring your own packaging (tupperware, screw-top jars, bottles or baggies) or you can lend one of our vessels  and then you fill it with exactly the desired amount of product. That's another one of the advantages of our
concept: you only buy as much as you need. This way, less groceries are wasted, while you save money. Our products are, of course, 100% organic, local and vegan or vegetarian. Additionally, we offer seasonal fruits and vegetables that don't conform to EU-standards and would otherwise be thrown away or fed to livestock, although perfectly edible. Our delicious organic take-out helps you to follow a healthy diet during the busy work week. We want our own consumption to be more aware  living environmentally responsible is not as complicated as it may seem. Additionally, we want our store to be a
meeting point for people from the neighborhood who share a passion for good food without a side of guilt. Our food and bakery items entice to hang around for a while. And we are looking forward to meeting you and toasting to a new movement with you.

What are the goals and the target audience? 

We want a more conscious kind of consumer behavior  and we are giving
this cause our blood, sweat and tears. Because we believe unnecessary plastic waste can be avoided  throughout the entire supply chain. That's why we work with hand-picked organic farms in Berlin and Brandenburg and make sure that no unnecessary packaging material is used during any step of the way. This way, we also offer more transparency. We know exactly where our products come from  and our customers can trust us on that.

We are excited to meet open-minded food aficionados at Blank. People of all ages who want to live a sensible lifestyle. Who want to reduce their carbon footprint and who have realized that if we want change, we must start with our own consumer behavior. People who may not find the time in their busy lives to handle this issue as consistently as they would like to. We are here to make it easier for you. And we are looking forward to a neighborly atmosphere at our store. We appreciate friendly communication, both with our customers and our
suppliers

Why should you support this project?

We all know the issue: We just produce too much waste. And we pay for it dearly, even though so much packaging is simply not necessary  be it milk cartons, shampoo bottles or pasta wrapped in plastic. It's not even just an environmental issue  there is also the time wasted on packaging, unwrapping, recycling or disposal to be considered. Additionally, many products can only be bought in standardized sizes, which often don't match the customer's reality (like single-person households, commuters or large families). This is another factor contributing to growing waste mountains. We think it doesn't have to be this way.

What will be done with the money?

If we source  30.000, we want to rent a store in Neukölln, Kreuzberg
or Schöneberg. Since we will sell our products blank, unpackaged, we need vessels to store them once we have received them from our suppliers. These will be gravity bins, wooden boxes for vegetables or counters with bulk bins. We will also need vessels that we can lend our customers, such as screw-top jars, glass bottles and the likes. Plus refrigeration equipment, a coffee machine and all the typical equipment needed for running a hospitality business. Our store will be furnished cozily and functionally with wood, so it can develop into a place that invites customers to come back  for grocery shopping, a cup of coffee or just a nice chat with the neighbors.

Other Ways You Can Help 

Aside from financial aid we would be delighted about some manual help. We
are trying to built our own business from scratch, after all. So if any of you are crafty, skilled or talented in a trade and don't mind getting your hands dirty, we would love it if you came by. We also need all kinds of equipment and furbishing  furniture, refrigerators, cupboards, a coffee machine and everything else. Maybe some of you have those things just lying around ... ;) And have a look we have lovely ThankYou's.

Why crowdfunding  why Indiegogo?

We want to take all the little steps needed to implement a little more awareness and transparency into our consumer behavior. But in order to get going with that, we're going to need help: We believe that Indiegogo is a great platform for that. We wouldn't be able to reach that far on our own. Crowdfunding also poses few risks for young entrepreneurs like us.

Who is behind this project?

My name is Franka, I'm from Berlin and have been working in advertising
for several years. That's where I deal with packaging and all things surrounding products that aren't the actual product almost daily. If you ask me, too many resources are wasted on what the product is wrapped in, rather than working on the product itself. That's why I want to open a neighborhood spot where groceries are sold unwrapped. But I am just one girl, and I could never bring this project to life on my own and it wouldn't be nearly as much fun, either. So this is
where I introduce my fantastic team to you, the people who help me with this idea that I love so much  and who continue to inspire me every day:

Philipp - sparring partner and interior construction

Kristina - graphic design, illustration

Heike - film, cut, photography

Sonja - social media consulting

Kathrin - text & public relations

Stella, Christoph, Bartholomäus, Lena, Kristina  - statements

Mama, Papa & Oskar -  mental support

Thank you all so much <3

bewussteres Konsumverhalten ein. Denn wir finden, dass man unnötigen
Plastikmüll vermeiden kann – und zwar in der gesamten Lieferkette. Deswegen
arbeiten wir auch mit ausgewählten Bio-Höfen Berlins und Brandenburgs zusammen
und sorgen dafür, dass bei keinem Schritt der Lieferkette sinnlose
Verpackungsmaterialien verwendet werden. Außerdem sorgen wir so für mehr
Transparenz für unsere Kunden: Wir wissen genau, woher unsere Produkte stammen
– und können so Vertrauen schaffen.
In unserem Kiezladen Blank freuen wir uns über
offene, aufgeschlossene und genussvolle Menschen, die bewusst leben und
konsumieren möchten. Menschen unterschiedlichsten Alters, die an ihrem
ökologischen Fußabdruck arbeiten wollen und bereits erkannt haben, dass ein
wesentlicher Schlüssel für Veränderung reflektiertes Konsumverhalten ist. Aber
die vielleicht im Alltag nicht die Zeit dafür finden, sich mit diesem Thema so
konsequent, wie sie es möchten, auseinanderzusetzen. Deshalb möchten wir euch
den Schritt zu diesem Ansatz so einfach wie möglich gestalten. Zudem freuen wir
uns über ein Kiez-nachbarschaftliches Miteinander. Denn wir legen Wert auf einen persönlichen Austausch mit unseren
Lieferanten und Gästen. 
Warum
sollte man dieses Projekt unterstützen?
Dieses Problem kennt jeder: Wir alle
produzieren einfach zu viel Müll. Und alle zahlen dabei auch noch drauf. Dabei
sind viele Verpackungen einfach unnötig – seien es Milchtüten, Shampoo-Flaschen
oder Nudeln in Plastik. Doch spielen hier nicht nur ökologische Aspekte eine
Rolle – sondern auch die Zeit, die für Ein- und Auspacken und Recyclen bzw
Entsorgen vertan wird. 
Außerdem werden viele Produkte ausschließlich
in normierten Größen angeboten, die oft nicht der Lebensrealität (zum Beispiel
von Singles, Pendlern oder auch Großfamilien) entsprechen. Das ist ein weiterer
Punkt, der unsere Müllberge anwachsen lässt. Wir denken: Das muss nicht sein. Was passiert mit dem Geld bei
erfolgreicher Finanzierung?
Wenn wir 30.000 Euro zusammen bekommen haben,
möchten wir ein Ladenlokal in Berlin anmieten. Da
wir unsere Ware ja blank, also unverpackt, anbieten, brauchen wir Gefäße, in
die die einzelnen Produkte nach Anlieferung durch ihren Erzeuger abgefüllt
werden. Das werden zum Beispiel Gravity Bins (Bulk Bins), Holzkisten für Gemüse
oder Theken mit einzelnen Schüttgut-Gefäßen sein. Außerdem müssen wir die
Gefäße, die wir unseren Kunden ausleihen, noch anschaffen – zum Beispiel
verschließbare Glasflaschen, Schraubgläser und Ähnliches … Dazu kommen
Kühlmöbel, eine Kaffeemaschine und weiteres typisches Equipment, das für einen
laufenden Café- und Ladenbetrieb benötigt wird. Unser Ladenlokal soll mit Holz reduziert
und gemütlich ausgebaut werden. Und sich so zu einem Ort entwickeln, in dem ihr
als Kunden gerne zurückkehrt – sei es für einen Einkauf, einen Kaffee oder auch
einen netten Plausch unter Kiez-Nachbarn. Wie ihr uns sonst noch helfen könnt...Neben finanzieller freuen wir uns
auch über eure tatkäftige Unterstützung. Schließlich wollen wir unser
Ladenlokal von der Pike auf selber gestalten. Falls also jemand von euch
handwerklich begabt ist und Lust hat, uns ein wenig zu helfen, würden wir uns
natürlich sehr freuen. Außerdem benötigen wir noch jegliche
Einrichtungsgegenstände – von Möbeln über Kühlschränke bis hin zu Regalen oder
einer Kaffeemaschine. Vielleicht hat ja der ein oder andere einen gewissen
Lagerbestand … ;)Und schaut euch unbedingt unsere tollen Dankeschöns an!Warum Crowdfunding – warum Indiegogo?Wir möchten mit kleinen Schritten versuchen,
etwas mehr Bewusstsein und Transparenz in unser Konsumverhalten zu bringen.
Doch damit wir anfangen können, brauchen wir Starthilfe: Dafür bietet sich
unserer Meinung nach das Netzwerk von Indiegogo besonders gut an – so eine
Reichweite würden wir alleine nicht unbedingt erreichen. Außerdem beinhaltet
diese Finanzierungsmöglichkeit wenig Risiko für junge Unternehmer wie uns. 
Wer steht hinter dem Projekt?
Mein Name ist Franka, ich komme aus Berlin und
arbeite seit mehreren Jahren in der Werbebranche und bin dadurch fast täglich
mit Verpackungen und allem, was sich um Produkte herum abspielt, beschäftigt.
Meiner Meinung nach werden viel zu viele Ressourcen auf das „Drumherum“
verschwendet, anstatt sich mit dem eigentlichen Produkt auseinanderzusetzen.
Deshalb möchte ich einen Kiezladen eröffnen, der Lebensmittel ausschließlich
unverpackt anbietet. Alleine ist so ein Projekt natürlich nicht zu
stemmen – und macht auch nur halb soviel Spaß. Deswegen möchte ich an dieser
Stelle auch mein großartiges Team vorstellen, das mir hilft, dieses
Herzens-Projekt zu realisieren – und mich zugleich immer weiter zu inspirieren:
Philipp - Sparringpartner & InnenausbauKristina - Grafik-Design & IllustrationHeike - Filmdreh und-schnitt, Fotografie

Sonja - Social Media Beratung
Kathrin - Text/ PR
Stella, Christoph, Bartholomäus, Lena, Kristina - Statements
Mama, Papa & Oskar - seelische UnterstützungEin besonderes Dankeschön geht an:Lobetal Molkerei BiesenthalHofladen Melchhof MelchowEngels NeuköllnLars Fischer, Hans Christian FussDanke an euch alle <3 
What is the project about?The team of Blank cares about one thing more than any other: promoting amore conscious and sensible consumer behavior. That's why we sell exactly what it says on the tin: blank, naked and unpackaged, products. How does that work? You just bring your own packaging (tupperware, screw-top jars, bottles or baggies) or you can lend one of our vessels  and then you fill it with exactly the desired amount of product. That's another one of the advantages of ourconcept: you only buy as much as you need. This way, less groceries are wasted, while you save money. Our products are, of course, 100% organic, local and vegan or vegetarian. Additionally, we offer seasonal fruits and vegetables that don't conform to EU-standards and would otherwise be thrown away or fed to livestock, although perfectly edible. Our delicious organic take-out helps you to follow a healthy diet during the busy work week. We want our own consumption to be more aware  living environmentally responsible is not as complicated as it may seem. Additionally, we want our store to be ameeting point for people from the neighborhood who share a passion for good food without a side of guilt. Our food and bakery items entice to hang around for a while. And we are looking forward to meeting you and toasting to a new movement with you.What are the goals and the target audience? We want a more conscious kind of consumer behavior  and we are givingthis cause our blood, sweat and tears. Because we believe unnecessary plastic waste can be avoided  throughout the entire supply chain. That's why we work with hand-picked organic farms in Berlin and Brandenburg and make sure that no unnecessary packaging material is used during any step of the way. This way, we also offer more transparency. We know exactly where our products come from  and our customers can trust us on that.We are excited to meet open-minded food aficionados at Blank. People of all ages who want to live a sensible lifestyle. Who want to reduce their carbon footprint and who have realized that if we want change, we must start with our own consumer behavior. People who may not find the time in their busy lives to handle this issue as consistently as they would like to. We are here to make it easier for you. And we are looking forward to a neighborly atmosphere at our store. We appreciate friendly communication, both with our customers and oursuppliersWhy should you support this project?We all know the issue: We just produce too much waste. And we pay for it dearly, even though so much packaging is simply not necessary  be it milk cartons, shampoo bottles or pasta wrapped in plastic. It's not even just an environmental issue  there is also the time wasted on packaging, unwrapping, recycling or disposal to be considered. Additionally, many products can only be bought in standardized sizes, which often don't match the customer's reality (like single-person households, commuters or large families). This is another factor contributing to growing waste mountains. We think it doesn't have to be this way.What will be done with the money?If we source  30.000, we want to rent a store in Neukölln, Kreuzbergor Schöneberg. Since we will sell our products blank, unpackaged, we need vessels to store them once we have received them from our suppliers. These will be gravity bins, wooden boxes for vegetables or counters with bulk bins. We will also need vessels that we can lend our customers, such as screw-top jars, glass bottles and the likes. Plus refrigeration equipment, a coffee machine and all the typical equipment needed for running a hospitality business. Our store will be furnished cozily and functionally with wood, so it can develop into a place that invites customers to come back  for grocery shopping, a cup of coffee or just a nice chat with the neighbors.Other Ways You Can Help Aside from financial aid we would be delighted about some manual help. Weare trying to built our own business from scratch, after all. So if any of you are crafty, skilled or talented in a trade and don't mind getting your hands dirty, we would love it if you came by. We also need all kinds of equipment and furbishing  furniture, refrigerators, cupboards, a coffee machine and everything else. Maybe some of you have those things just lying around ... ;) And have a look we have lovely ThankYou's.Why crowdfunding  why Indiegogo?We want to take all the little steps needed to implement a little more awareness and transparency into our consumer behavior. But in order to get going with that, we're going to need help: We believe that Indiegogo is a great platform for that. We wouldn't be able to reach that far on our own. Crowdfunding also poses few risks for young entrepreneurs like us.Who is behind this project?My name is Franka, I'm from Berlin and have been working in advertisingfor several years. That's where I deal with packaging and all things surrounding products that aren't the actual product almost daily. If you ask me, too many resources are wasted on what the product is wrapped in, rather than working on the product itself. That's why I want to open a neighborhood spot where groceries are sold unwrapped. But I am just one girl, and I could never bring this project to life on my own and it wouldn't be nearly as much fun, either. So this iswhere I introduce my fantastic team to you, the people who help me with this idea that I love so much  and who continue to inspire me every day:Philipp - sparring partner and interior constructionKristina - graphic design, illustrationHeike - film, cut, photographySonja - social media consultingKathrin - text & public relationsStella, Christoph, Bartholomäus, Lena, Kristina  - statementsMama, Papa & Oskar -  mental supportThank you all so much <3

story:
Dragon Alley Art

Dragon Alley Art is an artist's loft centered in Cooperstown, NY, better known as the home of baseball.

Founded in 2014 by two writers, co-authors, artists and close friends, Dragon Alley Art started as a non-profit organization for the display, advocacy, and sale of art, products, jewelry and crafts of local artisans.

Initially frowned upon by the art community, Dragon Alley has swiftly fallen on hard times because the co-owners and minds behind the Alley started with one philosophy:

NO JURYING ART!

We never thought that this would be such a problem with the community, but there you have it.

We thought that an artist's loft ought to celebrate art for art's sake, and to be a place where all artists, no matter the education level, social standing, or overall 'quality' of their work ought to be judged.

Take for example;

We thought that if a six year-old wanted to make some jewelry and sell necklaces for a couple dollars a piece, that ought to be nurtured and encouraged. Her stuff might not make waves at Tiffany's, but it makes her happy to know someone appreciated her work and bought one of her bracelets.

If a seventeen year-old  with a penchant for off-kilter art whose talent had been spurned by the local art associations and juried shows wanted to hang up a couple of paintings for sale because someone out there would appreciate his stuff, we thought that would be splendid.

As such, we've fallen on hard times. Our locale needs a facelift and relocation, our co-owners need some assistance and we need some help to really get the idea of art for art's sake out there and garnering some support from artist's from everywhere.


That's our only real wish, here, everyone. We want to keep this dream alive for the little people out there who're told their art or crafts are too 'weird', too 'non-conformist' or too 'poorly done', young artists, new artists, experienced and inexperienced artists alike, everyone is welcome!


We need YOUR help!

story:
Water Is Vital For All Forms of Life

Water covers 71% of the Earth's surface and is vital for all known forms of life. Safe drinking water is essential to humans and other life forms. The global water challenge is the reason Phantastic Art would like to raise public awareness through its Water Campaign and contribute in a very positive way to the ongoing discussions.

Water Campaign Painting

The Giant 

Wall Poster

We have a dream to create a giant wall poster and attract public attention for free and wise water usage worldwide. The water campaign panorama wall is presented in a traveling exhibition in larger world cities e.g. New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, London, Milan, Tokyo and Zürich. Our campaign ensures the start-up funding and marketing for the giant wall poster. The final size will be ultimately determined by the location, sponsor contributions and advertising revenues as well.

Water Campaign Facade

The Artist

Carl-W. Röhrig is the founder of Phantastic Naturalism, he seems to be the perfect match for the artistic guidance of our Phantastic ART - Water Campaign. Roehrig is well known for his paintings published in GEO magazine. His paintings were on display at the ART Expo in New York and he received many awards for his extraordinary artistic achievements within the last decade. Roehrig is a member of The National Geographic Society in Washington D.C. 

One of Carl W. Roehrig favorite quotes: "I want to inspire people and delight them."


Frontpage Painting by Roehrig


Your Impact

Water Campaign Theme 2

In funding or supporting the campaign you would help to:

  • Raise public awareness about water-based vulnerability
  • Raise public awareness for free access to safe drinking water
  • Raise public awareness on the fact that water belongs to the people   
         
                               

Water Campaign Theme 3

What We Need & What You Get

By selling T-shirts, digital prints and single original paintings we would like to raise means for our giant wall poster project and the worldwide exhibition tour. By supporting our Phantastic ART - Water Campaign you can get:

  • Special thank you emails or letters
  • Unique "Phantastic Art” T-Shirts
  • Signed digital paintings (6 themes)
  • Original Paintings signed by the artist



Our Fantastic T-Shirt


Water Campaign Theme 4


Water Campaign Theme 5

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • Visit our homepage at www.roehrigart.com
  • Gives us some Facebook Likes on your favorite paintings or pages
  • Or just use the Indiegogo share button and help us go viral
       

Water Campaign Theme 6


If we don’t reach our entire fundraising goals we will raise public awareness via print and online advertisements on a smaller local scale anyway. Claimed Phantastic ART T-Shirts will be printed and delivered in any case.

All paintings shown in our video and on our indiegogo.com crowdfunding page can be ordered as digital prints. All content and images on the Phantastic ART- Water Campaign crowdfunding site are property of the artist. © 2013 Copyright by Carl W. Röhrig

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We are Indigo and Julia, besties and business partners with a shared vision of planetary healing, creative expression, and radical love for all beings ( aka GAX)!

Indigo is a certified sex, love, and relationship coach, painter, and clothing designer.

Julia is a kundalini yoga teacher, astrologer, creator, performer and producer. 

Together we are wildly passionate about spreading feminine principles and energy throughout the world. What does a business structure look like when it's founded on pleasure and abundance? We believe the feminine energy is accessible and exists in all beings, regardless of gender, and our mission seeks to help creatures of all identities find the feminine within their own bodies; grace, beauty, creativity, nourishment, and divine love.

WHAT IS BODY PARADISE?

Imagine walking on the busy streets of MLK to find yourself magnetically drawn to the beauty and serenity of a mini-shop, full of creations made by local artists and makers. Indigo's handmade creations lay in a sea of pink, and every dollar spent here fills up the pockets and hearts of worthy artisans. With a focus on sustainable fashion, wellness, and beauty products, all of the items in the shop are curated to compliment the healing offerings that happen in our temple. We hope to bring awareness to money as a circular energy--what you spend in this space, is a donation to your very own heart. If it isn't obvious, we are passionate about the earth, and our business functions as a low to zero waste operation!

Perhaps you stopped in for a magical astrology reading with Julia where you'll touch down into the blueprint of your path here on earth, or a one-on-one sex and intimacy coaching session with Indigo. Maybe you're here for a Kundalini class or group workshop on self-pleasure, or vision plant journeys, or moon worship. Maybe you've simply stumbled in and found yourself in our web of dreams! Whoever you are, during the open worship hours of our sanctuary, we'll invite you to take your shoes off, sit on a pillow, stare at the altar, and replenish. Rest. Relax. How often is it that we are able to deeply integrate consumerism with what we believe it's true purpose should be; to give to ourselves our heart's desire, so that we can give freely to our community?! Our altar is in worship to our business deva we call "The Big Lady" aka the earth; this life giving planet that supplies us with all resources, and all opportunities for growth and expansion of consciousness. You'll be invited to add to the altar, and worship, whenever the shop is open, whenever you book a session with one of us, or attend a workshop or class! 

OFFERINGS AND OUR WORK

Both of our work centers around creativity, playfulness, and storytelling. We are both artists and healers, and recognize that to heal is an act of creative artistry, and that to create art is an act of healing the self. We combine these modalities in all that we do, which is why Body Paradise and is deemed a "playground for your higher self!" Since this space is in worship to the divine feminine,  we have energetically set the space to hold a nourishing and nurturing container so that throughout our session work, workshops, and community gatherings we all collectively let out our inner kids to play, explore, and splash about into the depths of our own creative potential. 

WHERE IS IT LOCATED (AND WHY!?)

Body Paradise will be located in SE Portland on MLK. The space has been functioning as Julia's private studio, and is in full renovations to accommodate both our practices and support our creative dreams. We picked the location of this chaotically busy street-corner to be a glorious representation of what it is we hope to do with our work; many healing philosophies pump people full of love and light, but neglect to spread that beauty to the parts of the world and parts of the self that aren't as "pretty" or "acceptable". We hope that the presence of this space will in a subtle way (a feminine way!) help break down the conventions of what beauty means, who is allowed access to it, and how we can embrace the sounds of traffic and the trash outside our door as an equally divine part of what it means to be human, sending them love and acceptance rather than compartmentalization or rejection.  The dichotomy between this sanctuary of pleasure and beauty and the reality of the hustle, bustle and action of the streets is the polarity we are working with--how can we bring more love to the harshness? Compassion for the trauma? Use creativity to approach our triggers? With this space we declare that our worship of the earth and her ever persistent wildly feminine energy seep outward into the structures of the world that need it most; starting with our little street-corner. 

WHAT DO WE NEED FROM OUR LOVED ONES?

We are ecstatic to begin offering these gifts to the community and are very close to making it happen! In donating, you are allowing this business to thrive, and quickening the healing on this planet. Not only will you be supporting us as healers and artists, you are saying YES to a community driven by feminine principles. We'd be so grateful if you joined us in making the following accessible: 

1. Licensing/insurance/ permits: opening a business is a lot of work! Let the abundance flow, let the signs be put up inviting the world in, let our clients be safe inside this space! 

2. Renovations of the space in a sustainable fashion; prioritizing all reused goods or ethically made goods.

3. Production/Overhead for retail items: supporting local artisans, particularly from marginalized communities 

4. Website/Marketing/Community Outreach: reaching the people who need us the most. Supporting other creators by paying them for their time/effort/design/skills in curating an internet presence.

5. Rent supplement: we would love to offer low cost workshops and events to our community, which means accepting support for our expenses in keeping our doors open. 

Because we value sustainability, we will be sourcing most of our renovation materials from The Rebuilding Center, thrift stores, and free boxes around the city!  This also cuts costs by a lot, making each donated dollar go much further. 

If money isn't your preferred mode of donation, we'd humbly accept your time/energy/skills! Want to help hang mirrors? Paint? Source cool items for the shop? Have an idea for a workshop? Want to teach a class? Please be in touch with any and all ideas::we want to know you!

WHAT YOU'LL GET

We're offering mini sessions of coaching and astrology to give you a taste of our work! We're offering clothing! We're offering love! 

WE LOVE YOU, WE MEAN IT

Thank you so much for reading, sharing, donating, blessing up our new venture <3 

The big lady thanks you for you kindness, generosity and love.

xoxo

I & J
