Since this space is in worship to the divine feminine,  we have energetically set the space to hold a nourishing and nurturing container so that throughout our session work, workshops, and community gatherings we all collectively let out our inner kids to play, explore, and splash about into the depths of our own creative potential. WHERE IS IT LOCATED (AND WHY!?)Body Paradise will be located in SE Portland on MLK. The space has been functioning as Julia's private studio, and is in full renovations to accommodate both our practices and support our creative dreams. We picked the location of this chaotically busy street-corner to be a glorious representation of what it is we hope to do with our work; many healing philosophies pump people full of love and light, but neglect to spread that beauty to the parts of the world and parts of the self that aren't as "pretty" or "acceptable". We hope that the presence of this space will in a subtle way (a feminine way!) help break down the conventions of what beauty means, who is allowed access to it, and how we can embrace the sounds of traffic and the trash outside our door as an equally divine part of what it means to be human, sending them love and acceptance rather than compartmentalization or rejection.  The dichotomy between this sanctuary of pleasure and beauty and the reality of the hustle, bustle and action of the streets is the polarity we are working with--how can we bring more love to the harshness? Compassion for the trauma? Use creativity to approach our triggers? With this space we declare that our worship of the earth and her ever persistent wildly feminine energy seep outward into the structures of the world that need it most; starting with our little street-corner. WHAT DO WE NEED FROM OUR LOVED ONES?We are ecstatic to begin offering these gifts to the community and are very close to making it happen! In donating, you are allowing this business to thrive, and quickening the healing on this planet. Not only will you be supporting us as healers and artists, you are saying YES to a community driven by feminine principles. We'd be so grateful if you joined us in making the following accessible: 1. Licensing/insurance/ permits: opening a business is a lot of work! Let the abundance flow, let the signs be put up inviting the world in, let our clients be safe inside this space! 2. Renovations of the space in a sustainable fashion; prioritizing all reused goods or ethically made goods.3. Production/Overhead for retail items: supporting local artisans, particularly from marginalized communities 4. Website/Marketing/Community Outreach: reaching the people who need us the most. Supporting other creators by paying them for their time/effort/design/skills in curating an internet presence.5. Rent supplement: we would love to offer low cost workshops and events to our community, which means accepting support for our expenses in keeping our doors open. Because we value sustainability, we will be sourcing most of our renovation materials from The Rebuilding Center, thrift stores, and free boxes around the city!  This also cuts costs by a lot, making each donated dollar go much further. If money isn't your preferred mode of donation, we'd humbly accept your time/energy/skills! Want to help hang mirrors? Paint? Source cool items for the shop? Have an idea for a workshop? Want to teach a class? Please be in touch with any and all ideas::we want to know you!WHAT YOU'LL GETWe're offering mini sessions of coaching and astrology to give you a taste of our work! We're offering clothing! We're offering love! WE LOVE YOU, WE MEAN ITThank you so much for reading, sharing, donating, blessing up our new venture <3 The big lady thanks you for you kindness, generosity and love.xoxoI & J

story:
Los venezolanos amamos nuestro país y nuestra cultura, muchos de nosotros estamos dispuestos a superar las dificultades y seguir adelante creyendo en que una mejor Venezuela es posible, una Venezuela que supera las dificultades y le demuestra al mundo que tenemos las herramientas para lograrlo.

C4 Trio representa eso, el crecimiento en medio de la dificultad y las ganas de hacer las cosas bien para construir una mejor Venezuela.

C4 Trío es una agrupación que ha posicionado la música venezolana en otro nivel, teniendo como protagonista uno de los mayores íconos de la cultura venezolana: el Cuatro. Ha motivado elogios de músicos muy importantes alrededor del mundo, llevando la sonoridad del cuatro a niveles insospechados, recogiendo su historia sonora y proyectándola a un futuro maravilloso, que evoluciona y que nos asegura la eternidad de nuestra cultura musical. Se han convertido en un ejemplo tangible y necesario para cualquier joven de hoy, para cada ciudadano venezolano que ame su tierra y su cultura. Un estímulo y una inspiración que construye las bases necesarias para la conformación de un mejor país. Pero es además, una propuesta plagada de innovación que ha venido a abrirle un espacio a la música tradicional venezolana en la palestra de la música universal.

Womex (World Music Expo) es un proyecto internacional que desde 1994 brinda apoyo y fomenta el desarrollo del World Music. El evento principal es una exposición que se realiza anualmente en diferentes locaciones de Europa. Comprende de una feria, conciertos, conferencias, proyecciones de cine, sesiones de trabajo y premiaciones. Los músicos y sellos disqueros tienen la oportunidad de hacer contactos para giras internacionales y distribución discográfica. Este año están inscritas mas de 1.200 compañías y festivales, mas de 200 artistas, delegados y productores musicales y mas de 600 expositores.

C4 Trío fue seleccionado, por concurso entre muchísimas agrupaciones de todas partes del mundo, para realizar un Showcase en WOMEX 16 delante de programadores musicales de los Festivales más importantes del planeta. Allí tendrán la maravillosa oportunidad de deleitar al público presente  con su ingeniosa visión de la música venezolana y el virtuosismo que los ha hecho merecedores de varios premios en Venezuela y el mundo, llevando como bandera la  música venezolana y al instrumento más icónico de nuestra cultura: “ EL CUATRO VENEZOLANO”.

Estar en Womex es un sueño para cualquier músico y por primera vez en la historia de esta feria  han seleccionado a una agrupación venezolana para que participe. Esto es historia y un logro sin precedentes para la música hecha en Venezuela. Es sin duda un acontecimiento que nos hará visible en el ámbito del World Music, que hará resonar las cuerdas del Cuatro en  los más importantes festivales de música y en los más sorprendentes recovecos del planeta. Para poder estar presente necesitamos 17.000$, este dinero se utilizara para comprar pasajes desde Venezuela hasta Santiago de Compostela, hospedaje para 7 personas, comidas, traslados internos  durante 6 días y los honorarios del equipo técnico, así que necesitamos recaudar este dinero y nos encantaría que tu formaras parte de este acontecimiento, puedes contribuir con la cantidad que este a tu alcance, estamos seguros de que tu colaboración nos hará recolectar lo que necesitamos para estar presente en este importante evento. y si no puedes colaborar con nosotros en metálico, ayudamos a difundir este mensaje compartiéndolo a través de las diferentes redes sociales. 

Y para concluir lo mas bonito de apoyar un proyecto como este, es ser parte de la internacionalización de nuestro CUATRO y  de llevarlo a espacios donde nunca antes había llegado y que juntos logremos convertir este instrumento en instrumento universal que es el mayor sueño de C4 TRÍO.

Desde ya te damos gracias

story:
We are here because we need your collaboration to bring this project to the world. We have devoted lots of hours to casting, planning , location scouting , and other pre production duties and we would appreciate your collaboration as far as continuing the production of our series.  


With your help, we will be able to achieve bringing to life this series with characters that represent positive aspects of our urban environment , reflections of current issues of our generation from a fresh point of view. 

We need funds to continue our production process. We still need to continue the cinematography editing and post production of this series, and even thou our cost are minimal because of the talents and the work of our team some costs cant be avoided. The funds being obtained will be used towards the completion of the episodes of the first season and we will finish the stories of each episode independently to assure that backers will get the content at the time promised. 

     

    A lot of the reasons why we love this project so much is that  most series are created from a marketing point of view, our series is inspired in real life events and situations that are a part of our normal lives in the city. We want to bring a different perspective of urban life not tainted by political agendas of cliche stereotypes.   

    Your contribution will help us fulfill our artistic duty to represent our urban habitat to our generations without the bias of  other projects.  We are confident in our hability to deliver on our promise of a refreshing fun and real series because we have plenty of experience working on projects like this on a micro budget and because we have spent plenty of time developing this concept from start to finish. 

    We appreciate your help, producing a series is a big endeavor but rest assured that everyone in our team is seriously committed to the task. Banking on our experience and our love for this project won't be a disappointment.  

     

    We need your collaboration because even with our ample experience of creating good quality content at ultra low budget a lot is needed to make a quality series come to life. Our guarantee that you can trust our word when we say: “you won't be disappointed for collaborating to our project” is displayed in our willingness to allow our high tier backers access to behind the scenes of our shoots.

    Going behind the scenes is a great way of meeting the cast , learning or collaborating with our team (if you are interested in production or just want to see where your funds are going ).

    • With our experience and funds plus your collaboration all the production hurdles will be taken care off so we can deliver to you this wonderful series so you may begin your love affair with our characters.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • There are other ways you can help! Show us Love by sharing this fundraiser with your friends and family or donate any ideas , locations,  skills or services you may have.  Specially your social media Love can make a difference!  

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Rainbow Travellers Tarot

A magickal tarot deck woven with insights and guided messages to support the traveller on the complex journey of life.

My Story

I've been creating digital art for 15 years. My passion is to take others on a journey through their imagination. The inspiration for the Rainbow Travellers Tarot began many years ago when I first began creating mythical and fantasy images. My spiritual journey of the past ten years has led me through a deep exploration of the tarot, and the archetypes that began to appear in my images.

The artwork and divinatory meanings of the cards are shaped by my years of study and will stray from traditional archetypes to provide the reader/querent with guidance.

The major arcana contains 22 cards, with a unique spin on the traditional symbols. "The Traveller" replaces "The Fool" and other changes lead to a unique and enlightening journey through the tarot. The cards can be also used with traditional spreads and interpretations. 

The minor arcana will provide guided messages to support the querent's journey of the mind (wands), body (pentacles), heart (cups) and soul (swords). This deck goes beyond the here and now and calls upon the mystics that whisper to us with wisdom that serves our higher purpose. 

This labour of love is so important to me that at 57 years young I have committed myself full-time to complete the editing, printing, and promotion of the 78-card Rainbow Travellers Tarot deck. I am also authoring an e-book and e-course on intuitive reading that can help even the novice reader gain insights and answers.

I look forward to sharing the journey with you!

Brightest blessings,

Carmen Waterman

What I Need and What You Get

I need $5,000 for printing costs. If I do not receive all of this money, I will print a smaller number of decks and make up any balance in the payment myself. If you contribute you will receive the perks as promised.   

Supporter $25 - You'll receive a 5" by 7" archival giclee print of your choice of one image from a web-based gallery of the Rainbow Travellers Tarot posted at the end of the campaign. The print will be mailed out by July 31, 2012.

Believer $45 - You'll receive a copy of the 78-card Rainbow Travellers Tarot deck and introductory booklet explaining the meanings of the cards. The deck and booklet will be mailed out by September 1, 2012.

Enthusiast $100 - You'll receive the perks for the Supporter and Believer levels, as well as a special thank-you card for your support and a handmade tarot bag for your new deck. You will also be credited as a supporter of the Rainbow Travellers Tarot deck on the RainbowTravellers.com Supporters page at the end of the campaign.

Merchant $150 - This is a special deal for merchants and others who would like to have additional copies of the deck to give as gifts. You'll receive 4 copies of the Rainbow Travellers Tarot deck and introductory booklets explaining the meanings of the cards. These will be mailed out by September 1, 2012.

Clairvoyant $250 - You'll receive the perks for the Believer and Enthusiast levels, and a Limited Edition "Travellers Pack" that includes a signed and numbered Certificate of Authenticity, a signed 8" by 10" archival giclee print of your choice of one image from a web-based gallery of the Rainbow Travellers Tarot at the end of the campaign, a stand to display a single card for daily meditation, a piece of ocean glass from the shores of Vancouver Island, Canada, and a copy of the e-book "Intuitive Readings" one week in advance of its release to the general public. The projected release date for the e-book is October 1, 2012.

Champion Querent $400 - You'll receive the perks for the Believer, Enthusiast and Clairvoyant levels, and a 40-minute Skype intuitive reading in the months of October or November 2012 at a time that is mutually agreeable.

Travellers Tarot Scholar $500 - You'll receive the perks for the Believer, Enthusiast and Clairvoyant levels, and a six-week "Intuitive Readings" e-course based on the Rainbow Travellers Tarot deck. The e-course will include instruction, practice exercises, assignments, journaling and a forum for interactive discussions with other participants during the course and for three months after course completion. The e-course will be available November 1, 2012.


Other Ways You Can Help

No Cost Advocate - If you're unable to financially support this venture but would like to see the Rainbow Travellers Tarot in print, please help to spread the word. Share this page to find others who can help make this dream a reality. You can also "Like" the Rainbow Travellers Tarot fan page on Facebook, share the link to this Indiegogo campaign on Twitter and other social networks. What you get is my heartfelt thanks and the knowledge that you can make a difference!

story:
**An Update**

Well, you are all seriously blowing us away. We reached our $5000 goal in under 32 hours. You know what that means? We'll do even more public art!

We are sitting on a half dozen mockup ideas for other walls around downtown that we'd love to prettify. Now that we've reached our goal, we'll make a new mural for every additionnal $2500 raised.

Soon we will release a brand spanking new mural concept that we hope to make real if we reach $7500. Stay tuned.

Hey, good looking!

Sudbury is known for its giant iconic monuments that connect us to home and to each other. Big coins and super stacks line our horizon. We hope to inspire connections, like they do, but on an a way smaller scale. We have no desire to build a bigger nickel.

We will be making three beautiful murals in and around downtown Sudbury this summer.

The three murals are temporary public art installations. Public art brings people together, it stirs our collective minds, it brightens our colorless winters and adds small doses of magic to our lives.

This project is an initative from the wacky folks at We Live Up Here, the collaboration project about life in the Nickel City. Last year, we made a photography book about Sudbury. This year, we want to do more than a book. We want to start conversations, spark community involvement and have a positive impact on this place we call home. That's where the murals come in.

Mural #1 : You Are Beautiful

Sudbury is beautiful. We want to remind people of that. This first mural on Durham street downtown will build community pride, inspire love for our ever-evolving core and add a little color to our award-winning winters.

You Are Beautiful is part of a global campaign instigated by one man, Matthew Hoffman from the US, and described as a simple, powerful statement aspiring to create moments of positive self realization.

We have been in cahoots with the kind folks from Barrydowne Paints and Paul Zulich from Zulich Enterprises who owns the wall of interest. Everyone is excited about this project. The plan is to complete this mural by the end of the summer.

Mural #2 : Let's Drive There

We have discovered some incredible archive photography from the Sudbury area from the early 1900’s. We thought up a way of showcasing some of them by wheatpasting largescale black and white prints on retaining walls. We're going to test this century old technique for our second mural on the Kingsway.

The first mural we hope to do will showcase some photography from an article in the Sudbury Star dating back to the early 50’s.

We believe that historical photography merged with smart taglines (inspired by the most popular of the thousands of pins we made last year) is a winning formula in creating beautiful public art that is well grounded in Sudbury’s rich history and that will have a positive impact in the community.

Mural #3 : Sudburians at the Market

A few months ago we launched Sudburians.com, a video portraits gallery of inspiring citizens. The Sudburians at the Market project piggy-backs on that concept, but instead of showcasing inspiring citizens, we'll be putting every Sudburian we can in the spotlight.

We will be at the Market on August 10th and 11th for one weekend only. We will take your photo and print it. We'll then proceed to pasting them around the Market on the retail units. We will cover the Market with the faces of those who attend it; ordinary citizens owning the public space in an extraordinary way.

What happens now that we've reached our goal?

The short answer is this: the more funds we raise, the more public art we will do.

We are sitting on a half dozen mockup ideas for other walls around downtown that we'd love to prettify. After we reach our $5000 goal, we'll release a brand spanking new mural concept that we hope to make real if we reach $7500. How does that sound?

If you know someone who owns a big blank canvas of a wall, in or around downtown Sudbury, that would love for us to beautify it, tell them to get in touch with us at hello@weliveuphere.com. Walls owned by the private sector are the easiest to get access to.

Let's continue making awesome together.

Here's How You Can Help Us Make It Happen

  1. Spread the good word.
  2. Volunteer your time.
  3. Donate to the project.

Making public art on this large of a scale isn't cheap but your donation will go a long way. Funds raised will go towards printing of photography, honorariums for professional artists involved, paying for supplies, paint, paper, equipement, scafolding, ladders, safety harnesses, insurance and permits.

All money raised will go towards these We Live Up Here public arts projects. If we do not reach our entire goal, we will try out darndest to make them happen anyway. If we exceed our goal, we'll do even more murals. We've got a few ideas for some other walls that we'd love to beautify.

We've set up some cool perks and rewards that we'll give you in exchange for your trust in the form of a donation. Get some pins, books, prizes or a twistin' dance party at your place!

You Are Awesome

Thank you Sudbury. You inspire us. You encourage us to stick around and to help transform this city into the place we want it to be. We can't thank you enough for the love and support you've given us. We'll keep making cool things like this happen if you keep giving us high fives.

Special round of high fives for Rob Roy who edited the video, Myths & Mirrors Community Arts for being there, Andrew Blair for his street art expertise, Paul Zulich for his wall and his enthusiasm, and finally Emily Trottier and her team of red tape cutters at the City of Greater Sudbury (sorry for all the grey hairs!)

Thanks for listenning!
story_txt:
**An Update**
Well, you are all seriously blowing us away. We reached our $5000 goal in under 32 hours. You know what that means? We'll do even more public art!
We are sitting on a half dozen mockup ideas for other walls around downtown that we'd love to prettify. Now that we've reached our goal, we'll make a new mural for every additionnal $2500 raised.
Soon we will release a brand spanking new mural concept that we hope to make real if we reach $7500. Stay tuned.
Hey, good looking!
Sudbury is known for its giant iconic monuments that connect us to home and to each other. Big coins and super stacks line our horizon. We hope to inspire connections, like they do, but on an a way smaller scale. We have no desire to build a bigger nickel.
We will be making three beautiful murals in and around downtown Sudbury this summer.
The three murals are temporary public art installations. Public art brings people together, it stirs our collective minds, it brightens our colorless winters and adds small doses of magic to our lives.This project is an initative from the wacky folks at We Live Up Here, the collaboration project about life in the Nickel City. Last year, we made a photography book about Sudbury. This year, we want to do more than a book. We want to start conversations, spark community involvement and have a positive impact on this place we call home. That's where the murals come in.
Mural #1 : You Are Beautiful
Sudbury is beautiful. We want to remind people of that. This first mural on Durham street downtown will build community pride, inspire love for our ever-evolving core and add a little color to our award-winning winters.

You Are Beautiful is part of a global campaign instigated by one man, Matthew Hoffman from the US, and described as a simple, powerful statement aspiring to create moments of positive self realization.
We have been in cahoots with the kind folks from Barrydowne Paints and Paul Zulich from Zulich Enterprises who owns the wall of interest. Everyone is excited about this project. The plan is to complete this mural by the end of the summer.
Mural #2 : Let's Drive There
We have discovered some incredible archive photography from the Sudbury area from the early 1900’s. We thought up a way of showcasing some of them by wheatpasting largescale black and white prints on retaining walls. We're going to test this century old technique for our second mural on the Kingsway.
The first mural we hope to do will showcase some photography from an article in the Sudbury Star dating back to the early 50’s.

We believe that historical photography merged with smart taglines (inspired by the most popular of the thousands of pins we made last year) is a winning formula in creating beautiful public art that is well grounded in Sudbury’s rich history and that will have a positive impact in the community.
Mural #3 : Sudburians at the Market
A few months ago we launched Sudburians.com, a video portraits gallery of inspiring citizens. The Sudburians at the Market project piggy-backs on that concept, but instead of showcasing inspiring citizens, we'll be putting every Sudburian we can in the spotlight.

We will be at the Market on August 10th and 11th for one weekend only. We will take your photo and print it. We'll then proceed to pasting them around the Market on the retail units. We will cover the Market with the faces of those who attend it; ordinary citizens owning the public space in an extraordinary way.
What happens now that we've reached our goal?
The short answer is this: the more funds we raise, the more public art we will do.
We are sitting on a half dozen mockup ideas for other walls around downtown that we'd love to prettify. After we reach our $5000 goal, we'll release a brand spanking new mural concept that we hope to make real if we reach $7500. How does that sound?If you know someone who owns a big blank canvas of a wall, in or around downtown Sudbury, that would love for us to beautify it, tell them to get in touch with us at hello@weliveuphere.com. Walls owned by the private sector are the easiest to get access to.Let's continue making awesome together.

Here's How You Can Help Us Make It Happen

Spread the good word.
Volunteer your time.
Donate to the project.

Making public art on this large of a scale isn't cheap but your donation will go a long way. Funds raised will go towards printing of photography, honorariums for professional artists involved, paying for supplies, paint, paper, equipement, scafolding, ladders, safety harnesses, insurance and permits.
All money raised will go towards these We Live Up Here public arts projects. If we do not reach our entire goal, we will try out darndest to make them happen anyway. If we exceed our goal, we'll do even more murals. We've got a few ideas for some other walls that we'd love to beautify.
We've set up some cool perks and rewards that we'll give you in exchange for your trust in the form of a donation. Get some pins, books, prizes or a twistin' dance party at your place!


You Are Awesome
Thank you Sudbury. You inspire us. You encourage us to stick around and to help transform this city into the place we want it to be. We can't thank you enough for the love and support you've given us. We'll keep making cool things like this happen if you keep giving us high fives.
Special round of high fives for Rob Roy who edited the video, Myths & Mirrors Community Arts for being there, Andrew Blair for his street art expertise, Paul Zulich for his wall and his enthusiasm, and finally Emily Trottier and her team of red tape cutters at the City of Greater Sudbury (sorry for all the grey hairs!)
Thanks for listenning!

story:
I believe Dallas is prime for a free all night art exhibition..........where the entire city can explore the power behind AURORA

 

With 27 days and counting we're launching an EXCLUSIVE online donation only T-Shirt.  Support Aurora by being some of the select few that have these stylish threads all year round.

 

Aurora installations from 2011......

The pinnacle of the Dallas Arts District programming is the stunning district-wide art installation – AURORA 2013. AURORA 2013 is a night of free public art that will literally transform the Dallas Arts District. The grand AURORA, which encompasses 10 city blocks of downtown and includes nearly 100 individual installations, spotlights the stunning work of local, national and international artists.

More than 100 extraordinary artists have donated their time and creative inspiration to be a part of this once in a lifetime experience. These artists have personally committed to AURORA to create exceptional art in unexpected places for the public-at-large; offering a rare glimpse of something truly unique, completely free and available for everyone to enjoy. Although many of the costs associated with AURORA 2013 have been donated by the artists and sponsors, some of the equipment and creative components such as projectors, audio support systems and art materials are still needed. As a sponsor, you would play an integral role in bringing AURORA 2013 to life. Your financial or in-kind donation of lights, projectors and other equipment will be used for the event; and 100% of your monetary gift will be used directly to underwrite the production.

story:
Dance For The Dawn: Our Story

Hello friends! We are Lithuanian burners. Dance For The Dawn idea was born in Black Rock City, while dreaming to built clear object that has esthetic look while being dynamic. Inspiration for the name came after witnessing dozens of sunrises in this amazing city existing only few months per year. It seems that each sunrise brought closer to the vision of building something that reflects view of the world and harmony in movement.

The first sketches were made straight after coming back from Burning Man 2016. We went forward with the idea and after being awarded the Burning Man Honoraria Art Grant we joined forces with VGTU LinkMenu fabrikas team of engineers and designers to bring Dance For The Dawn to life.

The installation is 23 feet wide and 13 feet tall. The iris of an Eye is formed out of 300 hands that are spinning on a metal circle creating hypnotizing feeling of pulling you into The Sunrise. Every hand will have a mirror in the palm and these will be creating hundreds of sun bunnies dancing around in the desert. At night time the installation will be decorated by hundreds of LEDs to create magical experience.

The whole concept symbolizes our unity and living in synchronous harmony. Watching the sunrise together brings us closer to the root values and reveals Burning Man 2017 art theme – Radical Ritual.

We Need Your Love & Support!

The project was awarded with Burning Man Honoraria Art Grant. The funding we got from Burning Man has covered the building of the main metal part of the eye.

We are still looking forward for Your support for the following spends: 

Wooden aches, platform - $1000

300 plastic mannequin hands (+ shipping) - $1300

Generator - $500

Electric parts, LED lights - $400

Logistics, trailer rent, fuel, etc. - $1000 (or maybe you have space in your truck going to playa?)

Connection parts, screws, paint - $300

Accommodation for our team in Reno - have a spare bed?:)

Your donation is highly appreciated! We offer all kind of special gifts for our fans - from crazy postcards straight from The Playa, to unique T-Shirts & hoodies.. We also organize an exciting Dusty Flashback event when we are back from Burning Man - don't miss it!

What has been done so far

The iris of The Eye has been already completed and is now on its way to US. In Reno, Nevada we will build wooden arches and all the necessary parts. We will attach 300 small mirrors into every hand together with hundreds of LED lights to have lights playing around the installation both day and night time. We will assemble the whole structure on playa and wait for You to join the Dance For The Dawn!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with anyone who you think might care! The more people will know about it the closer to the success this project will come! Spread the word around the globe! Burning Man needs Dance For The Dawn to happen and your contribution to this is very important!

Thank You so much for your LOVE!

story:
THE FLOWER TOWER

By day, the Tower will be a striking structure of colorful beauty, calling people to enter and leave behind their difficulties to become lighter, happier, and more relaxed. By night, the Tower will be a place of great intensity because it will use fire to burn off all the grief, stress, and confusion left behind during the day. We draw on the essential life-giving cycle of photosynthesis as our metaphor. Photosynthesis is the world’s breath, taking in and giving out. Likewise, the Flower Tower absorbs negative energy, transforms it through fire, and gives off positive energy. People enter the Flower Tower, leave behind the noise of the outside world, and are instantly awestruck by thousands of flowers. This is the transformational magic of the Flower Tower. 

 

Thousands of painted metal flowers will cover the Tower. Each flower will be unique and made by hand. The ornate, flower-covered Tower will be grounded by four buttresses and topped by a narrow spire. Fire is also crucial to the Tower’s visual and spiritual experiences. There will be 28 fire effects emitting from flowers, and outside the Tower, four fire pits, located in sacramental positions, will warm participants at night.

 

We are honored and extremely excited to watch an incredible volunteer movement already getting underway. We started making metal flowers in April with a just handful of artists. But word quickly spread about what we are doing, and many people have started to join us as we make thousands of flowers for the Tower. By the time the Tower is completed, our team will have included people from near and far who want to contribute a hand-crafted flower to the Tower. 

The Flower Tower is the natural next step in our ongoing contributions to the community of Black Rock City.  For Kevin Clark, the lead artist at Reaed In Steel, this is the culmination of his vision to build a temple-like structure for  Burning Man.

Everyone at Reared In Steel is driven by a deep desire to construct spaces that create memorable experiences for people.  The Flower Tower realizes our vision because it is a constructed, sculptural space that transforms people who experience it.

Burning Man Arts awards grants to a select number of artists and we are one of the chosen ones, however, we still need to raise more funds to complete this project.  Your contribution to our project will help us with our transportation costs, materials for lighting, paint, flame effects and propane.  We estimate it will take three (3) 40’ trailers to transport the Flower Tower to Burning Man.  The Flower Tower will have 28 flame effects……that’s ALOT of propane!  

Please consider contributing to our project and receive one of our great perks.  You can also follow the progress of the Flower Tower on Facebook and Instagram at Reared In Steel.

Thank you!

story:
View Videos in the GALLERY Tab, for a detailed presentation of the Project, available in English and Spanish


Short Summary

Internationally acclaimed Haïtian Visual Artist, Makeda, and Haitian Reggae Star, Rebel Layonn Have been selected by Intercultural Odyssey Costa-Rica, For a one of a kind Art Residency focused on:

  •  creating nature related Fine art pieces and music
  •  sharing Art, Art Therapy, music yoga and meditation workshop with youth of the community.  

The residency will take place for a month between September and October.

 Intercultural Odyssey Costa-Rica, is a civic social and non-governmental   organization, that provides a unique intercultural artists’ residency program in the belief that creating great art across borders opens up human hearths and challenges barriers that separate them.

What We Need & What You Get

After revision of our application, the jury of the Intercultural Odysseys Costa-Rica, approved of our project: 

"The selection committee and board of directors were especially impressed with your project's emphasis on exploring Costa Rica's part in the theme of "nature conservation which should be a global priority" as well as your action plan of "carrying out art therapy and creativity sessions, to share this beauty with the children, alongside music workshops"

We are raising funds to Pay for:

  •  our Plane tickets (ranging from 1000 USD each)
  •  Basic art materials to conduct art therapy, painting and music workshops with a group of youth of the Community of San Ramòn.  (Now when we say basic we mean that we will prioritize to use of raw materials present in nature since this is a significant wealth in Costa-Rica)

We are grateful for FOKAL (Fondation Konesans & Liberté), that has sponsored us by covering the Residency Fee of 1650 USD covering the following:

Each artist in residence is provided with the following: 

    • Selection Committee review and evaluation of portfolio.
    • Odysseys standard food and lodging accommodations: Home Stay with a carefully selected host family.
    • Individual work space  according to artist's discipline.
    • Common living space (living room/dining room/outdoor areas).
    • Weekly laundry services, housecleaning and change of bed & bath linens. 
    • Internet in the home when possible. May be available from a shared work station or by WiFi. 
    • Abundant and inexpensive local Internet cafes within walking distance of the home stay. 
    • Cultural immersion into a truly community-based Artists' Colony. 
    • Opportunities to practice Spanish or learn some (a working knowledge is helpful but not required, classes and tutoring available)
    • Preference to residencies of one month or longer. 
    • Same-day as arrival or next-morning orientation to the program and Costa Rica, with a tour of San Ramón.
    • An after-dinner Tuesday Evening Soirree and one local outing hosted by ODYSSEYS each week for all artists in residence to share time with each other, local artists when possible, and with the Program Director. 
    • Encouragement (never required) to share work: open studios, presentations and readings, etc...  
    • When possible these opportunities will also be provided publicly at least once during an artist's residency, often at the end, at appropriate local venues such as SiNEM (Institute for the National System of Music Education) the Figueres Museum and Cultural Center and our favorite venue for events that combine readings, music in concert and visual art,Costa Rica Regional Museum of San Ramon 
    • Optional outings to explore galleries, museums, theatres and other aspects of local culture, as well as adventure trips to beaches, volcanoes, and other natural wonders of Costa Rica will be scheduled with the input of all artists in residence.

The Impact

Art Residencies in general are designed to expand an artist field of exploration, thus expanding it's personal growth and quality and significance of his/her production. 

  •  Costa- Rica, Being without army since 1948, and directing these funds towards nature conservation and education, is the ideal place for a visual artist like Makeda, who paints mainly close ups of nature subject, and Rebel Layonn, a environmentally friendly oriented singer and songwriter, to experience significant growth within their practice and share this growth with the youth of Costa-Rica, and ultimately with those of the world. 
  • The Art Therapy, Painting and music workshops, along with yoga and meditation sessions, are opportunities for the youth to asses their strengths and weakness, defining their true self, with more ease and clarity.

Join us by supporting and be a part of this Amazing Adventure.

Risks & Challenges

  • Though the Language might be a tiny obstacle, due to the fact that we speak little spanish, we are confident in the universal languages of art and music, and have already started practicing our conversational spanish ;)
  • We also Risk to be inspired for a long time, which implies that the work which will be presented will be just the start a long inspiring journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Feel free to share any of our photos and post and to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your Interest and support,

Much Love! :)

story:
As an awkward child, with high watered jeans and large coke bottle glasses to complete the look,  I didn't fit in with any crowd, therefore feeling and becoming socially awkward. My brother and sister were my closest friends growing up and I don't think they fully understood me.  I spent a good deal of my time with a pencil or some kind of doodling tool in my hands. My artistic skill was the one thing I knew I could shine at and be accepted for. During my entire grade school career, I excelled as a top student artistically until graduation, taking college credits along with me. Entering adulthood took a toll on my interest in art.  I began to focus on discovering who I was as a person, resulting in action that led to me having to leave home at the age of 18. Survival was now priority and art took a further seat back in my list of things to do.

As a new adult living on my own, I was quite ambitious and a bit compulsive. When I had an idea, I went for it. One of those ideas happened to involve adult entertainment. This is not to say I wanted to become a "porn star". I had many interests, including being a runway model (people put the idea in my head because of my height and slender build). But with no help or direction, porn seemed to be rather easy and since I did have an ironic interest in performing on film, I applied. In short, at the age of 19, I began my extensive career as an adult film star. Once I'd done my first scene and graced my first cover not long after, I knew it was something I'd have to run with. So I did and ensured that I was the best at it. While my popularity was immensely growing, years went by and I found myself feeling empty.  There were things I still needed to fulfill. I knew one thing was my art. I stopped doing adult films to focus on the next chapter of my life.  I needed to share my talent with the world. But I had doubts. Would people come out to see and support a former porn star? 

As a man on a mission, I don't let anything stand in my way. So momentarily setting fear and doubt aside, I am excited and anticipating my first ever art exhibition. I have done so much, been so many places, I've seen a lot and learned a lot. I have a unique story to tell. Through my work, I hope to raise questions and curiosity from you.  I hope you see beauty, pain, joy, fear - the visual emotion each piece evokes and I hope that you will be able to relate. 

This will be my first time taking on a project of this magnitude. I am so passionate about it and will put nothing less than my all into it. I want this to be an experience more than an exhibition. I can only accomplish this with your help. Your funds go deeper than a dollar amount; they show me that you support my endeavor which gives me the strength and motivation to keep going. To many, I am extremely confident. That is something I have inherent in me and I am grateful for. But, at my core is a scared little boy who wants to be liked and accepted. I'm excited and thankful to all of you in advance. This is OUR project. I hope to see you in the fall at the unveiling of this project-I.AM.ART.
story_txt: As an awkward child, with high watered jeans and large coke bottle glasses to complete the look,  I didn't fit in with any crowd, therefore feeling and becoming socially awkward. My brother and sister were my closest friends growing up and I don't think they fully understood me.  I spent a good deal of my time with a pencil or some kind of doodling tool in my hands. My artistic skill was the one thing I knew I could shine at and be accepted for. During my entire grade school career, I excelled as a top student artistically until graduation, taking college credits along with me. Entering adulthood took a toll on my interest in art.  I began to focus on discovering who I was as a person, resulting in action that led to me having to leave home at the age of 18. Survival was now priority and art took a further seat back in my list of things to do.As a new adult living on my own, I was quite ambitious and a bit compulsive. When I had an idea, I went for it. One of those ideas happened to involve adult entertainment. This is not to say I wanted to become a "porn star". I had many interests, including being a runway model (people put the idea in my head because of my height and slender build). But with no help or direction, porn seemed to be rather easy and since I did have an ironic interest in performing on film, I applied. In short, at the age of 19, I began my extensive career as an adult film star. Once I'd done my first scene and graced my first cover not long after, I knew it was something I'd have to run with. So I did and ensured that I was the best at it. While my popularity was immensely growing, years went by and I found myself feeling empty.  There were things I still needed to fulfill. I knew one thing was my art. I stopped doing adult films to focus on the next chapter of my life.  I needed to share my talent with the world. But I had doubts. Would people come out to see and support a former porn star? As a man on a mission, I don't let anything stand in my way. So momentarily setting fear and doubt aside, I am excited and anticipating my first ever art exhibition. I have done so much, been so many places, I've seen a lot and learned a lot. I have a unique story to tell. Through my work, I hope to raise questions and curiosity from you.  I hope you see beauty, pain, joy, fear - the visual emotion each piece evokes and I hope that you will be able to relate. This will be my first time taking on a project of this magnitude. I am so passionate about it and will put nothing less than my all into it. I want this to be an experience more than an exhibition. I can only accomplish this with your help. Your funds go deeper than a dollar amount; they show me that you support my endeavor which gives me the strength and motivation to keep going. To many, I am extremely confident. That is something I have inherent in me and I am grateful for. But, at my core is a scared little boy who wants to be liked and accepted. I'm excited and thankful to all of you in advance. This is OUR project. I hope to see you in the fall at the unveiling of this project-I.AM.ART.

story:
My passion fro glass started when I was 14 and wanted to take glassblowing and lampworking classes at the Toledo Art Museum. My family couldn't afford them and I let it go. 12 years later I was given the opportunity to work at a factory that produces glass tobacco pipes as a prep worker. I spent all day on a torch melting and forming glass to be made into glass pipes. It was hot and hard and a dream come true. I fell in love with working with glass. Two years after leaving that job I think about working on a torch and producing glass items everyday but not pipes. I see myself making glass beads. I know that with the equipment and materials I can succeed in this business.

To help my business along, I am currently attempting to get into lampworking classes at the museum to further my knowledge and improve my skills. I also studied Business Administration for 3 years and have a lot of the knowledge needed to make my company successful from a business standpoint.

I have customers already waiting, all I need is the help to get my equipment and materials.

story:
Temple of Reflection

We are a group of Nobodies who believe that it is important to have a temple at Nowhere. A place to mourn, and to celebrate. To connect, and to dream. To meditate, and to express. Some of our own most intense spiritual moments have come from being in temples at previous Nowheres and other burns around the world. We hope to be able to gift such moments to you by building the Temple of Reflection for this year’s Nowhere.


The building materials and logistics required to create the Temple of Reflection come at a cost. We hope our design and philosophy resonate with you. And we kindly invite you to contribute and help gift this temple in its ideal form, to facilitate beautiful moments at Nowhere.



Concept/Philosophy

Imagine being in front of a fogged mirror in your home, at those moments that you are at rest and in peace. You start to write. There is no necessity, you just write. You feel free to let the words flow because they can easily be removed with only a single wipe. You really start out loosely drawing and writing, but in the process your deeper consciousness takes you to places where you need to be. In between, you wipe the mirror clean, to create more space for your story, every time you clean the slate you look yourself in the eye and reach deeper.


Now think of a sundial, in which the ever changing angle of the sun rays create a continuously changing projection on the desert soil, a reminder of the here and now, of the coming and going of light and dark, of eternity and impermanence.


At the Temple of Reflection you are inside thise sundial and surrounded by mirrors, on which you can express your deepest thoughts and wipe them away to clear the mirror and look deeper into your own soul.


Eight reflective crystals will be ritually placed in the temple’s spires at the start of Nowhere, to help create a pure and sacred space for us. At the end of Nowhere, we will ritually remove the crystals, releasing the building of its sacred function.



Design

The Temple of Reflection has an overall design that aims to enable both the communal and the private experience; to facilitate the transformative aspect of being at Nowhere.


It was influenced by diverse inspirations of sacred, spiritual, memorial, and experiential spaces and buildings from different parts of the world. Amongst them are Oscar Niemeyer's cathedral in Brasilia, Zen Buddhist temples and specifically their influence on the architecture of Kenzo Tange, the Poème Electronique building by Le Corbusier, and the Martyrs Memorial in Algiers by Bachir Telles.


The basic shape that repeats itself in the structure of the Temple is an octagon. The octagon has a common or similar symbolism in cultures and philosophies ranging from Buddhism to Islam to Paganism: regeneration, totality, rebirth, transition, and the interplay between heaven and earth, the eternal and the temporary.


Its exterior shape and design consists of connected legs that curve inwards, upwards, and then outwards into 'spires', in a movement that could be seen symbolic for processes of individual and collective growth and transformation. A last minute addition to the design [not shown in the pictures yet], are eight reflective crystals, that will be placed in the spires and will "activate" the energy of the temple. Suspended from the legs are pieces of white shadow fabric, tension-suspend outwards and downwards; white because it's associated with the sacred, purity and virtue, but also mourning. They create four openings to enter the temple, for the four directions of the wind.



In the interior of the temple there are vertical columns, accentuating the upward movement of the structure, and a central round "altar". On both the vertical columns and the central altar there is reflective material, on which participants can express their thoughts and feelings with dry erasable markers.


The altar itself is the spiritual center piece of the temple. The altar’s surface is a mirror reflecting the skies directly above, with the path in between the heavens and the earth paved by the ‘spires’ of the exterior shape. As above, so below. 


When looked at from above, the temple is designed to resemble an abstract clock or sundial, with the central altar welcoming the sun at noon. During the day, the interplay between reflections, shapes, shadows and lines will facilitate the beautiful moments we envision. And at night, the temple will be lit to accentuate its function as a 24/7 sanctuary.


During the days of the event, the temple is open for communal activities, such as weddings, vow renewals, and memorials. Apart from that, there is the possibility of hosting workshops there that align with the emotional, spiritual, and energetic objectives of the temple. The temple will be ritualistically opened and closed at the beginning and end of Nowhere.



Temple Guardians

Human extensions of the structure, and facilitators of the processes that happen inside it. Temple Guardians hold the space of the temple, maintain an environment that allows equal access for everyone to have the experience and expression they need, and keep the temple itself, as well as the participants who visit it, safe. We welcome anyone that feels their calling, to help out and become a guardian during the event.


What we need

For construction of the temple, the following items are part of our budget:
  • Structural wood                       € 1000,-
  • Plywood covering                    € 550,-
  • Reflective covering                 € 750,-
  • Fabric for panels                      € 500,-
  • Ground covering                      € 350,-
  • Accessories                               € 250,-
  • Hardware/fasteners              € 300,-
  • Lighting                                       € 300,-
  • Transportation/Logistics     € 500,-
  • Fundraising costs/fees         € 150,-
  • Perks                                           € 250,-
Total budget: 4900,-

The Nowhere Art Team has already granted the Temple of Reflection generous support of € 2500,- We ask your generous help as well, in raising our total budget and getting the temple out to Nowhere in its ideal form. 

If we don't raise our budget, the temple will be scaled down in size and refinement. In the case we raise more than our crowdfunding effort, the surplus money will go to further enhance the temple, up to a point where we will gift the additional funds to the Nowhere organization, to help fund other artworks or future temples.

In any case, there will be a Temple of Reflection at Nowhere this year!



What you get

We are grateful and blessed with each and every donation, big or small. Your biggest perk will be the knowledge that you have helped to realize profound and meaningful experiences at this year's temple. 

Depending on your contribution, we have devised the following perks:

  • for a € 5 donation, you are added to a "list" of contributors, that will be ceremonially blessed during the opening ceremony of the temple. 

  • for a € 10 donation, you are added to the list, and you will receive a special Temple of Reflection pendant.

  • for a € 25 donation, you are added to the list, receive a pendant, and get a special Temple of Reflection  t-shirt.

  • for a € 100 donation, you are added to the list, receive a pendant, get a t-shirt, and become the owner of a special Temple of Reflection sundial.

  • for a € 250 donation, you are added to the list, receive a pendant, get a t-shirt, own a sundial, and will receive one of the reflective crystals that are part of the spires, at the closing ceremony of the temple. 



Legacy

This year's process is the first year in which the temple has been adopted by the Nowhere Organization, in support and in recognition of its communal importance, and to secure its future incarnations at the event.


From the start of this year's process, we have been and are still continuously trying to create a workflow, a framework for co-creative collaboration that is repeatable for years to come, in which everyone and anyone that wants to participate in creating the temple, can do so.



Apart from this lasting legacy to the event, there are two ways in which this year’s temple could reincarnate. The first one, is recycling all of its materials for future Nowhere temples and/or other art works. This option has already been secured in collaboration with the Nowhere Art Team, in the creation of a storage container, amongst others for this purpose. 


The second one is by gifting a transformed version of the temple to one of the local Monegros communities. We are currently examining the possibilities to do so, and would love to hear the Nowhere’s participants’ feelings about our intent, and if you find it wise and acceptable to use parts of a structure that is financed by the Nowhere Organization and/or crowdfunded to gift to Monegros, or if you would rather see all of the materials reused at the event. For your feedback on this topic, we will create a poll and post on our FB page.


Others ways you can help

Apart from helping us with a donation, we kindly invite anyone that wants to help out, by reaching out to us. We most likely will need help in construction and teardown, welcome each soul that wants to gift their presence as a guardian during the event, and anyone else that feels they have something to contribute.

Apart from this physical help, we hope we can rely on your support as well, to help and spread the word via your own network and connections with other participants.

We hope to welcome you all in the Temple of Reflection in some months. We already thank you for your generous support and help. And, the divine in us salutes the divine in you, namaste.

story:
Dr. Placebo's Snake Oil Emporium is expanding the reach of it's wondrous potions, cures, tonics and elixirs in their finest forms of caffeine from The Orient, DisOrient, and ReOrient.

We need YOUR help to build a magical vessel, which will transport our wondrous cure-alls to Burning Man, across the desert, into the unforgivingly dusty playa, just so we can bring them to you. 

The Fantastical Farmacological Fountain Wagon will be fashioned from reclaimed wood, with hand carved elements and detailed paintings that will truly AMAZE you.  

UPDATE: We reached our initial goal in just 24 hours! Thank you! Any extra funds beyond our initial goal will go into pimping out our cart with lighting, concocting more tantalizing elixirs, and transporting our cart to and from the Playa from San Diego.


Build and Design

Our team is working vigorously in San Diego, California to get Dr. Placebo's Fantastical Farmacological Fountain Wagon underway. We have spent hours upon hours sketching, designing, and sourcing materials to make this project work.

Our designs are modeled after Medicine Show Wagons from the 19th Century United States. We will be affixing them with modern gears to allow for easier transport through the deep playa.


It's All In The Details

Each sacred bottle containing Dr. Placebo's magic cure-alls will be affixed with detailed and colorful labels that will transport you to a time of traveling carnivals, Freak Shows, and Snake Oil Salesmen, if you can bare it.



Some of Our Perks!

Digital Sketch of Dr. Placebo's Snake Oil Emporium Pendant


Original Playa Pendant in Never Before Seen Copper!

Original Playa Pendant in an Antique Silver Finish!

Handmade Stromatolite Pendant


We Cannot Wait to CURE you!


Thank YOU!

story:
Our Story
Hi, I'm not Sarah McLachlan. But what I am is a woman with long brown hair and a sultry singing voice, sitting here, writing these words you're reading, asking--no, PLEADING--for your help. 

Light some scented candles and check out this backstory:

In the autumn of 2008, Jaclyn Backhaus and Andrew Neisler joined together to create Fresh Ground Pepper- a safe space wherein emerging artists could share their unfinished work with a supportive audience, willing to offer feedback. By utilizing an open submission process, they created an environment where true collaboration could occur spontaneously, experimentation would be met with enthusiasm and work could be created that otherwise wouldn’t have been attempted.

Fresh Ground Pepper is now in its fourth year of featuring work by theatricals, musicians, choreographers, filmmakers, puppeteers, visual artists, comedians, media designers, buskers, chefs and creators of sport. Every month, FGP seeks to provide a completely unique experience. (Visit fgpnyc.com for more info on all of our events)

And, most importantly: FGP does not charge artists to participate or audience to attend their events. Everything is FREE.


What We Need

Now, Fresh Ground Pepper is thriving in many ways. But they still need your support!
 

Artists who work with Fresh Ground Pepper cannot always afford the materials or the rehearsal space necessary to continue creating. Kinko's is expensive, and so are rehearsal rooms that have air-conditioning and floors without splinters. And so I, Not-Sarah McLachlan, and a group of my devoted non-fans developed the FGPCA, to fight the world's fight in stopping cruelty to artists.

Look into their eyes. See their hurt. See their suffering. Help us help them to buy cans of paint and lace trim, and help them thrive.

Your donations will help us to:

-Provide rehearsal space for our participating artists

-Print scripts

-Supply materials for installation and fine artists

-Find better and bigger spaces for their events

And most of all,

-Keep FGP not only free to participate in but also free to attend!

 

What You Get 

To sweeten the FGPCA's deal, I've helped them come up with a few perks we will bring you in exchange for your generous donation. You may get a picture of the artist you adopted. You may receive a beautiful tote bag. You will not receive a CD of my greatest hits. You will most likely receive a barrel of sweet deals at our 4th Annual Toobie Awards! Check out the list on the right-hand side of your screen.

You're not going to want to miss your chance to help FGP's starving artists. And you will be thanked greatly for your gift to us. It is almost as sweet as the gift of song, which is something I am not gifted in.

The Toobie Awards

May 12, 2012 @ 3LD Art & Technology Center

The Toobie Awards are an innovative award show that celebrate all things viral- also with FREE admission. It is a chance to re-imagine the accomplishments of the YouTube world through the eyes of FGP and its community's work. Essentially, it's the Lilith Fair for the next generation. 

For more information on this fabulous event, look up FGP Toobies on Facebook and vote on your favorite videos here: http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/QF59RX8!

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word about our campaign. Use Twitter, Facebook, word of mouth, open mics. Tag street signs with a Sharpie (not with a Shar Pei). Link us to your blogs, your profiles. Pin us on Pinterest. Write profiles on us in the New Yorker. Write a song about us and upload it to YouTube. Build us some mystery.

I am not Sarah McLachlan, but I am a supporter of FGP and the FGPCA. Join me.

By utilizing an open submission process, they created an environment where true collaboration could occur spontaneously, experimentation would be met with enthusiasm and work could be created that otherwise wouldn’t have been attempted.
Fresh Ground Pepper is now in its fourth year of featuring work by theatricals, musicians, choreographers, filmmakers, puppeteers, visual artists, comedians, media designers, buskers, chefs and creators of sport. Every month, FGP seeks to provide a completely unique experience. (Visit fgpnyc.com for more info on all of our events)
And, most importantly: FGP does not charge artists to participate or audience to attend their events. Everything is FREE.

What We Need
Now, Fresh Ground Pepper is thriving in many ways. But they still need your support! 
Artists who work with Fresh Ground Pepper cannot always afford the materials or the rehearsal space necessary to continue creating. Kinko's is expensive, and so are rehearsal rooms that have air-conditioning and floors without splinters. And so I, Not-Sarah McLachlan, and a group of my devoted non-fans developed the FGPCA, to fight the world's fight in stopping cruelty to artists.
Look into their eyes. See their hurt. See their suffering. Help us help them to buy cans of paint and lace trim, and help them thrive.
Your donations will help us to:
-Provide rehearsal space for our participating artists
-Print scripts
-Supply materials for installation and fine artists
-Find better and bigger spaces for their events
And most of all, 
-Keep FGP not only free to participate in but also free to attend! 
 
What You Get 
To sweeten the FGPCA's deal, I've helped them come up with a few perks we will bring you in exchange for your generous donation. You may get a picture of the artist you adopted. You may receive a beautiful tote bag. You will not receive a CD of my greatest hits. You will most likely receive a barrel of sweet deals at our 4th Annual Toobie Awards! Check out the list on the right-hand side of your screen.
You're not going to want to miss your chance to help FGP's starving artists. And you will be thanked greatly for your gift to us. It is almost as sweet as the gift of song, which is something I am not gifted in.
The Toobie Awards
May 12, 2012 @ 3LD Art & Technology Center
The Toobie Awards are an innovative award show that celebrate all things viral- also with FREE admission. It is a chance to re-imagine the accomplishments of the YouTube world through the eyes of FGP and its community's work. Essentially, it's the Lilith Fair for the next generation. 
For more information on this fabulous event, look up FGP Toobies on Facebook and vote on your favorite videos here: http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/QF59RX8!
Other Ways You Can HelpSpread the word about our campaign. Use Twitter, Facebook, word of mouth, open mics. Tag street signs with a Sharpie (not with a Shar Pei). Link us to your blogs, your profiles. Pin us on Pinterest. Write profiles on us in the New Yorker. Write a song about us and upload it to YouTube. Build us some mystery.
I am not Sarah McLachlan, but I am a supporter of FGP and the FGPCA. Join me.

story:
Short Summary

We have been collaborating with industry professionals over the last few months such as:

  • Sebastian Professional
  • Mambo
  • Matthew Miller
  • Ally Capellino
  • 1906
  • Griffin

This exhibition is our chance to show the work that we have created with them, and we welcome you all to come and join us for our exhibition opening night.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise around $500 which will help us towards the costs of printing and mounting our images along with additional costs towards running this exhibition.

In return for your money, we are holding a free exhibition, for you all to come and see the incredible work that we have all produced. A selection of complimentary refreshments will also be available on opening night for you upon entry.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funds, please feel free to come along and show your support in person. Our exhibition opening night is Wednesday 23rd May, 6:00PM at the Riverfront in Newport:


The Riverfront,

Bristol Packet Wharf,

Newport, Casnewydd

NP20 1HG

story:
This includes the cost of paying models, photographers and getting the calendars printed.  Why so much more than last year you might ask? This year’s calendar will have just over double the number of Goddesses. That's 21 different Goddesses that all need to be paid for their time.  In order to make these amazing images possible we’ve enlisted the help of our very own Kassandra Leigh and we need to make sure she gets paid for all the hard work she’ll be giving us.

In addition to the Calendar, we will also be saving some extra images from each Goddesses calendar shoot.  From these images we will be selecting one of each Goddess that will be an exclusive portrait print available only through this fundraiser.  You won’t be able to buy it later.

Goddess Available: 

Alice Malice, Bambi Buttons, Bear, Brittnie Jade, Jessica Nova, Kalika, Katrea Lux, Kearstin, Kita Minx, Kitty, Maygin, Ruby Renoir, Solara

Choices Available: 

  Goddess 1   Goddess 2   Set
  Kassandra   Solara   Luna and Diana
  Alice Malice   Jessica Nova   Marceline and Fiona
  Alice Malice   Fauna   Marceline and Princess Bubblegum
  Alice Malice   Jessica Nova   Black Queen and White Queen
  Jessica Nova   Kearstin   Fluttershy and Rainbow Dash
  Bear    Jessica Nova   Roxy and Poison
  Alice Malice   Jessica Nova   Death and Delirium
  Ch3xy   Nana Valtiel   Celestia Lundenburg and Danga Ronpa  
  Bambi Buttons     Jessica Nova   Dathomir Witches
  Alice Malice   Kearstin   She Hulk and Red She Hulk
  Bambi Buttons   Jessica Nova   Licorice Dust and Boo Kitty
  Bambi Buttons   Jessica Nova   Pokemon!
  Alice Malice   Jessica Nova   Wicked Lady and Mistress 9
  Kearstin   Jessica Nova     Wilma and Betty
  Kalika   Maygin   Lily and Morticia
  Bambi Buttons   Solara   Chibiusa and Diana
  Bambi Buttons   Bear   Punk Chibiusa and Punk Wicked Lady
  Bambi Buttons   Jessica Nova   Huntress and Power Girl

Of course, if our supporters are generous we can add and do even more amazing things.  Every penny we receive will go right back into making GeekGoddess even better and giving our fans even more geeky goodness.  

$6,500: Shot Glasses:  All Backers $25 and Up

$7,500: Lanyards: Upgraded to Full Color

$8,500: 22nd Goddess Added

$9,000: Special Exclusive Print added for Backers over $100

$10,000: Inner Senshi Set- One Set FIVE Goddesses!!

$11,000: Everyone who donated at least $100 will receive a special exclusive image of Alice Malice, Jessica Nova and Kearstin. 

$15,000: ????

Are you looking for a custom perk?  Maybe you want to add a dice onto a Calendar.  When you select a perk you'll notice that you have the ability to add on additional funds to your donation.   While this most often gets used to add on shipping for our international backers there is no reason it can't be used to add on a little something extra.    If you are looking to add any of the following to your perk please use the price points below.

story:
Help Us Fund Our Residency at Organhaus in Chongqing, China!


Hi! We're Knox & Tonner (Bitsy Knox and Christian Tonner), a Berlin-based artist duo. We have been invited to participate in a two-month residency at Organhaus Art Centre in Chongqing, the fastest growing city in China, from early April to late May 2014. 

While there, we will research and produce a large-scale sculptural and video installation that will focus on the way rapid urban development in Chongqing and the surrounding area affects the daily lives of its inhabitants.

This project will be our most ambitious collaborative work so far, and will be exhibited in Chongqing at the end of our residency. Art centres in Canada and in Germany have also already expressed interest in showing the installation once the residency is over. 

This is also the first time either of us will go to Asia!


Our Project at Organhaus

For us, Chongqing represents a unique opportunity to explore a city that is in flux - a living example of a contemporary Industrial Revolution. 

The video and sculptures that we want to make and exhibit at Organhaus will be the result of intensive cultural research into the underlying systems and rhythms of the city and its people.

In previous work, we've focused on the way in which seemingly inconsequential daily routines and unconscious habits, from eating a sandwich on the way to work, to scratching one's head, to selling something on Ebay affect larger cultural systems. 

In Chongqing, we want to employ the same strategy by looking for key words, habits, and rituals that help to subtly inform the way in which rapid urbanisation is changing Chongqing and its people.

In other words, we want to see how big changes to a city affect little aspects of daily life, and vice versa.


Why We're Going to Chongqing

Residencies abroad are an important way for artists to explore new ways of making work, make important connections with other artists and curators, and show art in different cultural contexts. 

As artists, we feel that it is our job to research and interpret big and small changes that have an impact not only on local communities, but on the entire world. 

Chongqing's uniqueness lies in the extraordinary pace of its development over the last twenty years. We feel that it is important to continue to document and artistically investigate its changes on a human level.


What Your Donation Will Fund:

Organhaus Art Centre will generously provide us with living, studio, and a gorgeous exhibition space, as well as some organisational assistance. We are also putting our own savings toward travel to China and visa fees. Other than that, we're on our own. 

That's why we need your help with the following costs:

  • Transport within Chongqing and the surrounding area
  • Materials for our sculptures (such as wood, screws, fabric) 
  • Props and costumes for our videos 
  • Equipment rental (such as projectors and sound recorders)
  • An interpreter/translator to help us interact with the local community



Who We Are

We met during the summer of 2012, and have been working together ever since. Although we work on projects collaboratively, we also both have individual practices.


Bitsy Knox (1984, Canada)

I grew up in Vancouver Canada. I completed my BFA at Queen's University (Kingston, Canada), and my MFA at Piet Zwart Institute (Rotterdam, Holland). I have exhibited my paintings, performances, sculptures, videos, and writing at galleries, artist-run-centres, and museums in Belgium, Canada, Holland, Finland, France, Spain, and the United States. I am also a founding member of the Ister, a Brussels-based curatorial collective that supports emerging contemporary culture locally and internationally.

  


Christian Tonner (1977, Germany)

I grew up in the Germany countryside near Bielefeld. I received a degree in Industrial Design from Hochschule Für Gestaltung (Offenbach, Germany). Later, I obtained my MFA from Städelschule fur Bildende Kunst (Frankfurt, Germany). My collages, paintings, photographs, and sculptures have been exhibited all over Germany, as well as in Denmark, England, France, Switzerland, Norway, and the United States.


Where We're Going

Organhaus Art Space

Organhaus is a non-profit artist-run centre located at the 501 Art Warehouse in Chongqing, China. Part of the international contemporary art organisation Triangle Network, Organhaus exists for emerging multi-disciplinary artists to realise new works, particularly those that are focused on urban development and contemporary Chinese culture. 

In Berlin, we currently work in relatively close-quarters out of our own homes. Organhaus will provide us with generous studio space (seen below), allowing us to spread out and work on a larger scale.


Chongqing, China

Winding along the Yangtze river, Chongqing is often called the fastest developing city in China. Largely built over the last few decades, Chongqing now has a population of about 30 million people, and has become one of China's major industrial centres. It's also a city that is experiencing huge growing pains, from over-development and a housing shortage for migrant workers, to environmental damage to the neighbouring valleys and rivers. 



FAQ

Q: What happens if you surpass your funding goal?

A: If we are lucky enough to surpass our goal, any extra money will go back into the project in order to expand it further. Extra funding will allow us to pay anyone who helps us with our video or sculpture work, for example, or to start work on a publication relating to the project. 

Q: How can I keep up with your activity during your residency at Organhaus?

A: For all our backers, we will send out monthly progress reports with photos. 

Q: How can I help you spread the word about your funding campaign?

A: Why, what an excellent question! You can help spread the word by sharing this indiegogo link with your friends, family, and work colleagues over Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or via email!

story:
Ich bin Anna, 24, und darf mit einigen anderen Künstlern bei der Photo Vienna Ausstellung im MAK (14. - 18. Oktober) von einer Jury ausgewählte Arbeiten präsentieren, wobei die Ausstellungskosten selbst zu tragen sind. Dabei müsst ihr mir bitte helfen!
Ich benötige das Geld vor allem für den Ausstellungsbeitrag, und auch für die Prints meiner Fotos. Als Dankeschön bekommt ihr einen oder mehrere kleinere Fotoprints eurer Wahl (siehe Galerie). 
Es würde mir sehr viel bedeuten, wenn ihr mir eine kleine Förderung zukommen lassen könntet.


I'm Anna, 24, and will be participating in this years Photo Vienna (14th-18th of October) at the Museum of Applied Arts Vienna along with other artists. However the fee for the exhibition space and the costs for the enlarged photo prints are a real challenge for me. Supporters can be rewarded with a small print of the exhibited photos (view gallery). I would be dearly grateful for your help!
